loans.name: Sylver

texts.en:
Sylver is 31 years old and married, with two children who are between 3 and 7 years old.  Sylver is in the business of transportation, which he has been doing for three years. His business is well organized.

Sylver plans to use his loan to buy another motorcycle and material for a motorcycle. He hopes to make enough profit to renovate his house and to save money for his family.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle and material for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Purity Wamuyu

texts.en: Purity has practised agriculture in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. She is 59 years old, married to Stephen Gionga, and they have three children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Purity hopes to practise large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bernard Wekesa

texts.en:
Benard Wekesa M. is 31 years old and is married to Brigid Naliaka. They have four children. His wife runs a grocery store, while Benard is a tailor in Soy Sambu in Kitale town. He has been in this business for seven years now and makes a monthly income of KES.12,000.


This will be Bernard's first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the entire loan to buy material for making clothes. With the income he is going to get he plans to expand his business by buying various tailoring equipment. 

In the future Benard hopes to grow his business and to educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy material for making clothes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 42 years old and married.  He does photography to earn a living.  He was previously employed and went into business on his own so as to earn a better income.  He has been in the business for twelve years.  He has experienced a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to have a well established business in five years.  He has requested for 50,000kes to buy a digital camera.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 30 years old and married.  He has two children between the ages 3 and 8 years old. His wife is a teacher. He owns a clean and well-organized animal sales business. He has been in this business for three years and is open from as early as 6am until 6pm in the evening. He employs two people.

Vincent will use the loan to purchase more chickens and rabbits to sell. He would like to continue to expand and will use any profits he makes for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and rabbits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: George Njoroge

texts.en:
George has practised farming in Naivasha town for the past two years. He is 55 years old and is married to Lucy Njeri. They have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan from KADET. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, George hopes to grow his business and to practise large scale dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en:
Godelive is 30 years old and is married, with two children between the ages of 1 and 2 years.  Godelive is known for selling a variety of clothes, mainly women's and men's clothes.  This is her third successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 6am until 6pm every day.  She employs two people in her business.

Godelive has now requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her business by adding a variety of styles, such as women's shirts and some other attractive styles. With this additional business, Godelive will hopefully earn more profit than previously. One portion of the profit will be used to build a secure future for her future family. The other portion of her profit will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sales.

loans.name: Samuel Wanyoike

texts.en:
Samuel has been distributing water in Naivasha town for the past three years. He is 27 years old and is married to Veronicah Nyambura.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy three donkeys to push his other water distribution cart.

In the future, Samuel hopes to own more donkeys to enable him to distribute water to the entire Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy three donkeys to push his water distribution cart

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 57 years old, married and blessed with five children.  He has been running a cafeteria for fourteen years.  He is able to provide for his family, including educating his three children, with the income he gets from his business.  He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for funding him because he has managed to buy a piece of land and educate his children.  He hopes to open a hotel in the future.  Currently, he needs 50,000Kes to buy ingredients such as baking flour, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as baking flour, cooking fat and charcoal

loans.name: C1907 Abagamijiterambere Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old. She is the president of a group called 'Abagamijiterambere'. She is wearing the red shirt on the left side, the second person, first row. Agnes owns a little shop. She sells variety products such as rice, sugar, bread, cooking oil, etc. She has been in this business for about three years; the shop is open from 5am until 9pm every day. She currently employs ten people.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase more products to sell. She plans to save in the future and continue to invest in the business.

"Abagamijiterambere" is a group of eight people, three men and five women. Agnes and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 44 years old and married with six children between the ages 2 and 20 years old. She has small, well organized shop with clean shoes. She employs two people in her business. It is open every day of the week from 6am until 6pm. She has two years' experience in her business.

Rachel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business and purchase more shoes to sell. With her profit, Rachel will build her house.

loans.use: To expand her business and purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Ben Ochieng

texts.en:
Ben has operated his motorcycle business in Naivasha town for the past two years. He is 27 years old and is married to Pauline Shirago. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to set up a shop from where he will be selling eggs.

The anticipated income will be ploughed back into the business. In the future he wants to grow his business and to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: To set up a shop to sell eggs.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 33 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 7 years old. Her business is well organized. She has two people to help her, and her business is open from 6am until 8pm every day.

Clarisse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products like salt, sugar, rice and so on. With profits from this loan, Clarisse hopes to build a building for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Anne Nang'eri

texts.en: Anne Nang'eri E. is a lady of 35 years, widowed and the mother of three children. They live in Lodwar and she has been running a boutique in town for six years now. Her monthly income is 10,300 Kenyan shillings. This will be Anne's first loan from KADET. She plans to use the entire loan to buy new clothes to sell. With additional income, she will open a bigger shop. In the future, Anne wants to save and buy a lorry and venture into the transport business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 29 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 5 years old. His business is well organized and is open from 6 am until 9 pm every day. He employs two people to help him. He has two years' experience.

Theoneste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sugar, rice, and bread. With this loan, Theoneste will expand his business by buying more producst to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, and bread

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been operating a greengrocer shop for two years.  She also does dairy farming to supplement her income.  She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could save her money and access loans easily.  She has requested 20,000 Kes from Faulu Kenya which she will use to buy vegetables, mangoes, and bananas.  She hopes to expand her business and sell wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, mangoes and bananas

loans.name: Elizabeth Mercedes

texts.es: Elizabeth Mercedes, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad. La señora  tiene su negocio que es la venta de productos plásticos, localizada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende vasos, cucharas, platos, bolsas entre otros. Hace más de dos años que se dedica a este negocio, el cual inicio como una alternativa,  debido a que tenía a sus hijos que alimentar, por lo que se armó de valor y decidió establecerlo. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de productos plásticos. El deseo por el momento es trabajar duro para capitalizar el negocio, de tal forma que pueda en un futuro realizar mejoras a su casita, y brindarles mayores comodidades a sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Elizabeth Mercedes is a mother of two young children. Located in her house, the Señora has a business of selling plastic products. She sells cups, spoons, plates and bags among other things. For more than two years she has been dedicated to this business, it began because she had children to feed so she summoned the courage and decided to esablish this business. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of plastic products. Her wish for the moment is to work hard to make the business profitable so that she can make improvements to her house one day and to provide more comfort to her children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare the land for planting wheat

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while two are adults. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years, selling in a shop to her neighbours. Dama faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mary Jeptanui

texts.en:
Mary Jeptanui S. is 40 years old and is married to Charles S.. They have seven children and live in Moi's bridge in the outskirts of Kitale. Mary does dairy farming in the same area and also sells milk. She has been in this business for ten years now and makes a monthly income of KES.15,000.


This will be Mary's third loan from KADET LTD. She has paid all her previous loans well and in good time. With this loan she is going to buy a dairy cow. She will use the income she is going to get to expand her business. 


In the future, Mary wants to be a large scale dairy farmer and to educate her children in good schools.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still young for school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Furaha faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a stall in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn, wood, and bags

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 37 years old, married and has three children.  She sells clothes to earn a living.  She was previously operating a retail shop.  She has managed to grow her business with the support of Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to provide quality education to her children in the future.  She dreams of expanding her business in five years.  With 20,000 Kes, she will add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 34 years old and married with three children.  She supplies newspapers so as to earn a living.  She has engaged in the business for six years.  In her business, she has employed one person.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to improve her business.  She hopes to supply the newspapers wholesale in the future.  She has requested 80,000 Kes to add to her stock of newspapers.

loans.use: To buy newspapers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a food selling business for the past one year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She hopes to expand her food stall in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and cooking oil

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 35 years old, married with three children.  He has a matatu (van) transport business, which he has been running for 11 years.  He has three employees helping him with the business.  Through Faulu Kenya, Benard has gained business management skills which have helped him to improve his business.  He dreams of owning a transport company in the future.  He has requested for 40,000 Kes to repair and paint his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair and paint his van

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her bigest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a cereals selling business for the past two years.  She runs a shop and sells to her neighbors and passersby. Jane faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she will purchase beans and maize for sale. She decided to join Yehu, to access loans which will improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a food selling business for the past two years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Sophia faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to open more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of Kikoi’s for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Kikoi’s for sale.

loans.name: Ollin Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Ollin" este grupo se formo en San Juan Coajomulco, Jocotitlan, esta formado por 10 mujures exitosas, son muy trabajadores y unidas se apoyan mucho, tambien se conocen desde hace muchos años por eso fue que se animaron hacer un grupo al que llamaron "Ollin", desidieron ponerse asi porque tiene un significado que esta en Nahualt, la palabra significa movimiento, y para ellas es un movimiento el que hacen un cambio para tener una mejora en este caso una mejora economica atraves del prestamo, la comunidad donde vive el grupo esta lleno de alfareros, agricultores y profesionistas, hay poco comercio dentro de esta comunidad, los nombres de las 10 mujeres que integran el grupo son los siguientes:
1.-Maura H. T.
2.-Antonia L. A.
3.-Maria Guadalupe H. H.
4.-Yazmin T. H.
5.-Alma Aurea A. G.
6.-Reyna H. G.
7.-Ma Francisca H. S.
8.-Maria de Lourdes G. G.
9.-Angela G. G.
10.-Marisol H. G.
Estos son los nombres de las mujeres que integran el grupo, cabe mencionar que hay mujeres de este grupo como doña Angela, Alma y Reyna que pertenecen a un grupo de danzantes aztecas, las señoras junto con otras personas son danzantes y tocan los tambores y hacen varios tipos de rituales en sus danzas. la Señora Angela es la encargada del grupo vive ahi en San Juan Coajomulco, tiene 47 años y 26 años de casada, ella es artesana y tambien es danzante azteca, tiene 3 hijos pero solo dos hijos dependen de ella, una hija la mayor ya es casada y los otros dos hijos estan estudiando la universidad en lenguas indigenas, vive en casa propia donde tambien es el lugar donde fabrica las artesanias, por ejemplo fabrica pulceras echas de maderas anillos, collares y aretes, el material que usa para fabricar son semillas, hilos, cuancas, madera etc. La señora Angela sale a vender por ejemplo en las ferias i de ves en cuando acomoda un puesto para vender, pero regularmente lo hace cuando sale a danzar en el centro y con la gente que se junta le ofrece lo que hace, lo dificil en su actividad es que a la gente le guste que le agrade el producto para que lo compre, el prestamo le va ayudar a doña Angela porque nos comenta que le da una fuente de ingresos para tener mas ganancias, la meta que tiene es llegas a tener un local y vender lo que hago como tambien ahi mismo en el local fabricar los aretes y demas. Con las ganancias quiere poder seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos para que no se salgan de la escuela y la terminen.
Doña Angela tambien es empleada domestica de esta forma es como ayuda a su esposo y asus hijos para salir adelante y los motiva para seguir echandole ganas.
texts.en:
The following group is called “Ollin.”  It was formed in San Juan Coajomulco, Jocotitlan.  It’s made up of ten successful, very hard working, unified, mutually supportive women.  They have also known each other for several years and that’s why they were motivated to form a group that they called “Ollin.” They decided to call it that because in Nahuatl that word means “movement” and for them this is a movement toward improvement each one makes, in this case an economic improvement through the loan.  The community where this group lives is full of potters, farmers and professionals.  There is very little commerce within this community.  The names of the ten women who make up the group are as follows:

1.-Maura Hernández T.
2.-Antonia López Álvarez
3.-Maria Guadalupe Hernández Hernández
4.-Yazmin T. Hernández
5.-Alma Aurea Álvarez García
6.-Reyna Hernández González
7.-Ma Francisca Hernández S.
8.-Maria de Lourdes García García
9.-Angela García García
10.-Marisol Hernández González

These are the names of the women who make up the group.  It’s worth mentioning that there are women in the group, like Angela, Alma and Reyna, who belong to an Aztec dance troupe.  They, together with other women, are dancers and drummers and perform various rituals dances.

Angela is the group leader.  She lives there in San Juan Coajomulco.  She’s 47 years old and has been married 26 years.  She is an artisan and also an Aztec dancer.  She has three children but only two of them still depend on her; her oldest daughter is already married and the other two are studying Indigenous Languages at the university.  She lives in her own house where she also manufactures the crafts.  For example, she makes wood bracelets, rings, necklaces and earrings.  The materials she uses to make them are seeds, thread, beads, wood, etc.

Angela goes out to sell them at farmers’ markets, for example, and sometimes is able to set up a stand to sell but she usually does it when she dances downtown and she offers her wares to the people who gather round.  The difficult part of what she does is that the people like the products she makes so that they will buy them.

The loan will help Angela because she tells us that it provides a source of income to have more profits.  Her goal is to have a locale to sell what she makes as well as being able to manufacture the earrings and all else there.  With the profits she wants to continue providing schooling for her children so that they won’t drop out of school and finish it.

Angela is also a domestic employee and this is how she helps her husband and her children get ahead and she motivates them to continue making an effort.

loans.use: To make bracelets, rings, necklaces, etc.

loans.name: Kayissan Dalou

texts.fr: Madame Dalou est née à Lomé   et habite Agodeka.  Elle est née en   1970 et  est mère  de  2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois.  Elle  s’approvisionne  à Tsévié et  Amakpapé  et  a débuté son activité  en  2006.  Elle revend  ces marchandises à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite un prêt  pour  acheter  50 sacs de  charbons.
texts.en: Mrs. Dalou was born in Lomé and lives in Agodeka.  She was born in 1970 and is the mother of 2 children.  She is a reseller of charcoal.  She stocks up in Tsévié and Amakpapé and started her business in 2006.  She resells these goods in front of her house.  She is asking for a loan to buy 50 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: C2912 Tuzamuke Group

texts.en:
Dancille is 49 years old and is married. Dancille's business is well organized. Her business is open from 6:00 am until 8:30 pm. This is her third year of successful business operation. 

Dancille is the group leader of the group called Tuzamuke in the local language. Dancille is the person on the right side in the photo. The group includes five members, each one has her own business. 

Dancille and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses so that they can offer good service to their customers. This loan will impact the group members by helping them purchase larger quantities of products, which will allow them to earn more profits. Dancille and her group hope to save the extra money and reinvest it in their businesses.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Komi  Delali

texts.fr: Monsieur  Komi est âgé de 32 ans.  Il habite quartier  Adidoadin.  IL vent les Epices en gros. Il compte  3 ans dans cette  activité et revend les épices au grand marché de  Lomé.   Il demande un prêt  pour acheter  50 cartons d’épices pour pouvoir répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Mr. Komi is 32 years old. He lives in the Adidoadin area. He sells spices in bulk.  He has been in this business for 3 years and resells the spices at the main market in Lomé.  He is asking for a loan to buy 50 cartons of spices so that he can respond to never-ending growing demand.

loans.use: Purchase of spices

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 50 years old and is married.  He has ten children aged between 1 and 25 years old.  He takes care of two children aged between 2.5 and 6 years old.  

Faustin has a cow trading business. He has been in this business for about four years.   His working hours are from 7am until 5pm every day. His business is well-organized and he employs two people to help him.

Faustin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through adding more cows to sell.

With this loan, Faustin has a vision of growing his business to the extent where he can even start wholesaling.  If he starts wholesaling, he hopes to earn more profits than before,  which in turn will be used for further reinvestment in his business. He will then also be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To expand his farm

loans.name: Pentecostes Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Pentecostés se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlalnepantla, en el estado de Morelos, México. está conformado por 6 integrantes que son vecinos y conocidos ellos son la señora Antonia A. T. va a comprar con su crédito abono orgánico, fertilizantes químicos para abonar su nopal, la señora Lilia O. F. va a comprar mercancía para surtir su negocio azúcar, huevo por kilo, refrescos, galletas, queso, la señora Aurelia F. Z. va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su nopal, el señor Alberto M. P. va a comprar abono para fertilizar su nopal y tener más producción, la señora Brizaida F. Rodríguez va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su nopal y tener más producción, la señora Irma L. C. va a comprar fertilizantes y abono orgánico para producir su nopal. La señora Lilia O. F. es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 39 años de edad estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos Ernesto David tiene 8 años de edad y estudia el 3er. año de primaria, Deiry Mariana tiene 9 años de edad y estudia el 4º. Año de primaria, la señora Lilia tiene su tienda de abarrotes y solicito su crédito para surtir su tienda de abarrotes va a comprar café, dulces, huevo, azúcar, refrescos, jugos, galletas, queso, yogurt, crema, papel higiénico, etc. Su negocio lo inicio hace 4 años, como su hermano tiene una tiendita él le prestó y la llevo a la central a comprar mercancía lo más básico, poco a poco fue creciendo a base de préstamos. Su negocio es importante porque de allí va saliendo para los alimentos de sus niños y para ir progresando, la parte favorita de este negocio es atender a sus clientes amablemente y se siente orgullosa de haber logrado este negocio. Al principio pensó que no iba a poder pero si lo consiguió, ella recuerda cuando repellaron el negocio y le pusieron loseta al piso porque se ve más bonito el negocio, sus clientes son las señoras y los niños, su negocio es popular por el buen trato a los clientes, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son los costos elevados, pues el negocio está arriba de un cerro y como suben las cosas traen menos mercancía. Las ganancias del negocio las vuelve a invertir, otra parte para la alimentación y para pequeños gastos. La señora Lilia quiere ampliar su negocio le gustaría vender otras cosas como: artículos de papelería, focos, sockets, accesorios de electricidad y lo piensa lograr con otros prestamos que le proporcionen Kiva y Fundación Realidad, le ayudan en la tienda su hija atiende a los clientes despacha, su hijo mete refrescos al refrigerador. Tlalnepantla es un lugar bonito, tranquilo, el paisaje hay montes, muchos árboles, los cerros, se ve el volcán Popocatepec e Iztlacihuath. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia en la alimentación, su esposo ha hecho más amplia la casa y a tener su carro, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son echarle colado a la salita y repellarla y construir una cisterna, sus sueños y esperanzas son hacer crecer más su tiendita, vivir mejor que no suframos y que haya para la vejez, ella está feliz con este préstamo porque en base a esto va a aumentar su negocio lo va a surtir, las mejoras que desea lograr par el futuro se sus hijos son que sigan estudiando y que alcancen una carrera para el futuro y vivan bien contentos en armonía y lo piensa lograr aumentando las ganancias y seguirles dando estudio. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por los prestamos que nos hacen gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante”.
texts.en:
This community bank is called Pentecostés and is located in the community of Tlalnepantla, in Morelos state in Mexico. It is made up of six members who are neighbors and acquaintances: Señora Antonia A. T. who is going to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to fertilize her nopal (prickly pear cactus); Señora Lilia O. F. who is going to buy goods for her business, including sugar, eggs by the kilo, sodas, cookies and cheese; Señora Aurelia F. Z. who is going to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her nopal; Señor Alberto M. P. who is going to buy compost to fertilize his nopal so that it produces more; Señora Brizaida F. Rodríguez who is going to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her nopal in order to increase its produce; and Señora Irma L. C. who will buy fertilizer and organic compost for her nopal. 

Señora Lilia O. F. is the group's representative. She is 39 years old and she graduated third year of secondary school. She is married and has two children: Ernesto David who is eight years old and is in the third year of primary school, and Deiry Mariana who is nine years old and in the fourth year. 

Señora Lilia has a grocery store and is requesting a loan to stock up her store. She is going to buy coffee, candy, eggs, sugar, soft drinks, juices, cookies, cheese, yogurt, cream, toilet paper, etc. She started her business four years ago. Her brother had a small store, so he lent it to her and took her to the market to buy basic goods. Bit by bit, the business has grown through loans. 

Her business is important to her because it provides food for her children and allows them to get on in life. Her favorite part of the business is providing pleasant service to her customers and she is proud to have made this business successful. At first she didn't think she would be able to do it, but she did it. She remembers when they plastered the walls and tiled the floor to make the store look better. Her clientele consists of women and children, and her business is popular due to the good treatment received by customers. The challenges facing the business are high costs, and when costs are high she has less stock. She uses any profit to reinvest in the business and to buy food and pay other small expenses. 

Señora Lilia wants to expand her business to sell other goods such as stationery, light bulbs and electrical accessories, and she intends to achieve this with loans from Kiva  and Fundación Realidadand (Kiva Field Partner). Her children help out in the store: her daughter serves customers and her puts the soft drinks in the refrigerator. Tlalnepantla is a nice quiet place. The landscape has many trees and hills, and you can see the Popocatepetl and Iztlaccihuatl volcanos. 

Her business has helped feed her family. Her husband has extended the house and they have a car. She would like to make improvements to the house such as plastering the living room and building a well. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her store, improve her standard of living and save for her old age. She is happy with this loan because it will allow her to increase her business and buy more stock. For her children's future, she hopes that they continue their studies and have a career, and that they live happily and in harmony. She intends to achieve this by increasing her profits and continuing to pay for their studies. 

Members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you very much for the loans you provide us with. Thanks to you, we can move forward."

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar, soft drinks, coffee, candies, juices, cookies, cheese, yogurt, cream and toilet paper

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 12.  Emmanuel sells spare parts for cars and owns a spacious shop, which he has had for 1.5 years.  Emmanuel currently employs one person in his store.

Emmanuel will use this loan to purchase more car spare parts to sell.  If he is successful and earns a profit from the loan, he plans to reinvest it back into his business and hopes to keep making it grow.

loans.use: To purchase more car spare parts to sell

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Madame  Fati a 30 ans et mère  de  2 enfants. Elle  est mariée et habite quartier  Baguida.  Elle est revendeuse de fruits au marché de  Baguida.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché de Lomé et compte dans cette activité  6 ans déjà. Elle sollicite un prêt  pour acheter  3 paniers d’ananas,  4 paniers de mangue et 2 paniers de banane.
texts.en: Ms. K. is 30 years old and the mother of two children.  She is married and lives in the Baguida district. She sells fruit at the  Baguida market. She has been in this business for 6 years and gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market. She is requesting a loan to buy 3 baskets of pineapples, 4 baskets of mangos and 2 baskets of bananas.

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 33 years old, married, and has three children between 5 and 10 years old. Francoise's husband is a taxi driver.  Francoise works hard in order to provide everything necessary for her family. 

Francoise owns a small business selling various products in the market such as sugar, coking oil, flour and tomato sauce. Her business is well-organized.  She has five years of experience and employs one person from her community. The hours of her store are from 8am to 6pm every day except on Saturday.

Francoise has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more products for her store. Francoise hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to renovate her house.

loans.use: To expand store

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida is 38 years old.  She sells bags in the Nyabugogo district of Kigali, Rwanda's capital city.  She runs a well-organized store, which she has had for 5 years.  Currently she employs one other person to help her in the business.

Zaida plans to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing more bags to sell.  In the future, if she makes a profit, Zaida dreams of opening a similar business in another part of Kigali.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 42, widowed, and does not have any children. She sells charcoal in Gikondo and has a well-organized shop. Pelagie has owned this business for a year, and manages two employees. Pelagie works from 7AM until 7PM every day of the week. 

This is Pelagie's first loan, and she intends to use it to buy additional stocks of charcoal. If she realizes additional profits after this loan, Pelagie intends to put the money toward buying a bigger, more expensive house.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Jenifa is a happy, 32-year-old single woman. She sells shoes and bags in her spacious store which she has been running for 13 years. Currently, she employs one other person to help her in the store.

Jenifa plans to use her loan to purchase a large stock of shoes and bags. If she is successful in earning profits from the use of this loan, Jenifa will continue to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 40 years old, married, with two children; ages 10 and 17. She sells motorcycle spare parts. Jane has been in the business for two years. She left employment and started her own business so as to earn better income. She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has managed to improve her business and pay school fees for her children. Jane dreams of importing motorcycle spare parts in the future. She has requested 75,000 KES to add stock of spare parts.

loans.use: To add stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es: Uriel tiene 28 años, vive en la propiedad de sus padres y en compañía de ellos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas ayudando a sus padres a cultivar y cuidar las plantaciones, en la actualidad tiene sus terrenos de cultivos heredados y de las cuales administra en ella los cultivos que le son rentables. Su trabajo comienza todos los días en horas de la madrugada ya que siempre verifica el estado de sus plantaciones, cultiva principalmente la papa y también maíz, habas, arveja zanahoria entre otros productos, que luego de ser cosechados los lleva a vender directamente al mercado mayorista de la ciudad mas cercana a su localidad. Siempre recibe la ayuda de sus progenitores así como también contrata mano de obra de peones. Durante este tiempo ha visto que mejorará un poco más sus ganancias por lo que lo anima a continuar adelante en la actividad agrícola. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para su campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Uriel, 28, lives on his parents’ property with them.  Since childhood he has worked in agriculture helping his parents care for their crops.  He currently has his own fields that he inherited and administers.  His crops are profitable.

His day starts at dawn when he goes out to check on the state of his plants.  He grows mainly potatoes but also corn, lima beans, peas and carrots, among others, which are harvested and sold directly at the wholesale market in the city nearest his location.  He always gets help from his parents as well as from hired helpers.  During this time he has noticed that his profits will be a bit improved which encourages him to continue forward with farming.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support and he enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive, people.

He thanks all those people who will fund the loan he’s requesting which will be very useful for his activity’s progress.  He will use the requested funds to buy manure for the next planting season.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
"SANTA CATARINA" Este grupo esta conformado por 10 mujeres indigenas D. la poblacion D. Santa Catarina Mechoacan, Oaxaca, Mexico. Denominada Santa Catarina por la Virgen Santa Catarina ya que es la patrona D. la población. Mich-huacán: significa “Lugar D. Pescadores”; su etimología Michin = Pescado, hua = posesivo, Can = Lugar.  En mixteco se llama Nutiaca, que quiere decir “Pueblo D. Pescadores”; etimología Ñuhu = Pueblo, Tiaca = Pescado. Este grupo esta conformado por mujeres D. raza indigena muy trabajadoras. 
La representante D. este grupo es la señora Raquel C. H. D. 25 años D. edad casada con el señor Geraldo H. D. oficio campesino se dedica a la siembra D. maiz, frijol, etc; ambos tiene 3 hijos D. 6, 4 y 2 años, dos estudian el preescolar. La señorA Raquel se dedica a la venta D. calzado por catalago, D. igual manera venD. vestidos y bolsas.
Otra integrante D. este grupo es la señora Maria G. L. D. raza indigena D. 33 años D. edad esta casada con el señor Fabian H. quien se dedica  a la Agricultura el siembra maiz, frijol, calabaza, ajonjolí, jicama, etc; ambos tienen 3 hijos D. 9, 6 y 5 años D. edad los tres estudian.
La señora Maria se dedica a la elaboracion D. totopos (tortillas tostadas) hace D. diferentes tamaños: pequeños, medianos y grandes; los cuales pueden ser salados, simples y dulces con ajonjoli; ella aprendio a realizarlos ya que su mamá le enseño desD. pequeña y se ah venido heredando D. generacion en generacion, la señora Maria tiene que salir a la comunidad D. Jamiltepec que esta a 20 minutos D. su localidad para realizar sus ventas, ahi dias en que si se le termina pero ahi ocasiones en que le sobra un poco D. sus productos; D. igual manera en su casa venD., ahi ocasiones en que les llegan a ser pedidos D. otras comunidades.
La señora Maria solicito el prestamo para poder comprar los insumos que necesita para la venta D. sus productos.
Las ganancias que recibe D. la venta D. sus productos los utiliza para su familia en especial para sus hijos que estan estudiando ya que ella quiere que sus hijos estudien y tengan una carrera. Ella quisiera engrandecer  tener un local y poder vender otros productos aparte D. los totopos.
La integrantes D. este grupo agradecen a la fundacion y a todas las personas que hacen posible la realizacion D. los prestamos.
las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Alejandria L. G.: D. 56 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos y tostadas.
Cecilia Vasquez Hernnadez: D. 57 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la venta D. tostadas.
Leticia C. H.: D. 34 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la elaboracion D. tostadas para la venta.
Tomasa V. L.: D. 35 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. pollo y compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Cristina Q. Q.: D. 67 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Teresa S. O.: D. 34 años D. edad se dedica  a  la compra D. insumos para la elaboracion D. tostadas para la venta.
Maria G. L.: D. 33 años D. edad se dedica a la elaboracion D. tostadas para la venta.
Raquel C. H.: D. 25 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. zapatos para la venta.
Zoila S. D. O.: D. 55 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. hilos para la elaboracion D. servilletas para la venta.
Rosa Guadalupe H. R.: D. 50 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
texts.en:
"SANTA CATARINA” 

This group is maD. up of 10 indigenous women from Santa Catarina Mechoacan, Oaxaca, Mexico.  It’s called Santa Catarina after the Virgin of Santa Catarina who is the town’s patron saint.  Mich-huacán means: “Place of Fishermen.”  Its etymology: Michin=Fish, hua=possessive, Can=Place.  In Mixteco, it’s called Nutiaca, which means “Town of Fishermen;” etymology: Ñuhu=Town, Tiaca=Fish.  This group is maD. up of very hard working indigenous women.

The group’s representative is Mrs. Raquel C. Hernández, 25.  She’s married to Mr. Geraldo Hernández who is a farmer who grows corn, beans, etc.  They have three children who are 6, 4 and 2 years of age.  Two are in Preschool.  Raquel sells shoes via catalogue and also sells dresses and purses the same way.

Another group member is Mrs. María García López, 33, of indigenous race.  She is married to Mr. Fabian Hernández who is a farmer.  He grows corn, beans, squash, sesame, jicama, etc.  They have three children who are 9, 6 and 5 years of age; all three are in school.

María is a totopo maker (fried tortilla chips).  She makes different sizes: small, medium and large, which can be salted, plain or sweet with sesame.  She learned how to make them from her mother who taught her when she was a little girl and it’s been passed down from generation to generation.
María has to go out to the community of Jamiltepec which is 20 minutes away from her location to do her sales.  Some days she sells out everything but sometimes some of her product is left over.  She also sells from home and occasionally she gets orders from other communities.
María asked for the loan to buy ingredients she needs for the sale of her products. She uses profits from her sales for her family, especially for her children who are studying because she wants them to study and have careers.  She’d like to grow and have a locale to be able to sell other products besides totopos.

The members of this group thank the Fundación and all the people who make the loans possible.

The members of the group are as follows:

Alejandria L. G., 56, who buys ingredients for tostadas and fast food. 
Cecilia Vasquez H., 57, who buys ingredients for tostadas.
Leticia C. H., 34,  who buys ingredients for tostadas. 
Tomasa V. L., 35, who buys chicken and ingredients for fast food.
Cristina Q. Q., 67, who buys ingredients for fast food.
Teresa S. O., 34, who buys ingredients for tostadas.
Maria G. L., 33, who makes tostadas to sell.
Raquel C. H., 25, who buys shoes to sell.
Zoila S. D. O., 55, who buys thread to make napkins to sell.
Rosa Guadalupe H. R., 50, who buys ingredients for fast food.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Paraiso Perdido Group

texts.es:
Daria E. D. O., 66 años D. edad, viuda desD. hace 02 años, y con 06 hijos a su cargo. Daria es socia D. L. Ancancìa comunal "Paraiso Perdido" Ubicado en el poblado D. Izcuchaca, en el departamento D.  Huancavelica.
Hace màs D. 10 años daria venD. chicharrones D. chancho en los buses y tren que tienen como ruta las cuidades D. Huancayo - Izcuchaca - Ayacucho.
El prèstamo solicitado serà para implementar e instalar un puesto D. comida.
(En L. fotografìa, L. Señora Daria esta sentada y es L. primera D. L. derecha; esta vestida con chompa color gris)
texts.en:
66 year old Daria has been a widow for 2 years and has 6 children in her care. Daria is a member of the community bank "Paraiso Perdido", which is located in the town of Izcuchaca, in the Huancavelica department.
For more than 10 years, she has been selling chicharones D. chancho, a pork dish, to people in the buses and train that follow the route between the cities Hunacayo, Izcuchaca, and Ayacucho.
This loan will be used to set-up a food cart for this business.
(In the photo, Daria is sitting in the first row at the far right; she is wearing a grey sweater.)

loans.use: To set-up a food cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in Internet café business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in computer literacy training program

loans.name: El Cocal Group

texts.es:
La señora Efrocinia A. Pérez, vive en la Ribera el Aguacate, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Celin Pérez Juárez, en donde  procrearon  cinco hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad y son: Luis Fabián de doce años, Ignacio Eduardo de  diez, Víctor Manuel de ocho años, Fabricio Germán de seis y la más pequeña es Paola Daniela de cinco años.

         Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos de granja para luego venderlo aliñado (destazado), o en pie, en esta actividad lleva ocho meses y comenta que le va bien.
 
         Por su propia idea inicio con esta actividad ya que también quiere apoyar a su esposo con  los ingresos  de su hogar  y así sacar adelante a sus hijos.

         De las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad para que su mercancía no esté limitada y sus clientes estén satisfechos con  la atención brindada.

        Lo que más desea es que  logre tener su propia pollería, para que con ello logre ahorrar y poder darle lo mejor a sus  hijos que estudios.

       Las personas que integran el grupo son las siguientes:

       Efrocinia A. Pérez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo aliñados (destazado) o en pie.

      América Pérez E.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de  ropas para dama y caballeros.

      Lorena Juárez A.. invierte el préstamo e la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda abarrotes.
texts.en:
Efrocinia lives in Ribera el Aguacate, in the municipality of Copainala, part of Chiapas state, México. She is married to Celin, and they have 5 children in their care:12 year old Luis Fabián, 10 year old Ignacio Eduardo, 8 year old Víctor Manuel, 6 year old Fabricio Germán and the littlest, 5 year old Paula Daniela.        
She is requesting a loan to buy farm chickens and later sell them seasoned (cut up) or alive. She has been doing this for 8 months and says that it is going well.
She started this business on her own initiative as she wants to help her husband with the household income and so help her children to be successful. 
She will use the income that she gains through this work to ensure that she has sufficient supplies and that her customers are satisfied with the attention she offers.
What she most wants is to have her own store selling poultry, because that would enable her to save and give the best to her children who are in school.
The following people are members of her loan group:
Efrocinia: will use the loan to buy chickens and later sell them seasoned (cut up) or alive.
América: will use the loan to buy men's and women's clothing.
Lorena: will use the loan to buy supplies for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy chicken and later sell it seasoned (cut up) or alive.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children between 1 and 13 years old.  She also has one adopted child she cares for.  

Marie Louise has a business selling mobile phones.  She plans to use her loan to expand and purchase more mobile phones. She will use the profit she makes to continue to reinvest in growing and improving her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: El Milagro 1 Group

texts.es:
Grupo El "MILAGRO 1" se llama asi por que el grupo se formo de milagro ya que no se acompletaba el grupo invitaban a otras personas y algunas decian que si y despues que no, es por ello que al final si se acompleto. Este grupo esta formado por 10 mujeres que se dedican al comercio. Este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de Villa de Tututepec de Melchor Ocampo significa “Cerro del Pájaro”, de tototl, “pájaro” y Tepetl, “cerro” en el cual la mayoria de las personas que habitan este lugar son indigenas.
La representante de este grupo es la señora Balbina A. G. de 39 años esta casada con el señor Melquiades Lopez ambos tienen 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años los dos estudian la secundaria, la señora Balbina se dedica a la reposteria de pastel y pan.
La señora Rosa Elia G. M. de 42 años vive en union libre con el señor Armando Mata, la señora Rosa tiene 4 hijos de las respectivas edades 23, 21, 18 y 17 años los cuales estudian.
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de tortillas de mano ella elabora estos productos desde hace 30 años ya que sus mamá le enseño desde pequeña pero los vende desde hace 15años, sus ventas las realiza en su casa para que la gente valla a comprarlas los anuncian en una bocina, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus productos las da un buen precio y como son muy ricas pues la gente los compra muy bien.
Ella solicito el prestamo para poder comprar maiz, leña para la elaboracion de las tortillas y con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta es para la educacion  de sus hijos ya que ella quiere que sus hijos estudien aunque sea hasta la prepa y tengan un mejor futuro, de igual manera para poder realizar sus pagos.
Ella agradece infinitamente porque le hiiceron el prestamo que solicito y por confiar en personas humildes como ellas.
Las integrantes de este grupo son las siguientes:
Tomasa J. S.: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas y huevos.
Faustina Jovita H. X: De 79 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes para la venta.
Gloria F. H.: De 62 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos.
Maria Dolores C.: De 62 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pescado, mariscos para la venta.
Rosa Elia G. M.: De 42 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas de mano.
Balbina A. G.: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra ala reposteria de pastel y pan.
Guadalupe H. N.: De 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pan y tamales.
Jovita G. E.: De 45 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas
Eustolia B. J.: De 68 años de edad se dedica a la venta de atole y tortillas
Silvia L. H.: De 31 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales.
texts.en:
The “EL MILAGRO 1” group is called thus because it was a miracle that the group formed at all because they didn’t have enough people for the group; they’d invite others to join and they’d say yes but then change their minds and say no but it was formed at last.  The group has ten women who are merchants.  The group is located in the community of Villa de Tututepec de Melchor Ocampo.  It means “Hill of the Bird” from tototl, “bird” and tepetl “hill.”  Most of the residents of this place are indigenous.

The group representative is Mrs. Balvina A. García, 39.  She’s married to Mr. Melquiades Lopez.  They have two children who are 15 and 13 years of age.  Both go to middle school.  Balbina is a cake and bread and pastry maker.

Mrs. Rosa Elia García M., 42, is in an unmarried relationship with Mr. Armando Mata.  She has four children who are 23, 21, 18 and 17 years of age and all are studying.

Rosa sells handmade tortillas.  She’s been in this line of work for 30 years since she learned from her mother while still a little girl.  She’s been selling them for the last 15 years, though.  She sells from home and so that people will come by to buy them she advertises over a loudspeaker.  She has many customers because she sells her product at a very good price and because they are delicious so people buy them well.

She requested the loan to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.  She will use the profits obtained from the sales for her children’s education because she wants them to continue in school, at least through high school, and have a better future.  She also wants to be able to make her payments.

She is infinitely grateful because she got the loan she requested and because humble people like her are trusted.

Following are the group members:

Tomasa J. S., 39, who sells chickens and eggs.
Faustina Jovita H. X, 79, who buys groceries to sell.
Gloria F. H., 62, who sells food and beverages.
Maria Dolores C., 62, who buys fish and seafood to sell.
Rosa Elia G. M., 42, who sells handmade tortillas.
Balbina A. G., 39, who sells cakes and bread.
Guadalupe H. N., 47, who sells bread and tamales.
Jovita G. E., 45, who sells tortillas.
Eustolia B. J., 68, who sells atole and tortillas.
Silvia L. H., 31, who sells tortillas and tamales.

loans.use: To buy cake, bread and fast food making ingredients.

location.town: Villa de Melchor Ocampo, Tututepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
Grupo "MANANTIAL" este grupo esta conformado por 12 mujeres indigenas que se dedican a diferentes actividades economicas, ellas formaron este grupo ya que son vecinas D. esta comunidad. Este grupo se llama manantial por que en L. poblacion atraviesa un rio que se llama manantial lugar donD. las personas se van a bañar y a lavar ropa. Este grupo esta ubicado en L. poblacion D. Santa Catarina Mechoacan (Lugar D. pescadores) una poblacion muy hermosa como mucha flora y fauna.
L. representante D. este grupo es L. señora Isabel G. H. D. 39 años D. edad esta casada con el señor Roman G. ambos tienen 2 hijos que estudian. L. señora Isabel es L. persona que invito a las demas a formar parte D. este grupo; elL. se dedica a L. venta D. pan.
L. señora Gloria H. Q. forma tambien parte D. este grupo elL. es una señora D. 60 años D. edad muy reconocida en su localidad ya que hace unos panes muy deliciosos ya que elL. se dedica a esta actividad desD. hace mas D. veinte años, siempre tienes buenas ventas a demas D. que venD. sus productos en su localidad sale a venderlos a otras localidades. Las personas que reconocen el buen sabor D. sus productos le encargan para ocasiones especiales como son bodas, cabo D. año, etc.
ElL. pidio este prestamo para comprar mas insumos para su productos como son: manteca, harina, paneL. entre otros para que asi realize mas y tenga un poco mas D. ganancias; ya que estas las utiliza para mantener a sus dos hijos pequeños para que puedan seguir estudiando, D. igual manera para realizar sus pagos que ah adquirido del prestamo.
Las mujeres que integran este grupo son las siguientes: 
Antonia M. B.: D. 66 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. tacos dorados, quesadillas, tostadas y enchiladas.
Rosa D. L. P. B.: D. 44 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. antojitos y dulces.
Juana G. H.: D. 46 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. antojitos regionales.
Catalina Q. Cruz: D. 58 años D. edad se dedica  a L. venta D. pan.
Isabel G. H.: D. 39 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. pan.
Gloria H. Q.: D. 60 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. pan.
Cecilia L. G.: D. 43 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. tamales.
Luciana H. G.: D. 23 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. antojitos regionales.
Maria N. H.: D. 33 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. tostadas.
Zita G. M.: D. 29 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. antojitos regionales.
Clara L. H.: D. 35 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. tamales.
Elia Natalia Q. Cruz: D. 52 años D. edad se dedica a L. venta D. tostadas.
texts.en:
The group “Manantial” (Spring) consists of twelve indigenous women who engage in different business activities. They formed this group since they are all neighbors in the community. The group is named “Manantial” because there is a river of the same name where people go to bathe and wash clothes. This group is from the town of Santa Catarina Mechoacan, a place where many fishermen live and that is known for its beautiful vegetation and wildlife.

The representative of the group is Sra. Isabel G. H.. She is 39 years old, married to Sr. Roman G., and has two school age children. Sra. Isabel is the person responsible for inviting the other members to join this group. She earns her living by selling bread.

Sra. Gloria H. Q. is also a member of this group. She is 60 years old and is well-known in town for making some of the most delicious bread. Sra. Gloria has been in this business for more than twenty years. She always generates good sales because she is able to sell in other areas as well as in her own town. People are familiar with the good flavor of her products and order them for special occasions such as weddings, New Years, and other events. She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies used in making her products such as butter, flour, sugar, and other items so that she can produce more and generate slightly better earnings. This will enable her to support her two children who are continuing their education. Gloria will be able to make her loan payments as well.

Listed below are the women in this group: Antonia M. B., age 66: sells tacos, quesadillas, tostadas, and enchiladas Rosa D. L. P. B., age 44: sells snacks and sweets Juana G. H., age 46: sells regional snacks Catalina Q. Cruz, age 58: sells bread Isabel G. H., age 39: sells bread Gloria H. Q., age 60: sells bread Cecilia L. G., age 43: sells tamales Luciana H. G., age 23: sells regional snacks Maria N. H., age 33: sells tostadas Zita G. M., age 29: sells regional snacks Clara L. H., age 35: sells tamales Elia Natalia Q. Cruz, age 52: sells tostadas

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making & selling bread

loans.name: Nudjiratou

texts.fr: Madame Nudjiratou est âgée de 35 ans et  mère de 6 enfants.   Elle  est née à Sokodé  et habite Kégué.  Elle a reçu de WAGES un  crédit qu’elle a déjà remboursé. Elle fait le commerce d’igname en gros et en détail et Banane.  Elle  a  commencé en 1987 cette activité et revend  ces marchandises au marché de hedzranawoe.  Elle sollicite un prêt  pour acheter  10 tas d’igname.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nudjiratou is 35 years old and the mother of six children. She was born in Sokodé and now lives in Kégué. 

She received a previous loan from WAGES which she fully repaid. She sells yams (wholesale and retail) and bananas at the Hédzranawoé market.  She started this activity in 1987. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase 10 heaps of yams.

loans.use: Purchase of yams

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married and has a grown daughter. Mariya is a market entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. She sells women’s footwear in the central marketplace of her home town. Mariya offers a nice selection of merchandise at affordable prices. She has been working in this sphere of trade for 12 years. Her monthly income amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas. 

Mariya’s business is the main source of income for her family. This time she is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas. She is planning to use the loan to purchase assorted spring merchandise, e.g. 80 pairs of spring shoes. One of Mariya’s personal goals is to remodel her newly purchased apartment to be able to move in it. She is hoping to be able to save up and make that happen as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise to sell

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
Edwin un joven trabajador, casado, tiene su propio negocio una moto taxi, inicio con fondo propios siendo su principal fuente de ingreso, su proyecto a corto plazo es la construcción completa de su vivienda así su familia estará segura.   
Con este préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de hierro, paleta de ventanas. Para la puesta de dos venta en la parte de al frente de su casa. Obteniendo seguridad, protección y mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Edwin is a hardworking young man and is married. He has his own motorcycle taxi, a business that he started with his own money and it is his main source of income. His short-term project is to completely build his house so that his family will be safe.

With this loan, he will buy iron and window panes to install two windows in the front of his house. This way, he will have security, protection and will be more comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase materials for window installation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his wife’s fish and chicken business

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es: L. alcancía comunal “Virgen D. L. puerta” está conformada por 7 personas muy emprendedoras  y responsables. Dominga es una D. las integrantes D. este grupo, a sus 35 años D. edad, tiene cuatro hijos aun menores D. edad y es madre soltera, elL. venD. caldo D. gallina hace un año en Chosica pero D. forma ambulatoria, inició este negocio por necesidad y por mejorar su calidad D. vida ya que tiene que cumplir con el rol D. padre y madre para sus hijos. Dominga se encarga D. todos los gastos D. sus hijos y no recibe ningún tipo D. apoyo del padre D. los niños,  pero dice que seguirá adelante y desea que sus hijos sean profesionales aun que esto le cueste mucho trabajo no pierD. L. fe D. que lo lograran, elL. solicitó el préstamo para comprar los ingredientes (fideos, carne D. gallina y papas) que le hacen falta para seguir preparando  mas caldo D. gallina y seguir vendiendo, también para comprar algunas cosas que les hace falta a sus hijos. Dominga desea que su hijo se prepare para L. universidad ya que terminó L. secundaria y hará todo lo posible para que se matricule en una academia a más tardar en el mes D. mayo. En L. fotografía podemos apreciar a cinco integrantes del grupo ya que L. señora Milagros y Gudelia no pudieron asistir al desembolso por motivos D. trabajo pero se les tomó L. fotografía individualmente en el momento D. sus respectivos desembolsos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen D. L. Puerta” (Our Lady of the Door) consists of seven enterprising and responsible members. Dominga is one of the group members. She is 35 years old and a single mother of four dependent children. For the past year, Dominga has been selling chicken soup in Chosica as a street vendor. She started this business out of necessity because she wanted to improve her quality of life since she must be both father and mother to her children. Dominga is responsible for all of her children’s expenses and does not receive any assistance from their father. However, she says that she presses forward because she wants them to become professionals. Dominga continues to work hard and not lose faith in order to achieve her goals.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients (such as noodles, chicken, and potatoes) that she lacks so that she can continue preparing more chicken soup to sell. Also, she will buy a few things that her children are lacking. Dominga wants to prepare one of her children for university since he has already finished high school. She will do everything possible to make sure that he is enrolled no later than May.

The main photograph shows five members of the group since Sra. Milagros and Sra. Gudelia were not able to attend the disbursement meeting. Their photos were taken separately at the time of their respective disbursements.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, noodles, and potatoes for making chicken soup

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 51 years old and widowed with three children. In the past twenty years, Charlotte has been selling clothes to earn a living. She also owns rental houses. In addition, she does tailoring so as to earn extra income. She was previously running a retail shop for a living. Charlotte is a focused lady who hopes to open a boutique in the future. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, Charlotte has benefited because she saves her money on a weekly basis. She can also access loans easily. Hence, she has requested for 60,000 KES to buy more clothes and fabric.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and fabric

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Dame Enyonam  est  âgée de 51 ans et mariée. Pour arriver à participer  au foyer,  elle fait le commerce  de charbons de bois.  Elle s’approvisionne  au Nord du Togo à Bassar et revend à la devanture de sa  maison. Elle a commencé son activité en 2007 et réside quartier hedzranawoe.  Elle demande  un prêt  pour  acheter  25 nouveaux sacs  de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Enyonam H. is 51 years old and married. She sells charcoal to help with the household expenses.  She gets her supplies in Bassar, in northern Togo, and sells them in front of her house. She started her business in 2007 and lives in the Hédzranawoé district. She is requesting a loan to buy 25 new bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: El Principio Group

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo Pérez Sánchez, vive en la Ribera Guadalupe Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casado con la señora  María de Lourdes Palacios Marín con quien procreo ocho hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Riki y Maricel de quince años, Cristian Leobardo de doce años, Elver Elaine de once, Viviana de Jesús de nueve, Nelsin Yahir de ocho años, Alex Rubín de cinco años y la más pequeña es Candi del Rosario.

     El préstamo  que ha estado solicitando lo utiliza para comprar mazeca (maíz preparado para hacer tortilla) y luego venderlo en la comunidad, ya que donde él vive esta retirado, para irse a la tienda,  en esta pequeña actividad lleva cuatro meses y comenta que le va bien  ya que le está dando buenos resultados.

    Para comenzar a trabajar  le dio animo su hermano el señor Bernal quien es el representante del grupo a que juntos formaran un grupo  para solicitar un préstamo  y que mejor invertirlo en un negocio que le diera resultado y fue así como decido poner esta actividad.

    De la ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad, para que de ello logre solventar sus gastos que se generan dentro de su familia de la que está muy orgulloso.

    El grupo se llama el principio la razón del nombre es porque es la primera vez que trabajan con  un préstamo otorgado por el programa de fundación realidad.

    El grupo se integra de tres personas una mujer y dos hombres y son los siguientes:

    Gerardo Pérez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de productos agrícolas y éste préstamo lo utilizará en mazeca

    Bernal Pérez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de madera para su carpintería y también pagar el personal que trabaja con él.

    Marisol C. Arévalo: ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de refresco para luego venderlo en la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Gerardo Pérez Sánchez lives in the Ribera Guadalupe town of Coapilla in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. He is married to Sra. María de Lourdes Palacios Marín, the mother of their eight children for whom he is responsible: Riki and Maricel (age 15), Cristian Leobardo (age 12), Elver Elaine (age 11), Viviana de Jesús (age 9), Nelsin Yahir (age 8), Alex Rubin (age 5), and the youngest Candi del Rosario.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy “maseca” (cornmeal used for making tortillas) that he will later sell in the community. Even though he is retired, Gerardo opened a small store four months ago. He says he is doing well due to the good results he has achieved.

In order to begin working, Gerardo convinced his brother Sr. Bernal, who serves as the representative, to form a group for the purpose of requesting a loan since this was the best way to invest in a business that could generate good results. This is how he came to the decision to start a business.

By investing in a business, Gerardo is able to earn money to meet his expenses, which makes his family very proud.

The group is called “El Principio” (The Beginning) because this is the first time they have worked to receive a loan through the program offered by Fundación Realidad. There are three members, one woman and two men. They are listed below:

1. Gerardo Pérez Sánchez will invest his loan in the purchase of farming products and the production of cornmeal. 2. Bernal Pérez Sánchez will invest his loan in the purchase of wood for his carpentry shop and also to pay the wages of an employee who works for him. 3. Marisol C. Arévalo will invest her loan in the purchase of soft drinks that she will sell in the community.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making & selling cornmeal

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 45 years old and a single-mother of one. For a living, she sells fruit. Mercy has been in the business for about eleven years. She was previously employed in a petrol station. She opted to go into business so as to meet her needs comfortably. Through Faulu Kenya, Mercy has managed to educate her daughter and improve her business. She hopes to relocate her business to the town centre in the future. With 40,000 KES, she will buy mangoes, avocados and watermelons.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, avocados and watermelons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jhon Henrri

texts.es: Jhon tiene 33 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa y su menor hija de 07 años en casa de sus padres el se inicio como chofer de manera dependiente aproximadamente ocho años actualmente cuenta con mototaxi  propia en la cual trabaja de forma independiente el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para  invertir en un negocio de comida ya que su esposa tiene experiencia por haber trabajado como ayudante de cocina, se le propone el crédito por tener buenas referencias,voluntad de capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Jhon is 33 years old, married, and lives at the home of his parents with his wife and seven year old daughter. He started working as a hired driver approximately eight years ago, but he now has his own motorcycle taxi so that he can work independently.

The loan being provided will be invested in a food business since his wife has experience working as a kitchen assistant. Jhon is being recommended for this loan because he has good references as well as the willingness and capacity to make repayments.

loans.use: Invest in a food business that his wife will manage

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married with a grown daughter. She lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Lubov is retired. She used to live on her retirement fee. However, it was not sufficient for decent living, which is why Lubov launched her small business selling used clothing. She started the business 4 years ago. Presently, Lubov works in one of the local markets on weekends. She travels to neighboring towns to sell used clothing items during the week. Lubov makes about 4,000 UAH of income every month.  

Lubov invests a lot of effort in her business trying to make it efficient and profitable. She was raised as a diligent, hard worker. Therefore she can’t just be idle, but has to make the best of her resources and energy. This time Lubov is seeking an 8,500 UAH loan to purchase spring and summer merchandise at a good wholesale price. She is hoping to stock her inventory with good quality, second-hand clothing, which always sells well in smaller towns of Ukraine.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Milciades Edmundo

texts.es:
Milciades hombre trabajador, professión agricultor desde muy joven inicio con la faena de dedicarse a la agricultura, inicio por el apoyo de la reforma agraria. Planes es mejorar el servicio de agua potable y hacer trabajo de conservación de suelo. 
Con el apoyo de su esposa comercializa el producto y así incrementa su ganancia. Con el préstamo que solicitad comprara fertilizantes e insumos para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Milciades is a hard-working man.  He is a farmer who started out in this line of work when he was very young, with the support of the land reform process.  His plans are to improve his drinking water service and to preserve his soil.

With the support of his wife, Milciades sells his produce and increases his profits.  He will use the loan he is requesting to buy fertilizers and supplies so that he can continue growing in his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Luz E. Bermúdez, vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera  quienes sus hijas  ya están casadas, tiene a su responsabilidad  tres nietas que son: Alondra Patricia  de catorce años, la otra es  Rubí Fernanda  de trece años y la mas pequeña es Martha Isela de nueve años.
Ella invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes que es la actividad con la que se apoya para obtener ingresos en su hogar y de ello sacar adelante a sus nietas.
 
    Lo que lo animo a poner esta pequeña actividad fueron  sus hijas  quienes la apoyaron con unos ahorros para iniciarlo  ya que para sacar provecho de su tiempo  tenía que tener  un trabajo que le deje un poco de ganancias, para con ello lograr cubrir algunos gastos pequeños generados en su hogar.

    De las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la compra de más mercancía para que de eso mismo su actividad vaya  amentando  día a día para que mejor sea sus ganancias.

   Lo que más desea es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus tres nietas a terminar una carrera para que cada una sea dependiente de sí misma.

   En el grupo se integro por una invitación que le izo la señora Irma quien es la representante. Su grupo se llama las estrellitas la razón es porque  son cuatro señoras y un solo hombre.

    El grupo se integra de cinco personas y son las siguientes:

    Blanca Luz E. Bermúdez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes

   Irma Vázquez Vázquez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar pinol, tascalate, café molido, entre otros.

   Bertha C. Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo aliñado (destazado).

   Jorge Antonio Martínez Sarmientos: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos de rancho para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo.

   Matilde Alicia Cerón Gómez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales, para su  taller de manualidades.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Luz E. Bermúdez lives in Tecpatan in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is a single mother of daughters who are already married. She is responsible for three granddaughters: Alondra Patricia (age 14), Rubí Fernanda (age 13), and the youngest Martha Isela (age 9).

She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise to restock her grocery store. This business is the means by which she is able to generate household income to support herself and move her granddaughters forward.

Her daughters encouraged her to start this small business and provided her with some of their savings to use as seed capital. Blanca took advantage of her free time to work and earn a little bit of income which she could use to cover a few household expenses. With her earnings, she was able to invest in the purchase of merchandise. At the same time, her business grew each day and started generating more revenue. What Blanca wants most is to continue working so that her three granddaughters can get ahead and obtain their degrees. Each one is currently dependent on her.

This group was formed as a result of an invitation made by Sra. Irma, who is the representative. Her group is called “Las Estrellitas” (The Little Stars) because there are four women and only one man.

The group consists of five members who are listed below: 1. Blanca Luz E. Bermúdez will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise for her grocery store. 2. Irma Vázquez Vázquez will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients for making “pinol” (a beverage made from ground corn and cocoa), “tascalate” (a chocolate beverage), instant coffee, and other beverage mixes. 3. Bertha C. Sánchez will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens that she will butcher and dress. 4. Jorge Antonio Martínez Sarmientos will invest his loan in the purchase of chickens for fattening and eventual resale. 5. Matilde Alicia Cerón Gómez will invest her loan in the purchase of materials for her handicraft workshop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has two grown daughters. He runs a farming business in the small town of Vodyanoye. Oleg owns 8 greenhouses. He grows different vegetables, e.g. tomatoes, radish, cucumbers, for sale in the Kamenka region as well as in other regions of the Ukraine. Oleg has been working in this sphere for 17 years. He has about 180,000 Grivnyas invested in this business.  

Oleg is requesting a loan of 18,000 Grivnyas to install heating systems in his greenhouses. He is hoping to purchase natural gas boilers for each of his 8 greenhouses. One of Oleg’s long-term plans is to reconstruct his greenhouses in the future to make them taller to add extra space for bigger harvests.

loans.use: To install heating units in greenhouses

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a member of the Jawabu Njema group in Faulu, Kenya.  He runs a mobile money-transfer business.  He also loves painting and he earns extra income from it.  He really appreciates Faulu Kenya for supporting his business.  This has helped him to provide for his family and to improve his standard of living.  He is determined to open other outlets for his business in the future.  

Francis has requested a loan for 80, 000 Kes to top-up money as floating funds for his business.

loans.use: To add floating funds to money-transfer business

loans.name: Grigoryi

texts.en:
Grigoryi is married and has grown children. He is a farmer from Vodyanoye. Grigoryi grows early spring vegetables, specifically tomatoes. He owns 8 big greenhouses and plants 17,000 tall- and low-growing tomatoes. Grigoryi constructed his first greenhouse 17 years ago. He has invested about 180,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise.   

Grigoryi is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase 10 rolls of plastic film to cover the greenhouses to grow timely harvests. Grigoryi is hoping to use the film to keep his tomato plants warm, protect them from diseases and fungi, and leave them plenty of breathing room. He is planning to invest the profits generated into further development of his business, as well as help his two sons through school.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film for greenhouses

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
