Cecilia A. Z., 39 años D. edad, madre soltera, con 04 hijos.
Cecilia trabaja vendiendo por las tardes comida al paso (salchipapas, hamburguesas, cafe, etc.);esta actividad lo realiza en la puerta D. su casa.
Cecilia desD. muy joven mantiene su hogar, ya que con cuenta con la ayuda del padre D. sus hijos.
El mayor D. sus hijos trabaja en Chile, y el tercero trabaja en un restaurante y por las tardes ayuda a su mamà en el negocio.
El prèstamo otorgado lo invertirà en compra D. utensilios para mejorar su negocio.
(En la fotografìa, Cecilia esta sentada y se encuentra en el centro del grupo, ella esta vestida con una chompa D. color gris)
texts.en:
Cecilia A. Z. is 39 years old and a single mother of four children. She works in the afternoons selling fast food such as “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes), hamburgers, coffee, and other items. Cecilia operates her business from the doorstep of her house.

Ever since she was a young woman, Cecilia has maintained her household. She receives support from the father of her children. Her oldest child works in Chile, while her third child works at a restaurant and then helps her in the afternoons with running her business.

The loan that was provided will be invested in the purchase of utensils for improving her business. (In the photograph, Cecilia is seated in the middle of the group. She is wearing a gray sweater.)

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene  42 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 10 años y medio se dedica a la venta de comida que realiza en su misma casa, asimismo lo expende de manera ambulante. Cuando hay festividades en su localidad sale con su pequeña carpa a ofrecer sus platillos y cada 15 días realiza actividades como: polladas y parrilladas. En ocasiones la ayudan sus hijos pero generalmente realiza sola este negocio todos los días, por ello necesita siempre suministrarse de ingredientes básicos para la preparación de sus ricos platillos. Su negocio ha demostrado tener buenas ganancias que la satisfacen y la motivan a continuar, una de sus metas es tener un restaurante campestre. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de algunos ingredientes al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old, widowed, and lives at the home of her parents with her two children. She has been selling food from her home for 10½ years and also offers her dishes as a street vendor. Whenever there are local festivals, Sonia will set up a small tent where she sells her dishes. Every fifteen days she goes out to sell roasted chicken and grilled meats. Her children occasionally help her, but she generally works alone every day at her business. For this reason, she needs to always be stocked with basic ingredients for preparing her rich dishes. Her business has demonstrated that she is able to generate a satisfactory income, so she is motivated to continue working. One of her goals is to own a country restaurant.

This is her second loan with MFP. Sonia is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition, she is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She thanks those responsible for approving her loan request since the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of a few ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a businessman who runs a posho mill.  It has been five years since he started the business.  He runs the business with one employee.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Benson has benefited through the loans.  He has improved his business and can now provide for his family.  He dreams of opening other outlets for his business in five years.  With the 80,000 Kes loan, he will add stocks of maize for his mill.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Confort Oladogni

texts.fr: Mademoiselle confort a  45 ans  et mère d’un enfant.  Elle fait la vente de produits cosmétiques  pour  répondre  aux besoins de son enfant.   Elle a commencé son activité  en 2003 et achète les produits au grand  marché de Lomé.  Ensuite elle les revend au marché local de hedzranawoé.   Elle sollicite un crédit pour  acheter de nouveaux lots de produits.
texts.en: Ms. Confort is 45 years old and has one child. She sells cosmetic products in order to support her child. She launched this business in 2003. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé. She then resells her goods at the local market of Hedzranawoé. She is seeking a credit to buy a new supply of goods.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetic products

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Dora, resiD. en Nueva Guadalupe, departamento D. San Miguel, tiene 42 años D. edad, su familia está compuesta por: su esposo y dos hijos D. 18 y 14 años D. edad, que aun son dependientes, Ella administra una tienda donD. ofrece artículos para el hogar, lo inicio hace 10 años, trabajando D. lunes a Domingo. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, comprando mercadería como: huevos, gaseosas, aceite, pan y granos básicos. Este préstamo será un gran apoyo para doña Dora pues solamente D. esta manera ella pueD. ir aumentando el negocio. Además estará ayudando a su familia, pues garantizándoles un negocio competente.
Las aspiraciones con respecto al préstamo son realizar una buena inversión, seguir fortaleciendo el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y velar por todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Dora lives in Nueva Guadalupe in the department of San Miguel.  She is 42 years old, and her family includes her husband and two children aged 18 and 14 years, who are still dependents.  She runs a store where she offers household goods.  She started the business 10 years ago, and she works there every day. 

Now she requests a loan to invest in the business, buying merchandise such as: eggs, soft drinks, cooking oil, bread and staple grains.  This loan will be a great support for Dora, since only in this way can she expand her business.  In addition, she will be helping her family by ensuring that the business remains viable.

Her aspirations with regard to the loan are to make a good investment, to continue to strengthen the business, and to help her children with their studies and proviD. for all of their needs.

loans.use: to buy eggs, soft drinks, cooking oil, bread and staple grains

loans.name: Idekel 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Gloria pertenece al grupo Idekel 1 & 2, nombre tomado de la Biblia, ya que es un grupo formado por base cristiana, cada uno de ellos días a días realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Los Alcarrizos, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales,  o de manera ambulante. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos. 
 
Gloria posee una familia conformada por sus dos hijos  y su esposo. Sus hijos asisten a la escuela, y sus planes como familia, los lleva a trabajar y planificar un futuro mejor, donde sus hijos puedan completar su educación superior y su negocio pueda prosperar y ser un negocio familiar. 

El negocio de Gloria es la venta de calzado, lleva ya alrededor de 4 años, el cual inicio vendido zapatos por catalogo. Gloria ha tomado ya su 6to. prestamos con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en la compra de calzados para mujeres, de diferentes estilos, colores y tamaños. 

Su historia representa a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the 'Idekel 1 & 2” group.  The name is taken from the Bible since this is a group with a Christian base.  Every day, each member of the group carries out their business activities in the town of Los Alcarrizos.  Some have their own businesses established in their own homes and / or premises, while others do not sell from a fixed location.  Most of the group's members sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food and other miscellaneous products.

Gloria's family consists of her two children and her husband.  Her children go to school.  Gloria  works for her family and plans a better future where her children can complete their higher education and her business can prosper and become a family business.

Gloria's business is selling shoes and she has been in the business for around 4 years.  She started out selling shoes from a catalog.  This is Gloria's 6th loan from Esperanza Internacional and she feels very grateful because her previous loans have enabled her to make progress and invest in her business.  She will invest this new loan in buying women's shoes in different styles, colors and sizes.

Gloria's story is representative of the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (who mainly emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans.  They generally live in very poor communities.  This area, like many other poor areas in the Dominican Republic, lacks a reliable supply of drinking water and electricity.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años, es separada y  vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y desD. entonces sigue cultivando sus terrenos que ha heredado D. sus padres, lo que principalmente siembra es la papa y el maíz así como también algunas hortalizas como la cebolla, lechuga y zanahorias que después D. su cosecha lo lleva a vender a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. su zona. Sus 3 hijos la apoyan  en todo este proceso D. cultivo que requiere  fertilizar y cuidar las plantas y así se ahorra  en la mano D. obra y tener un poco más D. ganancias. La siembra en años anteriores  no le fue muy bien debido a los cambios climáticos pero a pesar D. esta dificultad  siempre tiene disponible  el alimento necesario para su familia además parte D. lo cosechado, aprovecha para preparar comidas que venD.  todas las tardes  cerca D. su casa. En adelante va a incrementar las semillas que va a sembrar. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar sacos D. abono para su campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old, separated, and lives in her own home with her three children. She has been farming since she was a young girl and continues to cultivate the land she inherited from her parents. Rosa grows mainly potatoes and corn, but she also has other crops such as onions, lettuce, and carrots. After harvesting her crops, she sells them to merchants at the different markets in the area. Her three children help with the entire farming process, including fertilizing and caring for the plants. This saves her the cost of labor so that she can keep a little more of her earnings. Her harvests in previous years have not been good due to changes in weather. Despite these difficulties, Rosa has always been able to proviD. the necessary food for her family by setting asiD. part of her harvest. She also prepares food to sell every afternoon near her home. Going forward, Rosa wants to acquire more seeds so that she can begin planting.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Rosa is very happy to know that she has financial support, so she always demonstrates responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. She also thanks everyone who approved her loan request because the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in sacks of compost for the planting season.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Ana Gricelda

texts.es:
Doña Ana, tiene 46 años de edad, vive con sus hijos de las de edades 26, 23, 18 y 16, residen en Lolotique departamento de San Miguel, doña Ana se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tortillas, este negocio fue iniciado por un familiar y que después paso a manos de doña Ana, tiene ya 4 años de existir y trabaja de lunes a domingo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para preparar las pupusas, como maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, papel y leña, estos productos son muy necesarios en el negocio, pues son los ingredientes y materiales que hacen posible la venta.
Las aspiraciones de doña Ana es seguir incrementando el negocio, para que así su familia cuente con más ingresos y puedan seguir estudiando sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 46 years old and lives with her children (ages 26, 23, 18, and 16) in Lolotique in the Department of San Miguel. She sells pupusas and tortillas. This business was started by a relative and afterwards placed in the hands of Doña Ana. Her business has been in existence for four years and she works Monday through Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making pupusas such as corn, cheese, pork, tomatoes, paper, and firewood. These products are necessary since they include ingredients and materials that make her business possible.

Doña Ana has aspirations of continuing the growth of her business so that her family can have more income and her children can move forward in their studies.

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, pork, tomatoes, paper, and firewood

loans.name: Mibame

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Mibame a 22 ans. Elle est née à Tsévié et habite quartier Hédzranawoé. Elle fait le commerce de produits d'alimtentation générale. Elle a commencé en 2008 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend les produits au marché de hédzranawoé. Elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Ms. Mibame is 22 years old. She is born in Tsévié and lives in the Hédzranawoé district. She sells general food products. She has started this business in 2008 and stocks up at the big market of Lomé. She then resells her goods at the Hédzranawoé market. She is seeking a loan in order to replenish her stock.

loans.use: Purchasing general food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying materials to repair her roof: shingles, nails, wood and paint

loans.name: Jacira

texts.es: Jacira tiene 22  años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de su madre, sus hermanos y su hijo pequeño. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y recientemente desde hace 1 año  tiene sus terrenos que ha heredado para sembrar  principalmente quinua, maíz y pastizales que le permite mejores ganancias a comparación de otros cultivos, es por eso que  diariamente por las mañanas sale a verificar sus terrenos y prevenir la plaga de insectos que pudieran afectar sus  cosechas. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su madre y en ocasiones la de sus hermanos, pero sus esfuerzos no solo quedan en las tareas agrícolas; asimismo expende comida a media mañana y a la hora de almuerzo  que es una ganancia adicional a la de su actividad agrícola. Considera que la venta de su cosecha es muy rentable sobre todo la venta de quinua, porque lo pueden adquirir a un bajo precio en el mercado de su localidad. Es por esta razón que continuará  dedicándose a sembrar estos productos en más extensiones de terreno. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Jacira is 22 years old. She lives with her with her mother, her siblings and her small child. Since she was young she has worked in agriculture. A year ago she inherited land in which she grows quinoa, corn and grass (for grazing) that allow her to earn a greater income, by comparison to other crops. Every day, in the morning, she inspects her crops in order to protect them agains harmful insects that could jeopardize the harvest. She sometimes receives help from her mother and on other occasions, from her siblings. Not only does Jacira work her land but she also sells food in the mid morning and at lunchtime. This provides an additional income to the earnings from her agricultural work. She feels that her crop is profitable, especially in the area of quinoa sales. She is able to sell it for a affordable price at her local market. Given its profitability, Jacira will set apart more area of her land to continue growing these same crops. 

This will be Jacira's second loan with MFP. She is very glad knowing that she has financial support and she is happy to be a part of her communal bank because all of its members are very responsible, supportive people. She thanks all those who contribute to the loan she is requesting since it will be very instrumental in furthering her business. Jacira plans to use the loan to invest in bags of manure and fertilizers for the next planting season.

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: La Flor De Limon Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Flor de Limón y está conformado por 9 integrantes, está ubicado en Quintana Roo, México. La señora Jacinta  C. es miembro del grupo y es vecina de  la comunidad  Maya de Limones,  ella  tiene  46 años, vive en una casa de madera y techo de palma de la región que se llama huano, le gusta, pero quiere algo mejor para sus  hijos, ya que no le gustaría que crecieran en un solo cuarto y sin privacidad. La señora Jacinta se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de composturas, arreglos  y encargos de sus vecinos, pero comenta que si tuviera  una máquina  de coser eléctrica  el trabajo seria  más rápido. Ella está contenta  por el crédito que solicito ya que quiere ampliar su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda de todos sus clientes.
texts.en: This group is called Flor de Limón ["Lemon Flower"], and it is made up of 9 members. It is located in Quintana Roo, México. Jacinta C. is a member of the group and a neighbor living in the community of Maya de Limones. She is 46 years old and lives in a wooden house with a thatched roof made from a local palm called huano. She likes it, but she would like something better for her children, because she does not want them to grow up in a single room without any privacy. Jacinta's business is tailoring; she makes all types of garments, repairs clothing, and takes custom orders from her neighbors. However, she comments that if she had an electric sewing machine, her work would go more quickly. She is happy about the loan she is requesting, because she would like to expand her business and be able to satisfy the requests of all of her customers.

loans.use: Buying an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Osmar Alberto

texts.es:
Osmar, casado su esposa trabaja en una empresa privada, sus planes en mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia. Con su propio negoció iniciándolo con apoyo su familia. Se le ha presentado dificultades como es el alza de los perecederos. Proyecto ampliar su negocio con mayores cantidades y variedades. 
Agradece a la financiera por apoyo con el préstamo ya que será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como. Cemento, arena, piedra, bloques, zinc, camisas entre otros permitiéndole mejora el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Osmar is a married man whose wife works in a private business. He has plans to improve the standard of living of his family through his own business, starting it with the help of his family. Some difficulties have come up such as the increase in the price of products. He plans to expand his business with larger quantities and more variety.

He appreciates the financing assistance of the loan which will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, blocks, zinc, work shirts, and other products, permitting him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Ruth Y Esther 2 Group

texts.es:
Anilesis pertenece al grupo Ruth y Esther 2, un grupo formado por 5 mujeres, dedicada a la venta de diferentes productos como: Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.  Cada una de ellos días a días realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Samana, es unas de las comunidad, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales,  o de manera ambulante. 

Anilesis posee una familia conformada por su su hija y su pareja. En una vivienda  alquilada, la cual pagan gracias al esfuerzo que ambos (padre y madre) ya que ambos llevan ingresos a su vivienda. Sus actividades favoritas son trabajar y cuidar a su familia, su desafió mas difícil y el cual es su principal reto por cumplir de poder tener su casa propia; logrando así, cuando lo pueda realizar, su mas anhelado sueño, junto a sus deseos de poder educar y guiar por el buen camino a su hija. Su  negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, para un publico general, compra por encargo, lo que necesitan sus clientes.  Anilesis lleva ya 5 años realizando esta actividad de negocio.

Anilesis ha tomado ya 4 prestamos con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en la compra de zapatos, y algunos artículos que ha identificado con muchas demandas. 

Su historia representa a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Anilesis is part of the Ruth and Esther 2 Group. The group consists of five women who engage in different businesses selling clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products. All of them conduct their business activities every day in the city of Samana. They have established businesses in their community whether it be in their own homes, from storefronts, or as street vendors.

Anilesis has a family that consists of her daughter and her partner. They live in a rented home that they are able to afford as a result of the household income that she and her partner earn. Her favorite activities are working and taking care of her family. The most difficult challenge she faces is being able to acquire her own home. Once she is able to achieve that, her greatest wish is to provide her daughter an education and guide her along the right path. Her business involves selling new clothing to the general public. She purchases what her customers need. Anilesis has been in this business for five years.

She has already taken four loans with Esperanza International. Anilesis is extremely grateful for these loans because she has been able to advance and invest in her business. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes and articles of clothing that are in great demand.

Anelesis is representative of other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in poor communities that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes in different styles

loans.name: Orlando Rafael

texts.es:
Orlando casado, su esposa de ocupación comerciante, tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropas, electrodomésticos y artículos del hogar. Proyectos para corto plazo la compra del local, convertirse en distribuidores y también el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Iniciaron con esfuerzo propios, se le ha presentado al dificulta de falta de financiamientos.   Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y condición de vida. 
El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de mercadería como: ropas de dama, caballero, niños, artículos escolares, productos para el hogar como cuadros, adornos, platos entre otros. Obteniendo un incremento de ventas e igual de ganancia.
texts.en:
Orlando is married. He and his wife are merchants and have their own business selling clothing, electric household appliances and basic home items. Their goals are to buy their working space, become distributors and upgrade their house. They started their business without any assistance but have had some difficulty with finances. They are grateful with the finance company for the support which will allow them to improve their living conditions and business.   

The loan will be utilized to buy general merchandise like clothing for women, men and children, school supplies, household items, pictures, knick-knacks and dishes. This would help them to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto, construirá una pequeña habitación, porque actualmente están viviendo en casa de su suegra, en donde ya se les dio un pedacito de terreno para que construyan una habitación para el  bebe que ellos tienen, ya que es un matrimonio joven que tiene muchos proyectos a futuro y son muy trabajadores, es por eso que decidieron ser padres, por este motivo que ellos, están construyendo esa otra habitación, para tener un poco mas de privacidad y darle a su familia un hogar
texts.en: Sr. Roberto will construct a small house, because he and his wife are now living in the home of his mother-in-law, where she has already given them a little piece of land so that they can build a house for their baby. Since they are a young married couple, they have many projects for the future, and they are very hard-working. This is why they decided to become parents, and this is why they are constructing another house, so that they can have a little more privacy and give their family a home.

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for  technical maintenance on his car, as well as upholstering the seats.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Madame Hawa Guissé est une femme de 46 ans qui habite dans l’un des quartiers environnants de la  localité de baye laye. Elle est mariée et s’active dans la teinture depuis 2004. Madame Guissé exerce parallèlement  la vente de tissus et autres articles divers. C’est par amour du métier  qu’elle a choisi l’activité de teinture. En période de veille de fête (Tabaski, Korite, etc.…) elle est habituée à confectionner des boubous en thioup qui sont  destinés à la vente. Elle est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis mars 2001. Elle a déjà remboursé 7 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits  et de tissus en vue de renforcer son activité de teinture. Madame Guissé compte sur son financement pour atteindre son autonomie financière  qui lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins primaires.
texts.en: Mrs. Hawa Guissé is a 46-year old woman who lives in an area close to the town of Baye-Laye. She is married has been dyeing clothes since 2004. In addition, she also sells fabrics and other miscellaneous items. She selected dyeing because she enjoyed it.  Before festivities, such as Tabaski (the Muslim holiday of Eid) and Korite (corresponding to the ending of Ramadan), she usually makes traditional outfits of dyed cloth for sale. She has been a member of the Yoff branch since March 2001. She already repaid seven  prior loans. She is seeking a credit of 300,000 West African Francs in order to purchase goods and fabrics in order to bolster her business. Mrs. Guisse counts on her loan in order to achieve financial autonomy and be able to provide for her basic needs.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics and dyeing supplies

loans.name: Susana Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Susana Tomasa H. H. D. S. se dedica a  la venta D. cómida y bebidas hace diez años aproximadamente, la solicitante vive con sus padres y su hijo mayor la cual ayuda con la canasta familiar.
Solicita el crédito por quiere ampliar su negocio comprando más mercadería y otras cosas adicionales para su negocio. Se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales además tiene experiencia acrediticia.
texts.en:
Susana Tomasa H. H. D. S. has been selling food and beverages for approximately ten years.  This loan applicant lives with her parents and her oldest son, who helps her pay the family's bills.

She is applying for the loan because she wants to buy more merchandise and other items for her business in order to expand. It has been decided to grant her the loan because she has good business and personal references and has a good credit history.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Miramar Femenino 2 Group

texts.es:
Yesenia es L. coordinadora del Grupo Miramar Femenina 2. Su familia está compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposo, ambos (padre y madre) han educado y criado a sus hijos. Nos dice que sus retos o desafíos más difíciles ha echar su negocio hacia adelante, ya que resulta difícil mantener cualquier negocio si no hay un enfoque a crecer y superar todos los retos. 

Yessenia está muy emocionada D. recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional.  ElL. ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 5 años. Hasta ahora Yesenia ha vendido solo carne D. res, en L. actualidad desea invertir este nuevo préstamo en L. compra D. pollos y cerdo, y poder comprar con un mayor capital, a un mejor suplidor. ElL. va a utilizar sus ganancias para cubrir algunas necesidades en su familia y aprovechar para ahorrar. 

Está asociada D. Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque deseas echar su negocio adelante, el cual requería D. capital para crecer. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una D. las comunidades D. mas escasos recursos ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad.
texts.en:
Yesenia is the coordinator of the 'Miramar Femenina 2' group.  Her family consists of her four children and her husband.  Both of them (father and mother) have educated and raised their children.  Yesenia tells us that her most difficult challenge has been getting ahead in her business since it is difficult to keep any business going if there is no focus on growing and overcoming challenges.

Yesenia is very excited to be receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She has had her business for around 5 years.  Up until now, Yesenia has only sold beef.  She would like to invest this new loan in buying chickens and pigs.  She would also like to be able to buy with more capital from a better supplier.  She will use the profits she makes to cover some of her family's needs and will also save some money.

Yesenia started working with us because she wanted to get ahead in her business which needed capital in order to grow.  We are using her story to represent the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (who have mainly emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans.  In general they live in very poor communities.  This area, like many other poor areas of the Dominican Republic, lacks a reliable supply of drinking water and electricity.  This group is located in the city of Santo Domingo, in one of the poorest communities, in the north of the city.

loans.use: To expand and diversify her meat products

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela embroiders hats, scarves, and sweaters for children, but will also make clothing for adults upon request. Mariela is going to use her loan to buy more fabrics and decorative objects for her clothes. She likes to add pompoms to the end of hats and other accessories to make fun clothing that children will enjoy wearing. Mariela's business has grown since she first started selling children's clothes and now she sells her clothes in another woman's store, but she dreams of owning her own store someday.

Mariela is a mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She hopes her children will continue to be successful in school and will go on to have successful careers after they finish school.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and embroidery materials

loans.name: Mujeres De Suenos Y Metas 2 Group

texts.es:
Cipriana es la coordinadora del Grupo Mujeres de suenos y metas 2. Su familia está compuesta por 4 hijos y su pareja, el cual es el padre de sus hijos. Viven en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, en una de las comunidades de mas escasos recursos ubicada al norte de la ciudad, en unas de sus comunidades rurales.  

Cipriana está muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional.  Ella opera un negocio de venta de comida rápida, en un puesto frente a su casa, su especialidad es comidas fritas. Va a invertir este nuevo préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como pollo, plátanos, aceite, carbón, un caldero para cocinar. Sus ganancias van a ser ahorradas para poder en un futuro poder tener un pequeño restaurante en su comunidad, lo que en República Dominicana le llaman un comedor. Este es uno de sus suenos al igual que pode tener una buena vivienda, donde pueda descansar y vivir segura.

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque las cuotas de pagos son más flexibles y a un menor interés. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Cipriana is the coordinator for the group “Mujeres de Sueños y Metas 2” (Women with Dreams and Goals 2). Her family consists of her four children and her partner who is the father of her children. They live in Santo Domingo in one of the poorest communities located north of the city. This community is in a rural area.

Cipriana is extremely excited about receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza International. She manages a fast food business from a stand in front of her house. Her specialty is fried food. She plans to invest her new loan in the purchase of supplies such as chicken, plantains, oil, charcoal, and a pot for cooking. Her earnings are being saved for the future so that she can open a small restaurant in her community, otherwise known as a “comedor” in the Dominican Republic. This is one of her dreams along with having a nice house where she can rest and live securely.

The group started with Esperanza because of the flexible payments and low interest rate. Cipriana’s story is representative of the other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in poor communities that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, plantains, oil, charcoal, and a pot for cooking

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Miguel, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Atlacahualoya, Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por 7 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son la señora Cecilia M. M. va a comprar mercancía azúcar por kilo, huevo por kilo, papel higiénico, aceite por litro, la señora Margarita M. Aragón va a comprar mercancía jabón, azúcar por kilo, aceite por litro, huevo por kilo, sabritas, refrescos, la señora Roberta M. M. va a comprar mercancía refrescos, jugos, jabón, chiles en vinagre, azúcar, huevo, aceite, la señora Lina C. Hernández va a comprar mercancía sabritas, refrescos, jugos por caja para surtir su negocio, la señora Alicia E. N. va a comprar harina, azúcar, huevo, mantequilla, esencias y una batidora para su negocio, la señora Virginia R. A. va a comprar hojas de maíz, maíz, manteca, una cazuela, para realizar sus tamales, la señora Alma América F. R. va a comprar refrescos, pepsicola por caja, jarrito, coca cola por mayoreo. La señora Roberta es la representante del grupo ella tiene 50 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, ellos son Luis Enrique de 10 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, Arseño de 20 años de edad se fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar, Nayely tiene 17 años de edad no estudia le ayuda a su mama a atender la tienda. La señora Roberta tiene su tienda de abarrotes y solicito su préstamo para surtir su tienda va a comprar azúcar, jabón, cloro, refrescos, sabritas, pan bimbo, galletas, barcel, arroz, azúcar, leche, papel higiénico, agua purificada, frijol, platos y vasos desechables, inicio su negocio hace 10 años tenían dinero ahorrado, su esposo se fue a estados unidos a trabajar y después ella también se fue a Estados  Unidos a trabajar en una lavandería,  ella estuvo 2 años y medio y su esposo 3 años, ella le mandaba a su mama y se lo fue guardando en el Banco, su esposo también fue ahorrando le mandaba a su hermano y lo fue guardando en el banco lo que mandaba y cuando regresaron le entregaron el dinero que fueron ahorrando de ahí compraron el terreno, construyeron su casa y surtieron su tienda.  La señora Roberta también tiene su negocio de alfarería elabora cazuelas y ollas de diferentes tamaños, los jarros los elabora en día de muertos su esposo y ella trabajan en la alfarería y su hija en la tienda. Atlacahualoya es un pueblo donde les gusto a sus hijos vivir su mamá y sus hermanos llegaron ahí a trabajar en el campo y se quedaron a vivir ahí y como su mama cuidaba a sus hijos ellos ya no quisieron regresar a San Marcos y se quedaron a vivir en Atlacahualoya a ellos les gusta porque es tranquilo siembran cebolla, guajes del verde, celebran la fiesta de San Miguel el 29 de septiembre hay feria, primeras comuniones, bailes, toros. Su negocia a ayudado a su familia a tener dinero para los gastos de su hijo para la escuela, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son arreglar su casa ponerle azulejos, sus planes y esperanzas son sus hijos serán los que hicieran algo mas, les va a dejar su casa para ellos, ya si quieren seguir ya ellos verán, los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por sus préstamos y que nos sigan prestando, espeR. no quedar mal, les agradecemos mucho porque nos están ayudando a crecer en nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "San Miguel," and it is located in the community of Atlacahualoya, Axochiapan, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It consists of 7 women who know each other and are neighbors. They are Señora Cecilia M. M., who is going to buy merchandise: sugar by the kilo, eggs by the kilo, toilet paper, and oil by the liter; Señora Margarita M. Aragón is going to buy merchandise: soap, sugar by the kilo, oil by the liter, eggs by the kilo, Sabritas chips, and soft drinks; Señora Roberta M. M. is going to buy merchandise: soft drinks, juices, soap, peppers in vinegar, sugar, eggs, and oil; Señora Lina C. Hernández is going to buy merchandise: Sabritas chips, soft drinks, and juices by the case to stock her business; Señora Alicia E. N. is going to buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter, fragrances, and a mixer for her business; Señora Virginia R. A. is going to buy corn husks, corn, lard, and a casserole to make her tamales; Señora Alma América F. R. is going to buy soft drinks, PepsiCola by the case, pitchers, and CocaCola wholesale.

Señora Roberta is the representative of the group. She is 50 years old and is married, with three children: Luis Enrique is 10 years old and is in primary school; Arseño, who is 20, left for the United States to work; Nayely, who is 17, is not in school but helps her mother tend the store. Señora Roberta has a grocery store and is applying for the loan to stock her store. She is going to buy sugar, soap, bleach, soft drinks, Sabritas chips, Bimbo bread, crackers, Barcel snacks, rice, sugar, milk, toilet paper, purified water, beans, and disposable plates and glasses. She began her business 10 years ago with money they had saved. Her husband went to the United States to work, and later she also went to the United States to work in a laundry. She was there for two and a half years and her husband for three years. She sent money to her mother and she kept it in the bank. Her husband also saved and sent money to his brother, who kept what he sent in the bank. When they came back, her mother and her husband's brother turned over the money they had saved and then they bought land, built their house, and stocked her store. Señora Roberta also has a pottery business. She makes casseroles and pots of different sizes. She makes jars on the Day of the Dead. She and her husband work in the pottery business and their daughter works in the store. Atlacahualoya is a town where her children like to live. Her mother and her brothers came there to work in the fields and stayed there to live, and since her mother was taking care of their children, they didn't want to go back to San Marcos and stayed in Atlacahualoya to live. They like it because it is peaceful. They plant onions and green calabashes. They celebrate the fiesta of San Miguel on the 29th of September. There are fairs, first communions, dances, and bullfights. Her business has helped her family to have money for the school expenses of their son. The improvements that she wants to make on her house are to fix it up and put on tiles. Her plans and hopes are that her children will do something more. She is going to leave her house to them, if they want to continue living there, they will see.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad "We give them thanks for their loans and for continuing to lend to us. We hope we don't make a bad impression. We thank them very much because they are helping us to grow in our businesses."

loans.use: Buy sugar, boxes of soap, bleach, soft drinks, Sabritas chips, Bimbo bread, crackers, Barcel snacks, rice, beans, eggs, sugar, milk, toilet paper, purified water, and disposable plates, glasses, and spoons

loans.name: Bicentenario Dos Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Bicentenario dos, porque son muy patriotas y orgullosos de su país. Esta ubicado en el estado de México y es la segunda vez que piden un crédito. La Señora Nelly Uribe C. es integrante del grupo y la presidenta. Ella tiene 21 años y dos hijos, ambos son niños, de 2 y 3 años de edad, lleva dos años con su negocio. El prestamo que solicita lo invertira en materias primas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así tener variedad en sus productos, su intencion es crecer economicamente y tener una estabilidad para apoyar a su familia. La señora Nelly se siente feliz al solicitar este crédito ya que con él le podrá ofrecer una carrera profesional a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Bicentenario Dos”, [Bicentennial Two] because they are very patriotic and proud of their country. It is located in the State of Mexico and this is the second time it has requested a loan. 

Mrs. Nelly Uribe C. is a member and the president of the group. She is 21 years old and has two boys who are two and three years old. She has had her business for two years.

The loan will be utilized to buy raw materials to please her costumers and offer a variety of products. She wishes to grow economically and obtain stability to provide for her family. Mrs. Nelly is excited about requesting the loan because it may allow her to provide a career path for her children through schooling.

loans.use: To buy raw material

loans.name: Egon

texts.en:
Mr. Egon is 47 years old.  He is married and has a 4-year-old daughter.  His spouse is Ms. Margarita. She is 43 years old and she works in the house.

Mr. Egon says that he learned his father's work when he was little and thanks to him he can earn a name in a competitive market.  Most of what Mr. Egon makes is home furniture, such as chairs and end tables.  He also makes windows and doors.  

Mr. Egon asked for the foundation's help to buy basic products for his business (cedar, pine and plywood) so he can get more work done for a restaurant.  He thanks the foundation for the trust it has for him.

loans.use: To buy wood (cedar, pine and plywood) to make furniture

loans.name: Las Damas De La Colosio Group

texts.es: El Nombre de este grupo es Las Damas de la Colosio, en mención a la colonia donde viven  y por ser  todas unas Respetables Damas, El Grupo se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Quintana Roo, México y está conformado por 11 integrantes. La señora Francisca Acuña C. es una de las integrantes del grupo, la señora tiene 46 años de edad y estudio hasta la primaria, ella vende frutas y verduras, tiene 3 hijos; dos mujeres de 17 y 14 años y un varón de 11 años. Comenzó su negocio de Frutas y verduras desde hace 3 años, ella solicita el préstamo para surtir su negocio y darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así satisfacer sus necesidades, ya Q. es la única recatería en la colonia, ella vende las frutas y verduras más frescas y nutritivas. Con este préstamo la Señora Francisca espera ampliar su negocio y poder surtirse, y de las ganancias Q. generen poder apoyar a sus hijos para Q. terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Damas de la Colosio” [The Ladies of the Colosio] in honor of their colony and because they are all well respected ladies. The group is from the Quintana Roo State in Mexico and is made up of 11 members. Mrs. Francisca Acuna C. is one of them. She is 46 years old and attended school until the end of elementary. She has three children, two girls who are 17 and 14 and a boy who is 11 years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years.

She is requesting the loan to stock and enlarge her business, better serve her costumers and provide a necessary service since her produce retail store is the only one in the colony. She sells the most fresh and nutritious fruits and vegetables. She wants to be able to support her children and provide for their schooling.

loans.use: To stock her business up with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.en:
This committe was formed thanks to Ms. Catalina D., who lives in Villa Rica.  Everyone was happy to form the Mujeres Rurales committee, naming it Mujeres Dinamicas (Dynamic Women).  

The members of this committee are engaged in handicrafts, using the skills they inherited from their parents to make beautiful clothing such as shirts, tablecloths in aopoi fabric, etc.  They are also engaged in trading food products, as well as other activities.  With the foundation's help, the members of this committee were able to increase their income and improve their life conditions.

Mrs. Claudelina B. is a seamstress who for many years support her family by making traditional embroidery.  She is skilled in crafts.  She would like to arrange a loan to help her proviD. higher quality products by purchasing more threads and fabrics of different varieties.

loans.use: To purchase crafts supplies such as aopoi fabric, thread racks, etc.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio tiene 23 años de edad es conviviente vive en casa propia con su esposa y su menor hija de 07 años Policarpio en la actualidad cuenta con dos mototaxis en una el se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte y la otra la da en alquiler,el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de una moto carga y asi poder ayudar a su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, se le propone el crédito por tener buenas
referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Policarpio is 23 and lives with his wife and young 7-year-old daughter in their own home. Policarpio currently has two motorcycle taxis. He uses one to offer a transportation service, and he rents out the other. This loan will be used for the purchase of a cargo bike, and to help his wife, who sells fruit. He has been approved for this loan because he has good references, and a desire and ability to repay it.

loans.use: the purchase of a cargo bike

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Ms. Emilce Felicita A. D. P.. Everyone was delighted to be a part of Mujeres Emprendedoras, naming the committee "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn).  

The members of the committee are engaged in handicrafts, skills which they inherit from their parents.  They make beautiful clothing items such as shirts and aopoi fabric tablecloths.  They also have various other businesses, like selling food and clothes.  With the foundation's help, the members of this committee were able to increase their income and improve their life conditions.

Mrs. Emily has a profession sewing clothes and crafting ornaments.  She has generated such good products that her clientele has grown, so she needs a loan to improve her products and proviD. the best to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase crafts supplies such as aopoi fabric, thread, racks, etc.

loans.name: Nazaria Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Nazaria Yamileth García R. tiene 24 años de edad, vive en union Libre con el señor Emil Alberto Martinez quien se dedica  pintar carros en su taller y Nazaria se dedica a la venta de productos varios tiene una tienda en la cual vende cuadros, flores, adornos para la cocina, sala y dormitorios tambien vende achineria como ganchos para el cabello, colitas para las niñas, fantasia fina, Calcomanias, etc.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de cuardenos, lapices, zapatos, pantalones, juguetes, tenis, borradores y papel. todos los productos son materiales para escuela, en estos momentos es temporada de inicios de clases y desea tener surtido su negocio.
Nazaria tiene dos hijos y junto a el padre de sus hijos trabajan duro para salir adelante con ellos.
Nazaria nos comento sentirse feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo rapido y esta teniendo buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs.Nazaria Yamileth García R. is 24 years old. She has a common law marriage with Mr. Emil Alberto Martinez, who paints cars in his workshop. Nazaria sells various products in a store she has. She sells pictures, flowers, kitchen, living room and bedroom decorative items, and items such as hair clips, hair band for girls, stickers, etc. She will use the loan to buy notebooks, pencils, shoes, pants, toys, tennis shoes, erasers and paper. All of these products are school supplies. It is back to school time right now and she wants to supply her business. 

Nazaria has two children and with her children's father she works hard to get ahead with them. Nazaria told us that she feels happy since her business is growing and she is making good profits.

loans.use: To buy backpacks, notebooks, pencils, shoes, pants, toys, tennis shoes, erasers and paper.

loans.name: Gladys Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Gladys Mercedes P. S. se dedica a la venta de gaseosas ,golosinas,comida y otros en el kiosko de la Universidad Alas Peruanas hace dos años aproximadamente , el cual es alquilado. Vive en casa familiar con su hija la cual es menor de edad y se encuentra en etapa escolar tiene otro hijo pero es independiente. Requiere del crédito para invertir en mercadería para su negocio ya que empieza a llegar la totalidad de alumnado y por tanto necesita abastecerse. Se le otorgará el crédito por que cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales .
texts.en: Mrs.Gladys Mercedes P. S. has sold soft drinks, candies and food among other things in a rented kiosk at the Universidad Alas Peruanas for approximately two years. She lives in her family home with her daughter, who is a school aged minor. She has another son, but he is on his own.  She requires the loan to invest in merchandise for her business since all of students are starting to come in and she needs to be supplied. She will be given the loan because she has good personal and professional references.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y una hija de 6 meses de edad, posee una tienda donde ofrece a los vecinos y amigos productos para el hogar, esté negocio tiene 1 año de existir, lo atiende de 6 de la mañana a 7 de la noche; José quiere invertirle al negocio y para realizarlo solicita un préstamo que le brinde los recursos para abastecer el inventario.
El préstamo será utilizado en bebidas, arroz, frijoles, jabón y detergente, esta compra le ayudara para crecer con el negocio, cubrirá la demanda y mejorar su condición.
Entre los sueños de José esta ver a su hija crecer sanamente, continuar trabajando con el negocio y seguir arreglando poco a poco la casa.
texts.en:
José resides in Corinto, within the department of Morazán.  He is 35 years old, and lives with his wife and a 6-month old daughter.  He has a store where he offers neighbors and friends products for the home.  The business has been in existence for 1 year; he tends to it from 6 am until 7 pm.  José would like to invest in the business, and requests a loan to have the resources to supply his inventory.  

The loan would be used for beverages, rice, beans, soap and detergent.  These purchases would help him to grow his business, as he would be able to meet demand and improve his situation.  José’s dreams include seeing his daughter grow up healthy, continuing to work  on his business and, little by little, making improvements to their home.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, rice, beans, soap and detergent.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Ms. Fabiola G. B..  They named the committee San Cayetano.

This group makes beautiful clothing items such as shirts and aopoi fabric tablecloths.  In addition, some members of this committee also sell food products and clothing items to generate income.  With the help given by the foundation, the members of this group were able to increase their earnings and improve their life conditions.

Ms. Fabiola is engaged in embroidery and needs a loan to move her business forward by purchasing the materials needed to do the work.

loans.use: To purchase crafts supplies such as aopoi fabric, thread, racks, etc.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 6 hijos.  Eusebia no pudo estudiar.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como chanchos y ganado ovino, en las diferentes ferias de la provincia. Viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que le sirvió en la compra tres corderos.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que  servirá para comprar un toro y trabajar con engorde de ganado vacuno.
Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la alegría, el trabajo en grupo y muchos otros.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” cooperative bank, located in the district and province of Tunguyo, in Puno.  She is 60 years old, married, and has 6 children.  Eusebia was not able to get an education.  She dedicates herself to buying and selling small animals such as pigs and sheep at the various markets in the province.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for twelve years, starting with an initial loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she used this loan to buy three lambs.  With this loan of 2,000.00 soles, she will buy a bull and work toward fattening her cattle.  Her dream is to improve her business.

What she enjoys most about working with the cooperative bank is the punctuality, the happiness, working with a group, and many other things.

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Adrian Antonio C. M. tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa, cameras, toallas, ropa de niño, carteras y mas.
 
Adrian en las noches estudia en la universidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa escolar, este mes es de epoca en donde entran a los colegios y a las escuelas los niños y desea tener bien surtido su negocio para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
su meta es crecer como microempresario y llegar a ser un empresario.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con algunos gastos del hogar y para sus estudios.
texts.en:
The young Adrian Antonio C. M. is 21 years old, single, and dedicated to the sale of shoes, clothing, cameras, towels, children’s clothes, purses and more.

At night, Adrian studies at the university.  He will use the loan to buy school clothes, as this month is the season when the children return to school.  He wants to have a well-supplied store so that he can meet customer demand.  

His goal is to grow as an entrepreneur and become a successful businessman.  He needs income to meet some household expenses and to pay for his education.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, pants, socks, t-shirts, undergarments, skirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
Evarista es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 11 hijos.  Evarista no tiene estudios. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, este dinero lo invirtió en la  compra D. dos corderos para engordarlos.  Su actividad económica consiste en el engorD. D. ganado vacuno y ovino, trabajo que es realizado por ella y su esposo.
Con este préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará  un toro y su respectivo alimento para engorD..
Su sueño es  trabajar con la misma actividad y mejorar sus ingresos.  Está muy agradecida D. poder contar con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Evarista is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” cooperative bank, located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in Puno.  She is 57 years old, married, and has 11 children.  Evarista was not able to get an education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for ten years.  Her first loan was for 300.00 Peruvian soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of lambs to fatten.  Her economic activity consists of raising cattle and sheep, a business she carries out with the help of her husband.

She will use this loan of 3,000.00 soles to buy a bull and its necessary feed.  Her dreams are to continue with the same activity and to improve her income.  She is very thankful to be able to count on the loans from Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase a bull and feed.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 25 años vive con sus padres y su hijo en la propiedad de sus padres. Desde hace un año y medio decidió abrir su propio negocio, meses atrás ella estaba apoyando a sus padres en las tareas agrícolas y con unos ahorros que disponía logró invertir en el negocio de su tienda que actualmente desempeña en la casa de sus padres. La atención que brinda es diaria y es la única que atiende en su establecimiento aunque en algunas ocasiones la apoya su madre. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro con su negocio, una de ellas es tener una tienda más grande y llena de mercadería. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos y aprovechar la época escolar que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Edith is 25 years old, and lives with her parents and son in her parents’ home.  A year-and-a-half ago, she decided to open her own business.  Before that, she was helping her parents with their farming tasks and, with some savings she had, she managed to open a store in their house.

She tends to her business every day, working alone but with periodic help from her mother.  She has many future plans for her business, one of which is to expand the store and carry more merchandise.

This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to know that she has financial support.  She has always demonstrated herself to be very responsible with her payments, and she also enjoys being part of her cooperative bank because the members are very responsible and united.  

She thanks those people who may be part of granting this loan to her, as it will be very useful in growing her business.  She will use the loan to buy more products, and take advantage of the school season that is approaching.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her store, as well as school supplies.

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es:
Karen P. O., de 28 años es la propietaria de la miscelánea y papelería. “Variedades Margarita”, ella vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 años al sur de Barranquilla, en una comunidad muy productiva de gente trabajadora, solidaria y de un gran espíritu cívico,donde abundan microempresas en manos de mujeres. 
Karen inició su negocio hace un año, como una actividad para entretenerse, pero al ver los buenos resultados le imprimió mayor empeño, y así fue dándole forma hasta convertirla  hoy, en  otra fuente de ingreso para su hogar y una manera de sentirse útil y productiva. Su sueño es lograr ampliar su negocio con productos que tengan  precios módicos, donde pueda estandarizarlos simultaneamente  en un solo precio que llame la atención de sus clientes; camino a este propósito está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en la línea de Kiva, para comprar artículos de cacharrería, baldes plásticos, tasas, tanques, termos  y loncheras; inversión que proyecta ser exitosa por la gran capacidad de servicio de Karen y el potencial de clientes que tiene a su alrededor, de los cuales ya ha registrado encargos. Asi su asesor expresa que  sus indices financieros se encuentran en los siguientes rangos: liquidez 2 veces, rentabilidad sobre las ventas    entre 30 y 35%, endeudamiento actual 45%, rotación de inventarios de 15 a 20 dias y  que desde allí proyecta su crecimiento futuro.
texts.en: Karen is 28 years old and owns a general store and stationery shop called "Variedades Margarita." She lives with her husband and 10-year-old son to the south of Barranquilla in a very productive community of hard-working, united people full of civic pride, where there are many small businesses run by women. Karen started her business a year ago as a way to entertain herself, but after seeing the good results she started putting in more effort and was able to convert it into what it is today: another source of income for her household and a way to feel useful and productive. Her dream is to expand her business with affordable products that she can standardize with a singular price to attract her customers' attention. It's for this reason she is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to buy crockery items, plastic buckets, cups, bottles, thermoses and lunch boxes, an investment she predicts to be successful in increasing her service capacity and bring in potential customers from the area, including those she has already attracted. Her adviser says her financial indices are in the following ranges: two times liquidity, return on sales between 30 and 35 percent, current debt 45 percent, and inventory turnover 15 to 20 days, which projects for future growth.

loans.use: Purchase crockery items, plastic buckets, cups, bottles, thermoses and lunch boxes

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin Alberto Z.  tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 12 años, en el el municipio de Malambo a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; alli tiene un   punto de venta  de mercancias  variadas, donde aprovecha para generar  otros ingresos con la venta de minutos y recargas a celulares. Edwin incursionò en la actividad  comercial  hace tres años, como cobrador de terceros, y con sus ahorros logrò emprender su miscelanea  en la casa de su madre, donde vende variados articulos como perfumes, elementos de aseo y papelerìa en general. Anteriormente se dedicò a la elèctrònica pero no le fue muy bien porque las personas no reconocen esta actividad y todo se va descontinuando muy rapidamente. Por eso buscò otra actividad que le generarà ingresos y una vez emprendiò su miscelanea, tambien adquiriò 3 planes de celulares para vender minutos y simultaneamente de dedica a hacer domicilios de medicinas y a cobrar facturas de manera independiente, actividades que le permiten obtener  ingresos complementarios a los que genera  por cuenta de su miscelanea. Hace un año le recomendaron la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organzaciòn con la que recibiò su primer financiamiento y adquiriò 3 vitrinas que surtiò con ese mismo crèdito. Este es su segundo financiamiento y con èl espera incrementar sus ventas en un 35% , teniendo en cuenta que comprarà ùtiles escolares porque es la temporada de ingreso a la escuela y justamente alrededor de su negocio  existe un importante colegio y es parte de su mercado mas seguro. Su meta es aumentar la cobertura de clientes y lograr como todo buen padre una educaciòn de calidad para sus hijos, porque sueña con verlos algun dia convertidos en profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Edwin Alberto Z. is 33 years old.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 2 and 12.  They live in the Malambo municipality, which is 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  He has a business selling varied merchandise there.  He takes advantage of the opportunity to generate other income by selling minutes and recharges for cell phones.

Edwin ventured in the business activity three years ago as a third party debt collector.  With his savings he managed to undertake his convenience store in his mother’s house.  He sells various items like perfume, cleaning products, and general stationery items.  Previously he worked with electronics, but it did not go very well for him because people do not know about electronics.  Everything stopped very quickly.

That is why he looked for another business activity that would generate income for him.  Once he undertook his store, he also got three cell phone plans to sell minutes.  He also makes home deliveries of medications, and  does independent invoice collection.  These activities allow him to get complementary income in addition to what he gets from his store.

He was recommended to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a year ago.  He got his first loan from them, and he got three display cases that he stocked with the same loan.  This is his second loan, and he hopes to increase his sales by 35%.  He will buy school supplies because it is the season for school to start.  There is an important school very close to his business, and that is the most secure part of his market.

His goal is to increase his customers, and, like all good fathers, give his children a quality education.  He dreams of one day seeing them become successful professionals.

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana R. de 62 años es una mujer muy fuerte y emprendedora, que con su negocio de fabricación de productos alimenticios como deditos, empanaditas, arepas y pastelitos de queso, carne , o pollo, a los que imprime el sabor de la comida de su natal Cartagena,  ha logrado sostener   su hogar; Ana  llegó de su tierra desde sus 7 años a Barranquilla, ciudad capital,  donde hizo estudios primarios, contrajo matrimonio, tuvo 8 hijos y finalmente se separó de su esposo  e inició su propio negocio, que  al principio   fue la  preparación de fritos en su propia casa, actividad que  cambió por la de panadería , con la que se posicionó por muchos años en el mercado y construyó su legado familiar en este oficio, pues  todos sus hijos en las edades de 25 a 38 años tienen su propia microempresa en panadería, o en preparación de productos derivados de la harina de trigo. 
Hoy  su principal actividad es la fabricación de deditos, pastelitos, empanaditas de queso, pollo o carne, los cuales distribuye en los colegios de los barrios aledaños a su vivienda y en tiendas donde es muy reconocida. Su meta principal es diversificar sus productos y la apertura de nuevos y permanentes mercados y este es justamente su gran desafío.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante la línea credikiva, ya que su capital de trabajo es muy pequeño y quiere fortalecerlo comprando, materias primas de contado para obtener descuentos por el volumen de compra, especialmente Harina de trigo, y azúcar, que aumentan sus precios permanentemente. El negocio de Ana en este momento presenta una Rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 1,3 días, una rotación de inventarios de 5 días, mientras su  rotación de cuentas por pagar es de 2, 5 días y su endeudamiento con el nuevo credikiva es de 11,20%. Ana Isabel es una gran madre que ha apoyado siempre a sus hijos y en la actualidad ellos la poyan también,  por eso su sueño es verlos realizados y con vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Ana R., age 62, is a very strong and enterprising woman.  She makes food products like deditos (a type of fried snack); empanaditas (little turnovers); corn cakes; and cheese, meat, or chicken pies.  She makes them with the flavor of food in her native Cartagena.  She has managed to support her household.

Ana left her land and arrived in Barranquilla, the capital city, seven years ago.  She attended elementary school, got married, and had eight children.  She eventually separated from her husband and started her own business.

At the beginning she made fried food in her own house.  She traded that activity for a bakery, which has been located in the market for many years.  She built her family legacy through this occupation.  All of her children, ages 25-38, have their own small bakery businesses or make products derived from wheat flour.

Now she primarily makes deditos; corn cakes; cheese, meat, or chicken empanaditas; and cheese, meat, or chicken pies.  She distributes them to the schools in the neighborhoods surrounding her house.  She also delivers to stores where she is very well-known.

Her main goal is to diversify her products and to open new and permanent markets.  This is precisely her great challenge.

She is currently applying for her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through Kiva.  She has very little work capital, and she wants to strengthen it by purchasing raw materials for cash.  She will do this to get volume discounts, especially for wheat flour and sugar.  These prices are constantly rising.

Ana’s business now has a turnover on accounts receivable of 1.3 days, a 5 day turnover of inventory, and its turnover for accounts payable is 2.5 days.  Her debt with the new Kiva loan is 11.2%.

Ana is a great mother who has always supported her children.  Now, they support her as well.  Therefore, her dream is to see them become successful and have their own homes.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge Eliecer E. vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la elaboraciòn y venta de “peto”, una deliciosa  bebeida o chicha caliente, que se prepara con maiz pilado, azucar una pizca de sal y canela; esta actividad la iniciò para cambiar su antiguo negocio de fabricaciòn de un embutido costeño y muy artesanal llamado “butifarra”, al que se  dedicaba anteriormente solo los fines de semanas, pero como Jorge Eliecer es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable de su familia, decidiò adicionar otra actividad rentable que le generara ingresos todos los dias,  asi es que conociendo el oficio de vender peto, en el cual trabaja su padre, decidiò reemplazarlo  para tener mayores ingresos, pues en su familia en la medida que crecen, aumenta las necesidades del hogar conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 años.  Desde que iniciò en la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo con su primer financiamiento vio cambios positivos en su negocio, especialmente porque es un  nuevo capital de trabajo que invierte y genera otras utilidades imprimiendole la fuerza de trabajo. El credikiva es su segundo financiamiento y con èl cambiará el triciclO (vehiculo de tres ruedas) y  los tanques de aluminio  condicionando su infraestructura y  ademàs comprará insumos para la elaboracion del producto. 
Su principal sueño es tener una casa propia para aumentar el bienestar de su famlia y por eso trabaja arduamente porque ellos son su inspiraciòn para hacerlo. En la actualidad su negocio presenta una rentabilidad  sobre la venta del 22%, un endeudamiento futuro muy bajo lo que con su capacidad de trabajo y experiencia emprendedora haran que esta nueva inversion tenga éxito, porque impactarà sus ingresos
texts.en:
Jorge Eliecer E. lives in the city of Barranquilla.  He makes and sells “peto” , a delicious drink, or warm  “chicha”  (a drink derived from corn).  It is prepared with husked corn, sugar, a pinch of salt and cinnamon.

He started this activity in order to change from his old business of making handmade coastal sausages called “butifarra”.  Previously he only worked on this on the week-ends.  But, as Jorge Eliecer is a very hard-working and responsible family man, he decided to add another business activity that would generate income every day.  That is how he got to know the job of selling peto, a business in which his father works.  He decided to fill in for him in order to have greater earnings.  

As his family grows, the household necessities increase.  His home is made up of his wife and their two children, ages 9 and 15.

Since he started with his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domino, he has seen positive changes in his business.  This is especially true because it is new working capital that he invests.  It generates other benefits, leaving the imprint of the strength of his work.

The Kiva loan is his second loan.  He will use it to change the “triciclo” (vehicle with three wheels) and the aluminum tanks.  Doing so will improve the condition of his infrastructure.  He will also buy supplies to make his product.

His main dream is to have his own house in order to increase his family’s well-being.  Therefore, he will work arduously because his family is his inspiration for doing so.  His business currently generates a profit margin of 22% and will carry a very low future debt ratio.  With his capacity for work and his entrepreneurial experience, this new investment will be successful because it will impact his income.

loans.use: He will change his tricycle and the aluminum tanks, which will improve the condition of his infrastructure for his new business.  He will also buy supplies for making his product

loans.name: Eusebio Ricardo

texts.es:
Eusebio G., un hombre  de 60 años y casado,  llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 11 años, procedente del municipio de Cereté, lugar donde vivía; el trabajaba en Cerromatoso, gran productor en Colombia de ferroníquel, o aleación de hierro y níquel, en el departamento de Córdoba, de donde hoy espera su pensión. 
Eusebio  vive en el barrio 7 de Abril y es propietario de la “Tienda los Abuelos”, negocio que inició por recomendación de su hermana y es hoy una fuente de ingreso y empleo para él y su esposa y por eso ambos son conocidos en el sector como “los abuelos”.  Este es su sexto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y esta aplicando a su primer credikiva para comprar víveres productos no perecederos, arroz, aceite, harina y azúcar  en mayor proporción, para ganar descuentos y continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia que es su fortaleza, lo que le augura éxitos en su inversión.
Desde que inició su historia crediticia en la Fundación su negocio ha crecido, porque cada crédito es una adición a su capital de trabajo que le permite expandirse al tener todos los productos  que sus clientes requieren de manera asequible.
texts.en:
Euesbio G., 60 years old and married, moved to the city of Barranquilla, Colombia 11 years ago from the municipality of Cerete where he used to live.  He used to work at Cerromatoso, a large producer of ferronickel - an alloy of iron and nickel - in the department of Cordoba; he is now waiting for his retirement pension from this company. Eusebio lives in the 7 de Abril neighborhood in Barranquilla, and he owns the "Tienda los Abuelos" (Grandparents' Store), a business that he began at his sister's suggestion. The store is now a source of income and employment for him and his wife, and because of this, both are known in the area as "the grandparents." 

This is Eusbio's sixth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he is applying for his first Kiva credit to buy non-perishable goods, such as rice, oil, flour, and sugar, in bulk so that he can buy at a discount and continue offering excellent service, which will help him succeed in his investment.  His business has grown since be began taking out credit with the Foundation, because each loan is an addition to his work capital that allows him to expand to have all the products that his customers need at an affordable price.  Through this growth, the couple has been able to sustain their business well.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk non-perishable goods, such as rice, oil, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Gessler Stivenson

texts.es:
Gessler Stivenson tiene 22 años y se dedica a la venta de mercancias variadas como ropa y calzado, y tambien al comercio de joyas fabricadas en oro golfi brasilero y en plata.
