Gessler naciò en un hogar Santandereano (Gentilicio de quien nace en el departamento de Santander) donde el negocio independiente y la gran capacidad de trabajo es parte de su cultura. En su experiencia familiar y desde muy  niño tuvo todo su aprendizaje para emprender su propio negocio, sin descuidar sus estudios, por eso se graduò tambien como “Tecnico de Laboratorio” en la universidad, y desde allì empezò a comercializar joyas entre sus compañeros de estudio, profesores y empleados de la academia,  apoyado por un capital de trabajo que le regalaron: su padre quien aportò $200.000 cop , su tia adiciònò $200.000 cop mas y su madre,  tambien prestataria de la Fundaciòn  le dio. $200.000 cop, con los que completò su capital inicial.
En la actualidad està solicitando su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, pues necesita un capital de trabajo adicional para lograr dar respuesta a  pedidos que han hecho nuevos clientes y requiere ser oportuno. Con el comprará mercancia surtida como ropa femenina, joyas de plata y de oro golfi brasilero : pulseras, aretes, cadenas, tobilleras y anillos. 
Su sueño es tener una casa propia adecuada con un local donde exhibir toda la variedad de productos que vende, pues en la actualidad su gran desafio es la compertencia quien aborda el mercado con productos de menos calidad pero bien exhibidos y él debe hacer mayores esfuerzos para posicionar sus productos en el mercado. Actualmente su negocio presenta una razon corriente de 7,23, un endeudamiento total de 13,4% y con el nuevo credikiva serà de 28,45, mientras maneja unas cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 27 dias , su rotaciòn de inventarios es de 51 dias  y su  rotacion de cuentas por pagar son de 14,8 dias. 
Gessler es un jòven muy capaz de salir adelante en todo lo que se proponga, asi que su emprendimiento muy probablemente generarà en un futuro, no solo sus propios ingresos, sino tambien empleo para muchas personas y esto  es con lo que Gessler realmente sueña.
texts.en:
Gessler Stivenson is 22 years old and he sells various merchandise, such as clothes and shoes. He also sells jewelry made with Brazilian goldfill and silver. Gessler was born in a Santanderean home (people who are born in the Santander department), where independent business and a great work ethic are a part of his culture. In his family experience, and since he was very small, he learned everything to be able to have his own business, without neglecting his studies. That is why he also graduated as a laboratory technician from the university.  It was there that he started to sell jewelry to his classmates, professors and school employees. He was helped by working capital that was given to him: his father gave her $200.000 COP, his aunt gave him another $200.000 COP and his mother, another borrower from the Fundaciòn, gave him  $200.000 COP. With that, he had all his initial capital.  

Presently, he is asking for his first loan from the Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo. He needs working capital to be able to respond to orders that new customers have made and he needs to be able to respond quickly. With it, he will buy various merchandise such as women's clothes, silver and Brazilian goldfill jewelry such as: bracelets, earrings, chains, anklets and rings.    

His dream is to have his own house that can have a locale where he can exhibit all of the products he sells. At present, his biggest challenge is the competition that exists in the market with lesser quality products. He has to make a bigger effort to position his products in the market. At present, his business has a current ratio of 7.23, and a total debt of 13.4%. With the new Kiva loan, it will be 28.45, while he manages some accounts payable that rotate every 27 days. His inventory turnover is 51 days, and his accounts payable rotation is 14.8 days. 

Gessler is a young man who is very capable of getting ahead in everything he sets his mind on. With his enterprising spirit, it is very probable that he wil generate a future, not only for his own income, but also a job for a lot of people. This is what Gessler really dreams of.

loans.use: Various merchandise, such as women's clothing, silver and Brazilian goldfill jewelry: bracelets, earrings, chains, anklets and rings.

loans.name: Jose Jacinto

texts.es:
El señor Jose Jacinto E. tiene 54 años de edad, es soltero con tres hijos y se dedica a la pesca artesanal.
tiene mas de 33 años de experiencia en dicha actividad, vive con sus tres hijos varones que le ayudan a realizar la pesca en su lancha.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para arreglar el motor de su lancha.
en estos momentos no puede transportarse hacia el mar y esto hace que tenga perdidas grandes por no poder pescar.
Don Jose Jacinto ademas es agricultor, cultiva maiz para consumo diario de su familia.
ademas de esto los fines de semana transporta turistas hacia la isla de Amapala en su lancha.
cuando esta en su casa lo dedica a costurar las redes que necesita para pescar.
texts.en:
Jose Jacinto E. is 54 yars old and the single parent of three childen.  He is a fisherman with more than 33 years of experience.  Jose Jacinto lives with his three sons, who help him to haul fish into his boat.  The loan proceeds will be used to purchase spare parts to fix his boat's motor.  Currently, he is not able to go out to sea, resulting in big losses due to his inability to fish.  

Jose Jacinto is also a farmer, cultivating corn for his family's daily consumption.  Additionally, he transports tourists to the island of Amapala in his boat on weekends.  When he is at home, he works sewing the nets he needs in order to fish.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for a boat engine.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is 67 years old, married, and has 8 children and 22 grandchildren. She is a member of the communal bank "Solidaridad". She will be using her loan of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase animals at markets outsiD. of Ayacucho. She butchers them for meat in her home with the help of some of her children, and sells the meat to local stores and restaurants to earn income. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 20 years now and enjoys being able to work and save.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Carmen Fresia

texts.es: La señora Carmen Fresia H. A. se dedica a la venta de carne hace más de un año aproximadamente en su puesto del mercado el cual es alquilado. La solicitante vive en casa familiar de sus padres comparte los gatos familiares. Está solicitando el crédito para capital de trabajo, se propone otorgarle el préstamo ya que cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otras entidades bancarias lo cual está pagando puntuamente.
texts.en:
For about a year, Carmen Fresia H. A. hace been selling meat in a rented stall at the market. She lives in her parents' house and shares family expenses.

Carmen is asking for the loan for working capital.  It has been decided to grant her the loan since she has loan experience with other banks and is paying off her loan punctually.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carla Emili

texts.es: La señora Carla Emili R. S. se dedica a activadad de venta de comida en su domicilio ubicado en Cerro Azul hace tres años aproximadamente, La solicitante vive en casa propia conjuntamente con su esposo y su menor hijo ambos se ayudan con la canasta familiar ya que su cónyuge trabaja como obrero. Requiere del crédito para comprar mesas y sillas para atender a sus cliente cómodamente. Se le otorgará el crédito por que tiene capacidad para asumir una nueva obligación.
texts.en:
For about three years, Carla Emili R. S. has sold meals in her home in Cerro Azul.  She lives in her own house with her husband and youngest son.  They both help with family expenses because her husband also works.

Carla needs this loan to buy tables and chairs so she can make her customers comfortable.  She will be given the loan because she is able to take on this new obligation.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 27 years old, married, and has a 2-month-old son. She is currently in her fourth loan cycle with FINCA. She sells clothing and cosmetics, and is a cosmetologist. 

Lourdes will be using her loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to buy cosmetic products and school uniforms to sell before the school season begins in March. She also plans to buy some wood for her husband's construction business. 

Lourdes hopes to expand her business and save money for her son and future children and to buy land in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothing to resell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 39 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niño aprendió todas las tareas agrícolas y desde hace 5 años posee una granja de animales, en donde cría cuyes para venderlos semanalmente. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, siembra papa, maíz y alfalfa, éste último le sirve de forraje para alimentar a sus animales. Se siente muy contenta de la tarea que realiza ya que le permite solventar sus gastos familiares y en adelante desea tener un establo para criar reses. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de madera y mejorar los galpones de sus cuyes.
texts.en:
39-year old Guillerma and her two children in their own house. Even as a child she learned all about farming, and for the last five years she has had a farm. She raises guinea pigs and sells them on a weekly basis. In addition, she grows potatoes, corn, and alfalfa--the latter is used to feed her animals. Guillerma feels very content with her job as she knows it allows her to pay for family expenses. In the future she would like to have a shed in which to raise cows. 

This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is happy to know that she has this financial support and has always been very responsible with the repayments. Guillerma is grateful to be part of her community bank because all the members are responsible, committed people. Likewise she is grateful to the donors who provide the loan money which will help greatly with the progress of her business. 

She plans to use the loan to buy wood and improve the guinea pig cages.

loans.use: to buy wood to construct guinea pig cages.

loans.name: Trabajando Por El Futuro Group

texts.es: EDAPROSPO, tiene una nueva alcancía Comunal que se hacen llamar “Trabajando por el Futuro” conformada por 7 personas muy responsables, quienes  decidieron  cambiar su futuro ya que solicitaron un  préstamo, algunos para emprender un negocio y otros para invertir en su negocio. Tal es el caso de Zenobia quien tiene 34 años de edad es casada, tienes dos hijos aun menores de edad y es la tesorera del grupo. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como: yogurt, jugos, gaseosas y galletas, aparte de vender en su bodega ella se encarga de repartir pan por las mañanas. Zenobia juntamente con su esposo trabajan arduamente y con el resultado de su trabajo lograron comprar un auto el cual lo emplean para trabajar en transporte público local, él se encarga de cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos y la comida mientras que Zenobia se encarga de cubrir los gastos de la casa como: luz agua teléfono y otros gastos más. A Zenobia le gustaría comprarse un carro más grande para transporte público y por eso ella y su esposo  trabajan con el fin de lograr dicho objetivo. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a los socios en el momento del desembolso en nuestras instalaciones, en donde concurrieron con sus menores hijos y  los dos socios de los extremos derecho e izquierdo asistieron acompañados de su madre.
texts.en:
A new group has joined Kiva partner EDAPROSPERO’s community bank. The group is called Trabajando por el Futuro (Working for the Future) and comprises seven very responsible people who have decided to work for a better future so they are seeking a loan. Some wish to start a new business; others wish to invest in their current businesses. 

34-year old Zenobia fits into the latter category. She is married, has two children, and is the group’s treasurer. She runs a small grocery store out of her house and plans to use the money to buy more merchandise such as yogurt, juice, soft drinks, and cookies. As well as running the store, she delivers bread in the mornings.

Zenobia and her husband work very hard and as a result have managed to buy a car which they use to provide a local taxi service. Her husband is responsible for paying for the children’s education and food, while Zenobia is responsible for expenses such as electricity, water, telephone etc. She would love to buy a bigger vehicle, and this is one of the couple’s goals. 

In the photograph you can see the group members during the time of loan distribution in EDAPROSPERO’s office. Some of their young children are also present. The two members on the extreme right and left have brought their mothers along.

loans.use: to buy yogurt, juice, soft drinks, and cookies

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena has been cooking and serving typical Peruvian dishes for about twenty years. During the summer months, January to March, she prepares food and sells it from the patio in front of her house. From April to December she rents space at a market near her house where she is able to sell her food to a larger number of customers. Every Saturday and Sunday she prepares Cebiche, a typical Peruvian dish made of fresh seafood, onion, cilantro and lime. Filomena's loan will help her purchase ingredients for her recipes and also cover the costs to rent space in the market. 

Filomena is in her mid sixties and is a loving wife, mother and grandmother. She enjoys her work but has had to take it easy the past couple of months due to a bad leg that prevents her from being on her feet all day. Now that her leg is feeling better she is getting ready for the winter months when there is a larger demand for her dishes. 

This will be Filomena's 22nd loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA.
texts.en:
Filomena has been cooking and serving typical Peruvian dishes for about twenty years. During the summer months, January to March, she prepares food and sells it from the patio in front of her house. From April to December she rents space at a market near her house where she is able to sell her food to a larger number of customers. Every Saturday and Sunday she prepares Cebiche, a typical Peruvian dish made of fresh seafood, onion, cilantro and lime. Filomena's loan will help her purchase ingredients for her recipes and also cover the costs to rent space in the market. 

Filomena is in her mid sixties and is a loving wife, mother and grandmother. She enjoys her work but has had to take it easy the past couple of months due to a bad leg that prevents her from being on her feet all day. Now that her leg is feeling better she is getting ready for the winter months when there is a larger demand for her dishes. 

This will be Filomena's 22nd loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA.

loans.use: Purchasing food and renting market space

loans.name: Las Bombon Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA LAS BOMBON, ELIGIERON ESTE NOMBRE PORQUE DICEN SER TODAS MUY GUAPAS, LO CUAL ES SIGNO DE ALTA AUTOESTIMA, ESTA UBICADO EN JILOTEPEC, ESTADO DE MÉXICO, LA COLONIA ES MUY ANTIGUA, ANTES ERA CONSIDERADA PUEBLO ALEDAÑO DE JILOTEPEC, LA GENTE DE ESTA COLONIA ES MUY RESERVADA Y CELOSA DE SUS VECINOS LO CUAL NOS MUESTRA SIGNO DE CONFIANZA EN EL GRUPO. ESTE GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR POR 10 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN CRÉDITO. MARTHA YAZMIN F.  ES LA PRESIDENTE DEL GRUPO, ESTUDIO EL BACHILLERATO Y TIENE 2 HIJOS; EL PRESTAMO LO INVERTIRÁ EN ROPA PARA AYUDAR A LA ECONMIA DE SU FAMILIA Y ASÍ TENER UN MEJOR FUTURO.
texts.en:
This groups is called “Las Bombon” [The Sweeties] because they have confidence in their attractiveness, which is a sign of high self-esteem, and it is from the colony of Jilotepec, Mexico State. The colony is very old and it used to be considered a suburb. Its people are very reserved and zealous which inspires confidence in the group.

The group is made up of 10 members and it is the first time it has requested a loan. Martha Yazmin F. is the president.  She studied through high school and has two children. She will buy clothing and hopes to improve her family financial situation and their future.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael G. is the owner and manager of Ismael Trucking Service, Inc., a hauling and excavation business.  Ismael manages day-to-day operations of the business, with his wife handling business finances.  In addition to the two of them, there is also a part-time driver who helps when needed.  
Ismael describes his business as a “do-it-all” outfit because of its diverse clients and the wide array of services it provides.  The business originally began as a hauling service, and Ismael would set up contracts with companies or individuals that needed material removed from a site.  Ismael had one truck with which he did all the hauling, and he grew his business by word of mouth.  

A few years ago, Ismael was able to purchase a backhoe, expanding the work his business could do.  The backhoe lets him to dig ditches for electrical lines, clear away trees and brush, break up concrete and excavate for houses, just to name a few of its uses.  For the competive industry in which Ismael operates, possesing such capabilities makes his business more attractive to clients.

Ismael is using the money from this loan to meet pressing business expenses.  He does not take any upfront payment for work he does, because of the negative image it would portray to customers.  He believes it builds respectability for his business when he waits to collect payment until a job’s completion.  This loan will allow him to buy materials needed for jobs, as well as help him with meeting other pressing operational costs such as payroll.  Business has been slow over the past few months due to the economy and inclement winter weather (when it rains, work grinds to a halt until the ground dries).  All of this puts pressure on cash flow, and affects Ismael’s ability to take on new business.  Ismael says were it not for this loan, he would have had to sell some of his equipment.

Ismael and his wife have 5 children, the latest of which are 18 month old twin boys.  Despite all the work that comes with maintaining and growing a small business, Ismael and his wife make family a priority.  They enjoy helping the kids with their schoolwork, and encourage their children to be active in extracurricular activities.

loans.use: Materials for already undertaken projects, payroll and other operational expenses

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 32 años, es separada y vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era una niña, sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar la tierra y  hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de ingreso económico. Todos los días se esfuerza por lograr mejorar su casa, ayuda bastante a sus padres, en la siembra y al mismo tiempo cuida de los suyos, ya que cuenta con sus propios terrenos cultivando papa, maíz y alfalfa. Para ella es un gran apoyo que su familia participe de la temporada de cosecha y siembra. Su cosecha lo lleva a vender al por mayor en el mercado de su zona, de esa manera es más rentable sus ventas con mayores ganancias. Su deseo es tener más extensiones de terreno para seguir adelante. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar papa y alfalfa.
texts.en:
32-year old Raquel is separated and lives with her son in her parents’ house. She has worked in farming ever since she was a young girl. Her parents taught her how to farm, and today this is how she earns her living. Every day she makes an effort to make improvements to the house, and she helps her parents a great deal in their fields as well as her own where she grows potatoes, corn, and alfalfa.

It helps Raquel greatly that the whole family participates at seed sowing and harvest time. She sells the produce at the local wholesale market. It’s a profitable business and she gets a good income from it.

Raquel’s goal is to acquire more land so she can have a better future. This is her ninth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is happy to know that she has this financial support; she has always been very responsible with the repayments. Guillerma is grateful to be part of her community bank because all the members are responsible committed people. Likewise she is grateful to the donors who provide the loan money which will help greatly with the progress of her farm. 

She plans to use the loan to buy bags of fertilizer for the potato and alfalfa crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 60 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 32 años de experiencia en la  ganadería y la agricultura, junto con su esposo sacaron adelante a sus hijos que ahora son mayores de edad y ahora  sigue dedicándose a estas tareas  para  apoyar a los menores que aun están estudiando, siembra papa, maíz, trigo y habas, adicionado a esto cría animales de ganado vacuno ovino y ahora intensifica la crianza de animales menores, principalmente los pollos que tiene en su misma granja, es así que tiene  muchas posibilidades de salir, en la actualidad su esposo es la ayuda principal que tiene y desea seguir dedicándose a esta labor hasta donde sigan dando sus fuerzas. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y cuyes.
texts.en:
Segundina is 60 years old and she lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She has 32 years of experience in raising cattle and farming. Together with her husband she has brought up her children, who are now grown up, but she continues with this work to support the youngest children who are still studying. 

She plants potatoes, corn, wheat and beans, and she also rears cattle and sheep. Currently she is rearing smaller livestock, mainly chickens, which she keeps on her farm. Thus she has many opportunities to make progress.  At the moment, her husband is her main helper and she wants to continue with her work as long as she is able. 

This is Segundina's seventh loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always proved herself responsible in making her repayments. Also, she likes to be part of the community bank because all members are responsible and very supportive. She thanks all those who will be helping out with the loan, which will be very useful in developing her business. 

Segundina will use this loan to buy pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and guinea pigs

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is 32 years old and has 4 children, including a new 2-week old baby. She is a member of the communal bank "Solidaridad" and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 6 years now. She will be using her loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy children's clothing in Lima to sell in Ayacucho. One day she would like to be able to open a small grocery store in her home. Sandra enjoys working with FINCA because they have a simple loan process and provide savings and education.

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Maximiliana Eustaquia

texts.es:
La señora Maximiliana es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, ubicado en el Distrito de callería, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y lo hace en un triciclo cerca a un grifo, ésta actividad la realiza desde las 10 am. 
Con este nuevo préstamo de 1,300.00 nuevos soles, comprará: una vitrina para poner sus dulces, 3 cajas de néctar, 3 cajas de gaseosa, 2 paquetes de agua sin gas, 1 paquete de agua con gas.
La señora maximiliana vive con sus hijos que todavía están estudiando y es por eso es que tiene que trabajar duro para poder dar a sus hijos lo que necesitan.  Su esposo es empleado público y no alcanza su sueldo para solventar todos los gastos que demanda una familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maximiliana is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of 2000) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. Maximiliana sells drinks from a tricycle cart located near a gas station. Her business opens at 10am.

With this new loan of 1300 PEN she will buy a display case for storing sweets, three cases of nectar, three cases of soda, two cases of non-carbonated water, and one case of carbonated water.

Sra. Maximiliana lives with her children who are still in school. For this reason, she must work hard in order to provide what they need. Her husband is a public employee and does not earn enough to cover all of the family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase  a display case for storing sweets, three cases of nectar, three cases of soda, two cases of non-carbonated water, and one case of carbonated water

loans.name: Fanny De Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny O. es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive por la parroquia de San Joaquín en donde su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y en su mayor parte a la agricultura siendo el lugar de mayor productividad.

La Señora Fanny tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene  3 hijos de 20, 18 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija  estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en una compañía de transportes, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Doña Fanny es directora de ventas de los productos Yanbal, actividad que desempeña hace 5 años y labora de lunes a viernes con horario de oficina.

Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 6 años,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Su meta es  tener una nueva sucursal.
texts.en:
Sra. Fanny O. is a member of the Yanbal Communal Bank. She lives in the parish of San Joaquín where some of the residents engage in trade and raising animals. However, most of the people are farmers since this is a place of great bounty.

Sra. Fanny is 39 years old, married, and has three children (ages 20, 18, and 14). Her eldest daughter is at the university while the two younger children attend high school in the city. Fanny’s husband is a professional driver who works for a transportation fleet. She and her husband were able to build their own home.

Doña Fanny is a sales director of Yanbal products. She has been in this business for five years and works regular office hours Monday through Friday. Fanny has been with her Communal Bank for six years. She will invest her loan in perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and trinkets. Her goal is to open a new branch.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and trinkets

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 6 hijos.  Genara no pudo estudiar. 
Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 12 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con éste dinero pudo  comprar cinco corderos su actividad consiste en la compra y venta de ganado ovino y porcino, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y trabajos eventuales  en construcción.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 2500.00 nuevo soles, comprará ganado ovino y porcino.
Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio y dar estudios a sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la capacitación y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Genara is a member of the Communal Bank “Túpac Amaru” which is located in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, and has six children. Genara was not able to obtain an education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for twelve years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN. The money was used to purchase five lambs for her business of buying and selling livestock, such as sheep and pigs. Her husband is a farmer, but he also takes temporary construction jobs.

With this loan of 2500 PEN, Genara will buy sheep and pigs. Her dream is to improve her business and provide her children with an education. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the training classes and the interest from her savings.

loans.use: Purchase sheep & pigs

loans.name: Raúl Noe

texts.es:
Raúl es padre de familia de 35 años de edad. Vive en su casa propia pequeña que adquirió recientemente. Aun no cuenta con energía eléctrica ni agua potable. Vive con su esposa y sus tres hijas en el distrito La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Raúl se dedica al servicio de lavado, pulverizado y encerado de autos, combis, motos y otros tipos de vehículos. Lleva casi tres años dirigiendo este negocio. Raul desea comprar una motobomba de agua lo que ayudaría proveer un mejor servicio de lavado. También podría lavar más vehículos en menos tiempo y lograr mayores ingresos del trabajo.

Raúl desea realizar mejoras a su casa lo que permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida. Para lograr su objetivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y familiares. La gente que lo conoce dice que es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 35 year old father. He recently acquired a small house that lacks electricity and potable water. Raúl lives with his wife and three daughters in the District of La Victoria, which is twenty minutes away from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Raúl provides a service that involves washing, polishing, and waxing automobile, buses, motorcycles, and other types of vehicles. He has been in this business for almost three years. Raúl wants to buy a power washer so that he can provide better service. This will enable him to wash more vehicles in less time as well as generate more revenue.

Raúl also wants to make improvements to his home so that he can raise his standard of living. To accomplish this goal, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. He presents good personal and family references. The people who know Raúl say that he is a father who is devoted to his family and always concerned about their welfare and development.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Fabiola Rocio

texts.es: La señora Fabiola Rocio Fernández F. realiza la actividad de venta de ropa hace varios años además trabaja en un fundo Floridablanca como obrera, gracias a sus ingresos económicos a logrado una buena acumulación de bienes. Solicitante requiere del crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que comienza la campaña escolar, requiere comprar uniformes, zapatos de colegio y otras cosas más. Se propone acceder al crédito por que presenta buen record crediticio en otros Bancos.
texts.en:
Sra. Fabiola Rocio Fernández F. has been selling clothes for several years. She also works at the Florida Blanca Estate as a farm worker. Thanks to her earnings, she has been able build up assets.

Fabiola is requesting a loan to invest in her business since the school year is starting. She needs to buy uniforms, school shoes, and other items. Fabiola is being recommended for this loan because she has a good credit record with other banks.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy uniforms, school schools, and other items

loans.name: Vilma Beatriz

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del  Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad.  Ella es con conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Gracias a su empeño pudo estudiar la  primaria completa. 
Viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles lo utilizó para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, lo cual era y es la venta de habas seca, producto que es comprado en Bolivia para vender en la feria de Yunguyo, también se dedica a la venta de combustible, esto gracias al apoyo de su esposo.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará ocho galones de gasolina para vende al por menor.
Su sueño es tener un carro y una tienda de abarrotes. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la puntualidad y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Túpac Amaru” which is located in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Thanks to her efforts, she was able to finish her elementary school education.

Vilma has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN. The money was used to increase the inventory of her business selling dry goods. She buys her products in Bolivia and sells them at the fair in Yunguyo. Vilma also sells gasoline with the help of her husband.

With this loan of 500 PEN, Vilma will buy eight gallons of gasoline to sell at retail. Her dreams include having a car and opening a grocery store. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the punctuality and being able to share with the other members.

loans.use: Purchase eight gallons of gasoline to sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Erminda Ysabel

texts.es:
Erminda es soltera, tiene 34 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad. Viven en casa propia en el distrito de La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a la crianza da patos en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, y cuando los patos ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso ideal, ella los vende todas las semanas a distintos restaurantes que se ubica en su distrito. 

A Erminda le gustaría contruir nuevos corrales y asi ampliar el número de los corrales logrando un buen desarrollo. Actualmente, cuenta con ocho corrales y desea conseguir mucho más con su crédito. Para lograr su objetivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles.

 Erminda es muy trabajadora y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Erminda is 34 years old, single, and has a ten year old son. They live in their own home in the District of La Victoria, which is twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Erminda raises ducks in an area behind her home. She feeds them grains and natural grasses. When the ducks have reached the right size and ideal weight, she sells them on a weekly basis to different restaurants in her district.

Erminda enjoys building new pens so that she can increase her numbers and achieve a well-developed business. She currently has eight pens and wants to use her loan to continue building more. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Erminda is an extremely hard worker and presents very good personal and business references.

loans.use: Build new pens for her ducks

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 8 hijos, todos independientes.  Ella pudo estudiar solo hasta la primaria pero no la pudo concluir.
La señora tiene un puesto en el mercado 15 de agosto de la ciudad de Yunguyo, donde ofrece productos diversos como cierres, candados, espejos, escobillas y muchos otros, dichos productos los compra de Tacna y Desaguadero. Ella está empezando a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos recientemente y solicitará un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles,  plata que invertirá en su negocio, comprará cuatro cajas de candado  Nro. 50.
Su sueño es  mejorar en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la alegría de las demás socias y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Valeriana is a member of the Community Bank "Túpac Amaru", located in the Yunguyo district and province, in the Puno department. She is 58 years old, widowed and has 8 children who are all independent. She was only able to study through primary school and could not finish. 

She has a booth in the market on August 15th in the city of Yunguyo, where she is going to offer various products such as: latches, locks, mirrors, brushes, and much more. She purchases these products from Tacna and Desaguadero (the border of Bolivia). She is starting to work with the recent Manuela Ramos Movement and is requesting a loan of 500.00 soles, that she will invest in her business. She will buy 4 boxes of locks, a quantity of 50. 

Her dream is to improve her business.  What she likes most about her Community Bank is the joy of the other members and the training lectures.

loans.use: She will buy 4 boxes of locks; a quantity of 50.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: doña María R. jiron es trabajadora de Enacal Masaya, ella vive en el costado este del parque de Masaya, ella quiere el dinero para mejora de vivienda
texts.en: Mrs. Maria R. Jiron is an Enaca Masaya worker and lives in the East side of the Masaya Park. She is requesting a loan to upgrade her house.

loans.use: Housing upgrade

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es:
Reyes es un padre de familia de 40 años de edad. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos en el caserío Vallecito. Se ubica en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 15 años, se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de cereales, maíz y limón. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar estos productos. Vende sus productos a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Reyes cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga del sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Reyes desea sembrar más maíz amarillo y mantener el cultivo de limón. Para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles.

Reyes es un hombre bastante trabajadoro y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir adelantando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyes is a 40 years old father living in his own house in Vallecito with his wife and four children.  It’s located in Tambogrande district, a farming zone located in Piura district over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

For the last 15 years he has farmed and sold cereals, corn and lemons.  He has a field where he tends to plant these crops.  He sells his products to merchants that visit the zone.  Reyes has an established customer base.  Income from this activity is used to support his family.

Reyes wants to plant more yellow corn and care for his lemon crops.  To assure a good harvest, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1600 new sol loan.

Reyes is quite a hard working man who’s devoted to his family.  His greatest wish is to continue improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To plant more corn.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es: Guillerma tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años se dedica al transporte, su esposo es el que conduce y cubre la ruta desde su zona hasta la ciudad más aledaña, esto le permite tener ingresos estables ya que este servicio  cubre en horarios determinados. Adicionalmente a esto también se dedica a la agricultura donde cultiva papa y maíz; de la misma forma se dedica también en la venta de animales en una feria ganadera de su localidad. Todas estas actividades constituye un ingreso estable en su economía que le permite vivir de manera estable, es por esta razón que continuará adelante brindando este servicio con la proyección de adquirir otra movilidad más. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. En esta oportunidad podrá comprar algunos repuestos menores para su carro y también  comprará más animles ovino para su venta de animales.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 41, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  For over five years she’s been dedicated to public transportation services.  Her husband’s the driver and covers the route between his zone and the closest city.  This produces steady income because the service is provided on a fixed schedule. 

In addition to this, she also farms potatoes and corn as well as raises animals to sell at a livestock market in her locality.  All of these activities constitute a stable income for her economy that allows her to live in a stable manner and this is the reason she will continue providing this service with the goal in mind of acquiring a second vehicle in the future.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always been responsible with her payments.  She also enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive people.  

She thanks all those who will fund the loan she’s requesting for it will be very useful for her business’ progress.

On this occasion she will buy some replacement parts for her car and also buy some sheep for her animal sales.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Yonny Daniel

texts.es: El señor U. Gonzáles Yonny Daniel se dedica a la labor de chofer de mototaxi la cual es propia también trabaja como albañil de tal manera cuenta con dos ingresos. Vive en casa familiar conjuntamente con sus padres ya que es soltero no tiene carga familiar. Solicita el crédito para realizarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi. Presenta buenas referencias ya que su mamá es cliente de la Caja Señor de Luren lo cual está pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mr. Yonny Daniel U. Gonzáles works as a mototaxi driver; he owns the mototaxi.  He also works as a bricklayer so he has two sources of income.  He lives in the family home with his parents since he’s single and doesn’t have a family of his own to support yet.

He is asking for a loan for mototaxi service and repair.  He has good references since his mother is a Caja Señor de Luren client and is repaying punctually.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Rosa  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo.  Rosa pudo estudiar la secundaria pero no culminarla. 
Viaja semanalmente a la ciudad de La Paz – Bolivia llevando diferentes tipos de producto, que a continuación se detallan: tunta (papa procesada), chuño (papa procesada), frazadas y otras veces pescado; las frazadas las encarga comprar en Juliaca y el resto del los productos lo compra en desaguadero. Hace un año viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de cinco arrobas de chuño blanco.
Con éste  préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro quintales de tunta y así seguir creciendo en su negocio.
 Su sueño es mejorar cada vez más y más en su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la capacitación y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” communal bank located in Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 26 years old, lives with partner and has a son.  Rosa was able to start middle school but did not finish it.

She travels weekly to La Paz, Bolivia to take a variety of products listed below: tunta (processed potato), chuño, (processed potato), blankets and sometimes fish.  She buys the blankets in Juliaca and the rest of the products in Desaguadero.  

She’s been collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement for a year.  Her initial loan was for 500 new soles that she used to buy five arrobas (1 arroba=11.5 kilos) of white chuño.  She will use this 1500 new sol loan to buy four quintals of tunta to continue growing with her business.

Her dream is to improve her business more and more each time.  What she likes about the communal bank is the training and the profits on savings.

loans.use: To buy four quintals of dehydrated, frozen potato.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 47 años D. edad.
Paulina no pudo estudiar y se casó muy joven ahora tiene  tres hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo recibido fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  con este dinero compró una vaquita, en aquel entonces el precio no era tan elevado como ahora.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras, productos que compra en Yunguyo directo a los mayoristas par luego revenderlos al por menor.
Con éste préstamo D. S/ 700.00 nuevo soles, podrá comprar ocho arrobas D. zanahoria,  cinco D. cebolla, tomate, lechuga y otros.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar en grupo y compartir con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” communal bank located in Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 47 years old.  She was unable to go to school, married young and now has three children.

She has been collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement for 10 years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to buy a cow; back then the price wasn’t as high as it is today.  Presently, she’s a fruit and vegetable merchant, products she buys in Yunguyo district direct from wholesalers for subsequent sale at retail.

She will use this 700 new sol loan to buy 8 arrobas of carrots, five of onions, tomatoes, lettuce and others.

Her dream is to stay in business and improve income.  What she enjoys about the communal bank is teamwork and sharing with her fellow members.

loans.use: She will buy 8 arrobas (1 arroba=11.5 kilos) of carrots, five of onions, tomato, lettuce and others.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos.  María no pudo estudiar.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con éste dinero compró ovejas para seguir operando con su negocio, tiene como actividad económica la compra y venta de ganado ovino, además se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y la agricultura, debido a que su esposo viene radicando buen tiempo en la ciudad de Arica – Chile.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará un torito de raza Bronzuis.
Su sueño es comprarse un auto. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad de los préstamo y compartir la alegría con las demás socias.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” communal bank located in Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 55 years old, married and has 7 children.  She was unable to go to school.

She has been collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to buy sheep to continue in business; her business is sheep raising.  She also raises cattle and farms because her husband has been living in Arica, Chile for some time now.

She will use this 3000 new sol loan to buy a Brown Swiss bullock.  

Her dream is to buy a car.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of loans and to share joy with the other members.

loans.use: She will buy a Brown Swiss bullock.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia tiene  36 años, es madre soltera y vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, posee un espacio de terreno en donde siembra papa, maíz y pastizales para sus animales. Trabaja diariamente para asegurarse una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá recuperar lo invertido. Ella siempre esta al pendiente de sus tierras agrícolas, en lo posible lo cuida de posibles plagas de insectos que puedan afectar seriamente su inversión. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que puede disponer de sus propios horarios y que tiene guardado reservas de alimentos de sus cosechas anteriores, por lo que es una gran ayuda económica. Sus planes a seguir es cultivar sus terrenos y tener un establo para criar animal vacuno y ovino. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un torete para engordarlo y venderlo a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Herminia, 36, is a single mother living with her three children in her own house.  For over 10 years now she’s been in agriculture.  She owns a field where she grows potatoes, corn and pasturage for her animals.  She works daily to assure a good harvest that will allow her to recoup her investment.  She is always watching over her farmlands doing everything possible to avoid insect infestations that can seriously affect her investment.  What she likes about her work is that she can set her own schedules and that she has food in reserve from previous harvests which is a big economic help.  Her plan is to continue farming and to have a stable to raise cattle and sheep in.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial help and she also enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive people.

She thanks all those who will fund the loan she’s asking for because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the loan to buy a bullock to fatten up for later sale at a better price.

loans.use: To buy a small bullock to fatten up and sell at a higher price.

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Mechoacan Group

texts.es:
Santa C. D. Mechoacan este grupo se llama así porque todas sus integrantes viven en el barrio santa C. y su localidad es Santa Catarina Mechoacan es por el cual le denominaron así. Todas las integrantes se dedican a una actividad economica el cual le ayuda a sobrevivir economicamente, estas mujeres son D. raza indigena y trabajadoras y honradaz. Las personas D. este grupo es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo, y lo solicitaron debido a la necsidad que tenian D. comprar mas insumos para la elaboracion D. sus productos.
La señora Angelica es la que oragnizo este grupo ya que su hermana le comento sobre la fundacion, ya que su hermana pertenence a otro grupo y por ello que les hizo la inviatcion y con ello empezaron a reunir personas hasta que formaron el grupo que esta integrado por 10 personas.
La representante D. este grupo es la señora Angelica Beatriz C. D. O. D. 22 años D. edad vive en union libre con el señor Ferdi Martinez, ella tan solo tiene un hijo D. un año D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. antojitos y a la elaboracion D. totopos (tortillas doradas) es por ello que solicito el prestamo para comprar insumos para la elaboracion D. antojitos y totopos, las ganancias que obtiene los utiliza para su hijo y para ayudar en los gastos del hogar. 
En esta ocasion comentare respecto a la señora Ilda M. C. D. 34 años D. edad esat casada con el señor Rufino G. D. O. quien tiene el oficio D. policia. La señora Ilda tiene 3 hijos quienes estudian, dos estudian la secundaria y uno la primaria.
La señora Ilda comenta que es la primera vez que solicita un prestamo y esto surgio debido a la necesidad que tenia D. comprar mas insumos para la venta D. tamales, los tamales que realiza son: mole D. pollo, cerdo en salsa verD., mole D. camaron, pollo en salsa verD., etc.
Hilda comenta que su esposo la convencio para integrarse al grupo ya que ella tenia miedo D. no poder realizar los pagos ya que ahí dias en que ahí ventas y otras que no, pero su esposo le dijo que la ayudaria a pagarlos y pues para que no se le hiciera mucho que solo solicitara poco dinero. Ella dice que su esposo siempre la apoya en todo.
Ella desea engrandecer su negocio ya que es una actividad que le ayuda mucho para sustentar a su familia sobre todo a sus hijos que estan estudiando, ya que ella quiere que sus hijos tengan una profesion.
Las integrantes D. este grupo son las siguientes y tienen las respectivas actividades economicas:
Rosalba C. D. O.: D. 35 años D. edad se dedica a la venta D. compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Angelica Beatriz C. D. O.: D. 22 años D. edad se dedica a la venta D. compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Lucia C. C.: D. 30 años D. edad se D. se dedica a la venta D. compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Soledad Q. C.
Estela G. G.: D. 28 años D. edad se D. se dedica a la venta D. compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Ignacia Q. H.: D. 35 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. tostadas para la venta.
Altagracia Q. C.: D. 40 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. tacos para la venta.
Celerina G. D. O.: D. 31 años D. edad se dedica a la compra D. pollos para la venta.
Ilda  M. C.: D. 34 años D. edad se D. se dedica a la venta D. compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
Cesilia D. O. Q.: D. 58 años D. edad se D. se dedica a la venta D. compra D. insumos para la venta D. antojitos.
texts.en:
This group is called "Santa C. D. Mechoacan" because its members live in the Santa C. neighborhood, located in Santa Catarina, Mechoacan so that's why they named it that.  All of the members do something that helps them manage economically.  These women are indigenous, hard workers, and honorable.  This is the first time the members of this group are taking out loans; they are taking out loans because they need to buy supplies to make their products.  

Mrs. Angelica is the one who organized the group since her sister told her about the foundation.  Her sister belongs to another group, hence the invitation.  With this, she began to gather people to form the group that is maD. up of ten members.

Mrs. Angelica Beatriz D. O., 22, is the group's representative.  She lives with her partner, Mr. Ferdi Martinez and only has one child who is one years  old.  She sells snacks for a living and makes totopos (golden tortillas) which is why she is taking out a loan to buy ingredients to make snacks and totopos.  She uses the income she earns for her son and to help with household expenses.  

Now I will talk about Mrs. Ilda M. C., 34, married to Mr. Rufino G. D. O. who works as a police officer. Mrs. Ilda has three children in school.  Two are in high school and one in graD. school.  Mrs.IIda says that this is her first loan and it's because she needs to buy supplies for the sale of tamales.  She makes the following tamales:  chicken mole, pork in green sauce, shrimp mole, chicken in green sauce, etc.  Hilda says her husband convinced her to join the group since she was afraid she wouldn't be able to make the payments since there are days when there are sales and others none.  But her husband told her he would help her with the payments and so he wouldn't have to do much, she is only asking for a little bit of money.  She says her husband has always supported her in everything.  She wishes to grow her business since it's work that really helps to support her family and above all her children who are studying as she wants her kids to have a profession.

The members of this group are the following and have their respective economic activities: Rosalba O. Teller: 35 years old is dedicated to the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Angelica O. Beatriz Teller: 22 years of age is engaged in the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Lucia C. C.: 30 years of age is engaged in the sale of the purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Estela C. Q. Soledad G. G.: 28 years of age is engaged in the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Ignacia Q. H.: 35 years old is purchases materials for the manufacture of chips for sale. Altagracia Q. Cashier: 40 years of age purchases materials for making tacos for sale. Celerina G. O.: 31 years of age purchases chickens for sale. Ilda M. Cashier: 34 years of age is engaged in the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks. Q. O. Cesilia: The 58-year-old is engaged in the sale of purchase of materials for the sale of snacks.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to sell appetizers.

loans.name: Freddy Wilson

texts.es:
Freddy de 48 años, es un microempresario que vende arroz por quintal y en ocasiones trabaja como peluquero para tener ingresos adicionales. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su ventas por eso quiere continuar con el negocio de venta de quintales de arroz. Trabaja desde las 07h00am vendiendo por el sector donde vive el arroz a un valor aproximado a $ 32.00. Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo quintales de arroz para darles mas oportunidades a sus tres hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal. En el futuro quiere tener un local grande y surtido para la venta del arroz.
texts.en: Freddy, 48, is a small businessman who sells quintals of rice and sometimes works as a hairdresser for extra income.  He has a lot of aspirations for his sales and therefore wants to continue with the business selling quintals of rice.  He works from 7:00 a.m. selling rice in his neighborhood for approximately $32.00.  He wants to continue with his business, therefore, he wants to buy quintals of rice with the loan in order to give his three children more opportunities to study in a public school.  In the future he wants to have a big store that is well stocked to sell rice.

loans.use: Rice.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene tres hijos.   Juana no pudo estudiar.
El trabajo de la señora consiste en la venta de ají y tunta (papa procesada), productos que compra desde desaguadero y como lugar de venta  tiene pues a la ciudad de La paz Bolivia. Hace siete años esta trabajando  con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el préstamo recibido por primera vez que fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, pudo utilizar para comprar tres arrobas de ají.
Ahora recibirá nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que  invertirá en la compra de mercadería entre ellos tres arrobas de ají y un quintal de tunta, de hoy en adelante trabajara junto con su hija, es decir viajaran las dos. 
Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio y tener casa en Yunguyo. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la capacitación que recibe por parte de la Promotora.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” communal bank located in Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She’s 37 years old, married and has three children.  Juana was unable to go to school.

Her work consists in chili pepper and tunta (processed potato) sales, products she buys in Desaguadero and sells in the city of La Paz, Bolivia.  She’s been collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to buy three arrobas of chili pepper.

She will now get a new, 500 new sol, loan to buy merchandise among which will be: three arrobas of chili peppers, one quintal of tunta.  From today on she will work with her daughter, that is, they will travel together.

Her dream is to improve in her business and have a house in Yunguyo.  What she likes about the communal bank is the training she gets from her advisor.

loans.use: To buy merchandise among which will be three arrobas (1 arroba=11.5 kilos) of chili peppers and one quintal of tunta (dehydrated, frozen potato)

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad. Reside junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Barrio Libre. Se ubica en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace cuatro años, María ha dirigido una pequeña bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de su madre así que conoce el rubro a la perfección. Ofrece a una clientela ya establecida en la zona artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Con su negocio, ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María desea ampliar su bodega comprando más mercadería con la finalidad de incrementar sus productos y obtener más ventas diarias. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles. 

María es una mujer bastante trabajadora y encargada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
María is the 36 year old mother of a family.  She lives together with her husband and their four children in her own home, in the rural part of the small town Barrio Libre.  It is located in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area that is located in the province Piura, a little more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For the past 4 years,  María has run a small store in her own home.  She learned this work from her mother, and so she knows the field to perfection.  She sells to an established clientele in the area, selling articles of basic necessity and groceries.  With her business, she helps her husband with the economic support of the family.

María wants to grow her store, buying more merchandise with the goal of increasing her products and obtaining more daily sales.  Therefore, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles.

María is a pretty hardworking woman, responsible for her family.  The people who know her hold her in high esteem.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Itacuan Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Itacuan” se llama así porque sus integrantes son originarias de la población la Cruz del Itacuan, Itacuan en mixteco significa flor amarilla esta flor es muy conocida en estas regiones ya que es la flor que utilizan para adornar los altares en las fiestas de dia de muertos. Este grupo lleva varios ciclos y esta integrado por 10 mujeres las cuales se conocen bien puesto que han estado en los ciclos anteriores. Este grupo cuenta con un comité que los organiza para poder realizar los pagos y tramites que se van realizando en el transcurso de los pagos del préstamo. 
La representante de este grupo es la señora Araceli R. L. de 34 años de edad esta casada con el señor Fortino C. Martinez  ambos tienen 5 hijos que están estudiando la secundaria y primaria. L señora Araceli se dedica a la venta de pollos en pie y destazados es por eso que solicito el préstamo para poder comprar mas pollos y poderlos vender y de las ganancias que obtiene es para el apoyo economico de su familia y para realizar sus pagos y de igual manera para poder engrandecer mas su negocio y poder tener mas ingresos.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Matilde C. M. de 48 años de edad esta casada con el señor Nemesio C. Calderon de oficio campesino ambos tienen 4 hijos los cuales todos ya están casados. Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales actividad que aprendio a realizar gracias a su mama quien le enseño desde que era adolescente, ella empezó a realizar esta actividad hace mas de 15 años  debido a la necesidad que tenia para la educación de sus hijos.
La señora Matilde realiza diferentes tipos de tamales  como son: dulces, de manjar, de rajas con queso, mole de pollo, cerdo en salsa verde, mole de iguana, tichinda, mole de pescado, entre otros, realiza estos tamales todos los dias, cada día vende de 3 diferentes; es por ello que solicito el prestamo para poder comprar mas insumos para realizar sus tamales como son el maiz, hojas de elotes y los diferentes productos para poder realizar el guisado que llevara el tamal. Sus productos los vende en su población de manera ambulante y siempre acaba ya que sus tamales son muy deliciosos  y ella es muy reconocida en su población y es por ello que tiene muchos clientes.
Ella sueña con poner otro negocio que le deje un poco mas de ganancia ya que la elaboración de tamales es muy cansado y laborioso y deja pocas ganancias, pero pues tiene que seguir realizándolos debido a que es la manera de sobrevivir económicamente.
Es una mujer muy puntual en sus pagos y piensa seguir siendo así siempre. Agradece a las personas que le proporcionaron el apoyo del prestamo.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes: 
Heriberta Rafaela R. R.: De 42 años de edad ella se dedica a la compra de quesos para la venta.
Emma S. R.: De 54 años de edad se dedica a la compra de cerdos para la venta.
Francisca S. G.: De 40 años de edad se dedica a la compra de cerdos para la venta.
Elizabeth Soledad M. M.: De 21 años de edad se dedica a  la compra de ropa por catalogo para la venta.
Carmen C. M.: De 46 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Eufemia Ines M. M.: De 41 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollo para la venta.
Araceli R. L.: De 34 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollo para la venta.
Luisa S. S.: De 27 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollo para la venta.
Lucia C. Sachez: De 28 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa para la venta.
Matilde C. M.: De 48 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
texts.en:
The group 'Itacuan' calls itself this because its members are from the population of la Cruz del Itacuan.  In Mixteco (a local indigenous language), itacuan means yellow flower.  It is well known in these regions as it is a flower that is used to decorate alters in the festivals for the Day of the Dead.  This group has completed several loan cycles, and is made up of 10 women who know themselves to be as well prepared as they have been in the previous loan cycles.  This group includes a committee who organizes them in order to make payments and complete the processes for the repayment of the loan.

The representative of this group is Señora Araceli R. L..  She is 34 and is married to Señor Fortino C. Martinez.  Together they have 5 children who are studying in secondary or primary school.  Señora Araceli works selling live and butchered chickens.  This is what she is asking for a loan for, in order to buy more chickens and be able to sell them, and the earnings that she obtains are for the economic support of her family and to make her repayments, and by the same manner to be able to grow her business and have more income.

One of the members of this group is Señora Matilde C. M..  She is 48 years old and is married to Señor Nemesio C. Calderon.  He does farm work.  They have 4 children whom are all married.  She works selling tamales, work that she learned to do thanks to her mother, who taught her how when she was an adolescent.  She began doing this work more than 15 years ago because of what she needed to fund the education of her children.

Señora Matilde makes different types of tamales like:  sweet, delicious, onion and cheese, chicken mole, pork and green chili, iguana mole, tichinda, fish mole, among others.  She makes these tamales every day, and every day she sells 3 different ones.  This is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy more ingredients to make her tamales, like corn, corn leaves, and different products to be able to make the filling that fills the tamale.  She sells her products on foot in the town, and she always sells out as her tamales are very delicious and she is recognized for this in her town.  Because of this she has many customers.

Her dream is to be able to have another business that would make more profits.  Although making tamales is exhausting and laborious and provides small earnings, she has to continue making them as it is how she survives economically.  She is very punctual with her repayments and she plans to continue making them as always.  She is grateful to the people who give her help though the loan.

The people who make up this group are the following:
Heriberta Rafaela R. R.:  42 years old, she works making cheese for sale.
Emma S. R.:  54 years old, she works purchasing and reselling pigs.
Francisca S. G.::  40 years old, she works purchasing and reselling pigs.
Elizabeth Soledad M. M.:  21 years old, she works selling clothing by catalog.
Carmen C. M.:  46 years old, she buys ingredients to make and sell tamales.
Eufemia Ines M. M.: 41 years old, she buys chicken for resale.
Araceli R. L.:  34 years old, she buys chicken for resale.
Luisa S. S.:  27 years old, she buys chicken for resale.
Lucia C. Sachez:  48 years old, she buys clothing for resale.
Matilde C. M.:  48 years old, she buys ingredients to make and sell tamales.

loans.use: COMPRA DE POLLOS PARA LA VENTA DE POLLOS EN PIE Y DESTAZADOS

location.town: Cruz del Itacuan, Pinotepa Nacional; Oaxaca

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del  Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Irene no cuenta con estudios.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado ovino, dicha actividad la realiza en las diferentes ferias de Yunguyo. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, con lo que podrá comprar unas cinco unidades de ganado ovino para el engorde y la  venta del mismo.
Su sueño es  seguir con el mismo negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar y conversar en grupo con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the community bank “Tupac Amaru,” located in the district of Yunguyo, province of Yunguyo, department of Puno.  She is 50 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  Irene did not go to school.

She works buying and selling sheep.  She does this activity in different markets of Yunguyo.  She has worked with the Movement of Manuala Ramos for the past 4 years.  Her first loan was 300.00 nuevo soles, money that she invested in her business.

Currently, she is asking for a loan of 1500.00 nuevo soles, with which she will be able to buy 5 units of sheep to fatten and resell.

Her dream is to continue on with her business.  What she likes about the community bank is to work and talk in a group with the other members.

loans.use: To buy 5 units of sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 46 años D. edad, está  casada y tiene 9 hijos, ella estudió hasta cuarto D. primaria. 
Actualmente se dedica a la artesanía, es decir al tejido D. lijjllas , inkuñas y frazadas, solo atiene pedidos, no solamente trabaja con la artesanía sino también con engorD. D. ganado porcino. DesD. hace cinco años viene trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el préstamo recibido por primera vez fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra D. lana para elaborar productos ya mencionados.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará  ganado vacuno (un toro para su respectivo engorD.).
Su sueño es comprar un auto y trabajar duro ya que su esposo se encuentra en otra región trabajando como albañil (operario D. construcción).
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la capacitación que recibe  y la ganancia D. sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district, in Yunguyo province, in Puno department.  She is 46 years old, married, and has 9 children.  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Inés currently makes handicrafts.  She knits blankets, 'llijllas' and 'inkuñas' (the latter two products are traditional woollen squares that can be either worn or used to carry things in).  She makes these products to order.  However, she doesn't only make handicrafts.  Inés also fattens pigs.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she used that money to buy wool for making the products mentioned above.

Inés will use this new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy cattle (a bull to fatten).  Her dream is to buy a car and work hard since her husband is in another region working as a construction worker.

What Inés likes about her community bank is the training that she receives and the money that she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy cattle (a bull to fatten)

loans.name: Mariposas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Mariposas Emprendedoras, este nombre fue elegido porque para ellas como las mariposas les gusta buscar nuevos horizontes. Está ubicado en ixtlahuaca, México, L. comunidad se caracteriza por mantener sus raíces, L. lengua y vestimenta Mazahua. L. mayoría D. los habitantes se dedican a L. venta D. verduras que ellos mismos cultivan. El grupo está conformado por  11 miembros. Una D. las integrantes del grupo se llama Rosa María S., tiene 48 años, estudió hasta  L. secundaria, es ama D. casa y comerciante, elL. comenta que gracias a su negocio ha salido adelante, apoyando con los gastos D. su familia, elL. tiene 1 hijo varón D. 15 años. L. señora Rosa se dedica a L. venta D. verduras que elL. misma cultiva desD. hace 10 años. Su dedicación le ha permitido obtenga una mejor estabilidad familiar y económica, con el préstamo que obtenga elL. comprará los abonos y fertilizantes que necesita para el cultivo. L. señora sueña que algún día pueda incrementar sus cultivos para darle L. oportunidad a que su hijo tenga una educación profesional.
texts.en: This group is called Mariposas Emprendedoras ["Enterprising Butterflies"]. This name was chosen because the members, like butterflies, like to seek new horizons. It is located in Ixtlahuaca, México, a community which is noteworthy for maintaining its cultural roots, including the Mazahua language and traditional clothing. The majority of the inhabitants work selling vegetables which they grow themselves. The group is maD. up of 11 members. One of the group's members is named Rosa María S., and she is 48 years old. She studied up to secondary school, and she is a housewife and merchant. She comments that thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead, helping with her family's expenses. She has one 15-year-old son. Rosa has worked for 10 years selling vegetables that she grows herself. Her dedication has allowed her to achieve greater stability, both economically and for her family. With the loan she will obtain, she will buy the compost and fertilizers she needs for her crops. She dreams that some day she will be able to expand her crops, so that she can give her son the opportunity for a professional education.

loans.use: Buying compost and fertilizers for her vegetable crops

loans.name: Lorma

texts.es:
La señora Lorma Gutiérrez Hernández, vive en Chicoasen, Estado de Chiapas México. Vive en unión libre con el señor  José Gonzales Arévalo, con quien procreo dos hijos  quienes aun están a su responsabilidad: Edison de nueve años y Bridni de tres años.


      Ella invierte el préstamo  en la compra de zapatos por cátalo de la marca Andrea, en donde lleva  trabajando seis años, y comenta que le va bien ya que le deja buenos ingresos desde que inicio con esta pequeña actividad.
 

     En esto inicio por su propia  creatividad ya que para  obtener ingresos tiene que tener una actividad que le deje buenas ganancias y de ello poder superarse con su familia a un qué pequeña pero importante para ella.

 
    Con lo que vende está ahorrando para que  así logre agrandar su negocio y tener su propia zapatería  de la que pueda seguir trabajando y  así logra salir adelante.

 
    Su deseo es que  logre seguir trabajando para comprar material y construir su casa que es lo que más desea, como también darle lo mejor a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Lorma Gutiérrez Hernández lives in Chicoasen, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She lives with her common-law husband José Gonzales Arévalo and they have two children who are still in their care: 9 year-old Edison and 3 year-old Bridni.

Lorma is investing her loan in buying Andrea-brand shoes from a catalog.  She has been in this business for six years and she tells us that it is doing well and has made her good profits since she started.

Lorma started her business through her own creativity since, in order to make income, she needed a business activity that would make her good profits and allow her to get ahead in life with her family which, although small, is important to her.

When she sells products, Lorma also saves so that she can expand her business and one day own her own shoe store.  This will enable her to continue working and get ahead in life.

Lorma's wish is to continue working so that she can buy materials and build her own house.  This is what she most wishes for.  She would also like to be able to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: To buy Andrea-brand shoes through a catalog

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana tiene 34 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en su casa propia en la zona rural del caserío La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos. Cría los animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo se los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general.
