Aprendió esta actividad de su padre así que conoce a la perfección este rubro. 

Ana desea invertir su capital para adquirir más animales y alimentos balanceados con la finalidad de ampliar sus ventas. Por  ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her own home, in the small village of La Victoria, which is in a rural area, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For 10 years, Ana has been raising and selling small animals such as turkeys.  She raises the animals in an area behind her home and when they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to traders in the area and to the general public.  She learned the business from her father and so knows it perfectly.

Ana would like to invest her capital in purchasing more animals and balanced feed in order to increase her sales.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire more animals to expand her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 42 años D. edad.  Está casada y tiene 7 hijos.  Francisca no tiene estudios.
Su negocio consistente en la compra y venta D. animales menores como ganado porcino y ovino, también se dedica a la venta D. chuño en forma temporal. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace doce años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  con lo que compró chanchos para engordarlos y luego venderlos.  Nos cuenta que su esposo trabaja en las construcciones como operario.
Con éste préstamo D. S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará un toro y trabajará con el engorD. D. ganado vacuno.
Su sueño es mejorar en su negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ganancias. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones realizadas por la promotora D. crédito.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district, in Yunguyo province, in Puno department.  She is 42 years old, married, and has 7 children.  Francisca did not attend school.

Francisca's business is buying and selling small animals such as pigs and sheep.  She also sells 'chuño' (a freeze-dried potato product) seasonally.  Francisca has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for twelve years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money to buy pigs to fatten and sell.  She tells us that her husband works as a construction worker.

Francisca will use this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy a bull and she will work fattening her cattle.

Francisca's dream is to improve her business and, above all, to improve her profits.  What she likes about her community bank are the training sessions that her loan officer provides.

loans.use: To buy a bull and to work fattening her cattle

loans.name: Nancy Amada

texts.es:
La Señorita Nancy P. es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza cultural y natural, su variedad en la gastronomía, su gente que es muy amable y cordial.

La Señorita Nancy tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres quienes se dedican al comercio, ayuda en la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que viven es de propiedad de sus padres.
 
Nuestra socia es profesional, es profesora de un colegio donde dicta clases de Ciencias Naturales hace 4 años. En su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cremas, perfumes, cosméticos y bisutería. Su meta es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Nancy P. is a member of the Yanbal communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, known for its beauty, culture, nature and variety of foods.  Its people are very friendly and hospitable.

Nancy is 28, single, and she lives with her parents who are in business.  She helps with the household expenses in the house that belongs to them.

Our member is a professional.   She has been a teacher in a school where she has taught natural sciences for the past 4 years.  In her free time she sells Yanbal products.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years and the money from her loan will be used to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  Her goal is to travel the world.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.es:
La señora  Elisabeth Hernández Chaves, vive  en Chicoasen Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor  Julio Gutiérrez Méndez, en donde procreo cuatro hijos quienes ya están casados y está muy feliz que hayan encontrado la felicidad.

      El préstamo que ha estado solicitando lo invierte en la compra de  frutas y legumbres, para luego salir a venderlo en las comunidades cercanas de su pueblo,  en esto lleva  un año y dice que le va bien  ya que ha logrado ver que tiene buenos resultados.

      Para dedicarse a esta actividad se puso de acuerdo con su esposo, para que juntos trabajen y así salgan adelante hasta que dios les preste vida.

      De las ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad y de eso mismo toma para cubrir algunos gastos generados en su hogar, como también ser de manera puntual en sus pagos de fundación.
 
       Lo que desea es agrandar más su negocio para que logre tener más ingresos y así tener de donde sostenerse cuando ya esté  grande y no puedan trabajar mucho.
texts.en:
Elisabeth Hernández Chaves lives in Chicoasen in the state of  Chiapas, México.  She is married to Julio Gutiérrez Méndez.  This marriage has produced 4 children who are already married and are glad to have found happiness. 

The loan that she has requested will be invested in the purchase of fruits and vegetables that she will later sell in the communities near her town.  She has had this business for a year, and says that it is going well as she is seeing good results.  

In order to dedicate herself to this business, she made an agreement with her husband that they would work together and in this way continue to make progress as long as God grants them life. 

From the earnings that she gets from this investment in her business she will cover some of the household expenses and also make her payments on time to the foundation.

What she wants is to expand her business so that she can have more income and in this way support herself when she is older and can no longer work as much.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to later sell in nearby communities

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elvira Pérez Hernández, vive en Chicoasen Estado de Chiapas México, es casada  y tiene dos hijos a su responsabilidad, quienes son: Kevin Jasiel de trece años y la más pequeña es Martha Eunice de once años de edad.


        El préstamo que ha estado solicitando para invertir en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva ocho años y comenta que le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos en su hogar.


        Con esta actividad  y inicio por el ánimo de sus suegra ya que ella era la que tenia este tipo de negocio, pero luego decidió vender verduras  y se lo dejo a su nuera para que se apoye con sus gastos  de sus familia.


       Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la compra de más mercancía, para que se vea  mejor surtida y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan  comprar, y mejor sea su ganancia en su actividad.


        Lo que  desea es lograr ahorrar para que  ha sí logre aumentar más su negocio, como también de eso mismo obtener para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira Pérez Hernández lives in Chicoasen in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is married and has 2 children in her care, who are: Kevin Jasiel, 13, and Martha Eunice, 11.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, which she has had for 8 years.  She comments that the business is going very well, as it has provided a good income for her household.

Her mother-in-law, who had a grocery store, encouraged her to work in the business. Later, her mother-in-law decided to sell vegetables and left the business to Rosa so that she could help support her family.

With the earnings that she is getting she invests in the purchase of more merchandise, so that she can better stock her store and so her customers can find what they are looking to buy.  In this way she can improve her profits.  What she wants is to be able to save so that she can manage to expand her business, and so that she can provide for her two children, who are in school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 32 años es madre soltera, natural del distrito de Ayna San Francisco; es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada junto a sus 02 queridos hijos Marisol de 17 años y Liner de 14 años de edad. Lo que más desea en la vida es poder brindarles la mejor educación a sus hijos. El lugar más conocido y concurrido para comprar variedad de ropa es en un pequeño centro comercial llamado “Gamarrita”, es aquí donde Rayda tiene un puesto de venta. En este lugar atiende a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes visitan continuamente su puesto, debido a los novedosos modelos de ropa que trae personalmente de la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que mejor les quedan, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco. Lleva 04 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que abre a las 08 de la mañana y trabaja hasta aproximadamente las 09 de la noche. Con el transcurso del tiempo, desea poner un negocio más grande, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy alegre y siempre esta poniendo las cuotas acordadas. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que este tipo de prendas de vestir es la que  tiene mayor demanda en la zona selvática de nuestro querido Perú.
texts.en:
Rayda, 32, is a single mother from Ayna San Francisco district; she’s an unassuming, hard working woman living in a rented house with her two beloved children, Marisol, 17, and Liner, 14.  What she most wants in life is to be able to provide her children a better education.

The best known and most popular place to buy assorted clothing is a small shopping center called “Gamarrita” which is where Rayda has a sales stand.  She tends to all her customers who visit her stand here kindly and courteously thanks to the novel items she brings personally from the city of Lima.

What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers on which items look best on them because she entertains herself a bit doing so.  She’s been in this line of work for four years and considers having to remain in her sales stand all day as the most difficult aspect of it because she opens at 8am and stays open until about 9pm.  In time she’d like to set up a larger business where she can provide better customer service.

This is her third loan with MFP and she knows that she must repay on time if she wants to be able to access future loans and is willing to do so.  She is a very cheerful member of her communal bank who always contributes the agreed upon contributions.

She will use the requested three thousand new soles to buy more clothes in the city of Lima, preferably summer clothes, since this is the type of clothing most in demand in the jungle area of our beloved Peru

loans.use: To buy summer clothes.

loans.name: María Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora. María Gutama es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive en la comunidad de Hierba Buena que  pertenece al a parroquia de Molleturo, este sector es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, son personas muy amables.

Doña María tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 9 y 5 años de edad y está embarazada de 8 meses por lo que está muy contenta, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos  en la escuela.  Su esposo labora como minero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

La Señora. María hace tres años  de dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal y ropa, vende recorriendo la ciudad a sus amigas y conocidas, también se dedica a la cría de animales como: cerdos y cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 3 años y  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento de animales, cerdos y cuyes. Su meta es  poner una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Gutama is a member of the Yanbal communal bank.  She lives in the community of Hierba Buena which belongs to Molleturo parish.  This is a cold weather sector whose residents are very kind people dedicated to farming and raising animals.

María is 31 years old, married and has three children who are 15, 9 and 5 years of age.  She is 8 months pregnant which makes her very happy.  Her oldest son is in high school and the rest are in elementary school.  Her husband works as a miner.  They do not have a house of their own; they live in a relative’s house.

María has been selling Yanbal products for the last three years.  She sells throughout the city visiting friends and acquaintances.  She also raises farm animals like pigs and guinea pigs.

She has been in the communal bank for three years and will use the loan money to buy animal feed, pigs and guinea pigs.  Her goal is to set up a store in her house.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has his own metalworks shop in Ayacucho. He is also a mechanics professor. He will be using his loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase metal. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for 7 years and was one of the original founders of his communal bank, "Solidaridad." He enjoys the weekly meetings, trainings and general support that FINCA provides. Pedro hopes to invest in more tools in the future and expand his business and increase profits.

loans.use: Purchase of metal for metal shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 24 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Reside junto a sus padres en la parte rural del caserío Cruceta en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi propia. Desde hace tres años, ha desarrollado una clientela ya conocida y establecida que transporta a través la ruta Tambogrande-Cruceta.

Julio solicita un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para el mantenimiento de su vehículo y para la compra de algunos accesorios como unas llantas y un sistema de arrastre. Estas mejoras lo ayudarán a brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, realizar más correos a zonas establecidas y así obtener un mayor nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio is 24 years old, single and doesn’t have children.  He lives with his parents in the rural area of Cruceta in Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in Piura province which is part of Piura region located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

He provides public transportation services in his own mototaxi.  He’s been in business three years developing a set, established customer base that he transports on the Tambogrande-Cruceta route.

Julio is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan for vehicle maintenance and repair and to buy some accessories like tires and a traction system.  These improvements will make it possible for him to provide better customer service, do more trips to established zones and thus earn higher income.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatros hijos en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Palominos. Esta comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Cuenta con una vitrina y unos accesorios en su casa que usa para exhibir sus productos. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona como vende sus productos entre sus vecinos y amistades. En esta temporada, tiene más pedidos por atender debido a la campaña de Mangos que trae más gente a su caserío. 

Para satisfacer la aumentación de la demanda de su clientela, Ana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería con nuevos diseños. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, is a mother living with her husband and four children in her own house in the rural section of Palominos.  This community is located in Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in Piura province over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She has been selling clothes for three years.  She has a display case and some accessories at home she uses to exhibit her wares.  She has an established customer base in the area since she sells her items among her neighbors and friends.  During this season demand is higher because it’s mango season and this brings more people into her hamlet.

To meet increased customer demand, Ana wants to expand the business buying more merchandise with new designs.  She has, therefore, thought it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan.

loans.use: To acquire more clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Juan Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Alfonso D. L. C.  T. es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta que ha salido adelante con sacrificios  al lado D. su esposa y sus hijos han sabido invertir en una tienda D. abarrotes que actualmente esta atendiendo  su esposa Minerva mientras que el en su taller repara todo tipo D. lavadoras y refrigeradores, es conocido por mucha gente que lo frecuenta, en esta ocasión a ellos les esta haciendo falta el techo D. lado D. L.  tienda en donD. tienen el taller D. reparación y  así  poner L. losa para que puedan  trabajar en tiempos lluviosos y fríos  y D. esta manera obtener mas ganancias, así  como dar una  mejor calidad a sus clientes, ya que abarca una parte del techo D. L. tienda D. abarrotes, y cuando llueve, ellos temen que se les pueda echar a perder algunos productos D. los que tienen para venta al publico.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Alfonso D. L. C. T. is a very hard working, responsible, honest person who has gotten ahead thanks to sacrifices.  AlongsiD. his wife and children they have known how to invest in a grocery store that his wife, Minerva, currently tends to while he works in his workshop repairing all kinds of washing machines and refrigerators.  He is known by a lot of people who come to him.

They currently lack a roof on the store where they have the repair shop installed.  He will install roofing tiles so that they can work during rainy and cold times thus obtaining more profits as well as proviD. a better quality to their customers since it includes part of the grocery store’s roof and they fear when it rains some of the products they have on sale to the public could spoil.

loans.use: To install the roof.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victor Alex

texts.es:
Víctor es soltero y tiene de 24 años de edad. Reside en casa de sus padres en el caserío Zaranda. Se ubica en el distrito de Pitipo, una zona agrícola situada en la región Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 1 año, se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de maíz amarillo. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar este producto. Vende su producto a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Víctor cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos y ayudar a sus padres. 

Víctor desea sembrar más maíz amarillo y comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo. Para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Víctor es un hombre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ser un empresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Victor is single and 24 years old.  He lives in his parents’ house in Zaranda, located in Pitipo district, an agricultural zone in Lambayeque region over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last year he has been growing and selling yellow corn.  He has a field where he plants this crop.  He sells his products to merchants that visit the zone.  Victor has an established customer base.  Income from this activity makes it possible for him to pay his personal expenses and help out his parents.

Victor wants to plant more yellow corn and buy fertilizers and insecticides for his crops.  To insure a good harvest he has deemed it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Victor is quite a hard working man who is devoted to his family.  His greatest wish is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To plant yellow corn and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de la socia Alejandrina es la elaboración y venta de panes “Chuta”, ella tiene su propio horno donde prepara panes “Chutas”. El PAN CHUTA es un típico pan de la ciudad del cusco, caracterizado por ser un pan gigante que mide aproximadamente unos 30 x30 cm y 4 a 4 cm de grueso y por ser un pan muy delicioso, tanto así que muchos turistas gustan llevar una muestra a sus familiares como obsequio, a fin de que puedan estos saborear un poquito de la magia que envuelve a la ciudad imperial del cusco. 

En esta oportunidad Alejandrina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas más. 

Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 51, lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.  Her main activity is making and selling “Chuta” bread; she has her own oven where she makes “Chutas.” Chuta Bread is bread that is particular to the city of Cusco.  It is characterized for being giant bread measuring approximately 30cm x 30cm and 4cm thick; it is quite delicious, so much so that tourists like to take samples of it as gifts to their relatives so that they too can taste a bit of the magic that enfolds the imperial city of Cusco.

Alejandrina requires a loan on this occasion to buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.

Alejandrina is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” communal bank and she’s grateful for the opportunity provided through this means.  At the same time, she commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour and yeast and many other things.

loans.name: Juan Raul

texts.es:
Juan Raúl tiene 49 años de edad y tiene cinco hijos, El nació en la ciudad de San Pablo de la provincia de Canchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Juan Raul vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Juan Raúl es bridar servicio de transporte en su propio taxi, el cubre la ruta que va de la ciudad de Oropesa  a la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Juan Raul requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 

Juan Raul pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan Raúl, 49, has five children.  He was born in the city of San Pablo in Canchis province, Cusco department.  Currently, Juan Raúl lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.

His main activity is providing transportation service in his own taxi; he covers the Oropesa-Cusco route.  Juan Raúl needs a loan for vehicle maintenance and repair on this occasion.

He belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means.  At the same time he commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 45 años de edad y tiene ocho hijos, Ella nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Guadalupe vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Guadalupe es la elaboración y venta de panes “Chuta”, ella como la mayoría de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio tienen que alquilar un horno por horas para preparar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Guadalupe requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas más. 


Guadalupe pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 45, has 8 children.  She was born in the city of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba province, Cusco department.  Guadalupe currently lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.

Guadalupe’s main activity is baking “Chuta” bread.  She, like most of the area residents who are in this business, has to lease an oven for hours to make their products.  On this occasion, Guadalupe needs a loan to buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.

Guadalupe is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means.  In addition, she commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like flour, yeast and many other things.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 42 años de edad y tiene tres hijos, Ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Juana vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Juana es venta de comestibles, ella tiene su propia tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería y así poder abastecer su pequeña tienda. 

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old and has three children. She was born in the city of Quillabamba in the Province of La Convención, Department of Cusco. Juana currently lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru.

Her main business activity is selling groceries. She manages her own grocery store out of her home. Juana is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more merchandise so that her tiny store will be well-stocked.

Juana belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Zhullin (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhullin está formado por 12 mujeres y un hombre quienes luchan en sus trabajos y en diferentes actividades diarias para ofrecerles un mejor bienestar a sus familias, son personas muy amables y carismáticas. Viven por el sector de Zhullin o en sus alrededores, este sector se caracteriza por que su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población laboran en diferentes actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca y Azogues.

La Señora. María Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal Zhullin, vive por el cantón Cañar, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y ha fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este gran grupo de señoras luchadoras.
Se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica tres días a la semana de 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. 
Doña María Mariana tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 8 y 4 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela del sector. Su esposo labora como ayudante de un bus, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para iniciar en este negocio. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.

La Señora Blanca Marina Pérez vive por el sector del Descanso vía a la ciudad de Azogues, tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 17, 12, 10 años y un bebe de 10 meses de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su hija de 12 años  estudia en una academia de belleza, su tercer hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector, con su esfuerzo ha logrado obtener una casita donada por la curia. 
Doña Blanca Marina trabaja hace 10 años como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Hace 3 meses se ha dedicado a la cría de pollos.
Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por su mamá, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para crecer más en este negocio. Su meta  es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Zhullin community bank is made up of twelve women and one man who work hard in their jobs and different business activities so that they can offer their families a better life.  They are very kind and charismatic people who live in the Zhullin neighborhood or surrounding areas.  This neighborhood is characterized by the fact that its inhabitants work raising animals and farming crops.  A lot of the population works in different businesses in the cities of Cuenca and Azogues.

María Mariana C. is a member of the Zhullin community bank.  She lives in Cañar canton and this is the first loan she has taken as a member of her community bank.  She was invited to join this group of hard-working women by her sister.

María Mariana works as a cleaner three days a week, from 8.00am to 3.00pm.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children aged 10, 8 and 4 months.  Her eldest two children attend a local elementary school.  Her husband works as an assistant on a bus.  They do not own their own home but rent.  María Mariana will invest her loan money in buying fruit to set herself up in a fruit selling business.  Her dream is to own her own home.

Blanca Marina Pérez lives in Descanso neighborhood, in the city of Azogues.  She is 34 years old, is a single mother, and has 4 children aged 17, 12, 10 and 10 months.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently.  Her 12 year-old daughter attends a beauty academy, her third child (a boy) is attending a local elementary school.  Through a lot of hard work, Blanca has managed to obtain a small house, provided by the church.

Blanca Marina has been working as a cleaner for 10 years.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 9.00am to 3.00pm.  For the past 3 months, she has been raising chickens.  This is the first loan she has requested through her community bank and she was invited to join by her mom.  She will invest her loan money in buying chickens so that she can grow more in this business.  Her goal is to get her children ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy fruit and chickens

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene dos hijos.  Raquel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, ella tiene un galpón en su domicilio donde aproximadamente tiene 500 cuyes. Ella vende la carne de los cuyes porque es muy suave y por supuesto que rico en proteínas. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Raquel en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y sueño es construir dos o tres galpones.   

Raquel pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Raquel lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. She raises and sells small animals, such as guinea pigs. Raquel has a pen in her home where she keeps approximately 500 guinea pigs. She sells the guinea pig meat because it is very tender and rich in protein. Raquel has been in this business for six years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to acquire more guinea pigs. Her wish is to build two or three more pens.

Raquel belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Acquire more guinea pigs

loans.name: Dulce  Deyanira

texts.es: La Sra. Dulce es una persona muy seria y respetuosa ella es casada, tiene un negocio de comida y venta de accesorios en su casa, en un futuro quiere ampliar su negocio si dios le da vida  para  de  esta  manera  tener  mayores  ingresos  por  los  servicio  prestados ya  que   esto  representa  el  único  sustento con el  que  cuenta  por  lo  cual  día  con  día se  esfuerza  cada  vez  mas  para  salir  adelante.
texts.en: Sra. Dulce is a very serious and respectful person.  She has a food business and also sells accessories from her home.  In the future she wants to expand her business, God willing, so that she can generate more income for the services she provides.  This is her only livelihood, so she strives each day to get ahead.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 45 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de socia Alejandrina es la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes, ella tiene 25 gallinas y unos cuantos cuyes para vender pero en esta oportunidad  desea aumentar el capital del negocio y desea el micro crédito para comprar gallinas, cuyes y alimento para los animales. Ya son veinte años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. 

Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 45 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is raising and selling small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has 25 chickens and a few guinea pigs that are available for sale. Alejandrina is taking this opportunity to increase her business capital, so she is requesting a microloan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her animals. She has been in this business for twenty years and has done very well.

Alejandrina belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for her animals

loans.name: Erasma

texts.es:
Erasma tiene 42 años de edad y tiene seis hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Erasma es la elaboración y venta de panes “Chuta”, ella como la mayoría de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio tienen que alquilar un horno por horas para preparar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Erasma requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas más. 

Erasma pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Erasma is 42 years old and has six children. She was born in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is making and selling “Chuta” bread. Like most of the residents, she operates this type of business by renting an oven by the hour in order to make her products. Erasma is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can purchase supplies such as flour, yeast, and many other items.

Erasma belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and other items

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos es soltero y tiene de 28 años de edad. Reside junto a su familia en el caserío El Verde. Se ubica en el distrito de Pitipo, una zona agrícola situada en la región Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace años, se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de cereales. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar este producto. Vende su producto a los comerciantes que visitan la zona. Santos cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos y ayudar a sus padres y hermanos menores. 

Santos desea comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo. Para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es un hombre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 28 years old and single. He lives with his family in the village of El Verde, which is located in the District of Pitipo. This farming district lies in Lambayeque region and is more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos has been growing and selling grain for several years. He has a plot of land on which he cultivates this product, which he sells to traders who visit the area. Santos says that he already has an established customer base. The earnings he generates from his business are used to cover his expenses and support his parents and younger siblings.

Santos wants to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops. In order to continue with the production of his crops, he is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Santos is a hardworking gentleman who is devoted to his family. He wants to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 34 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de socia Catalina es la crianza y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas, chanchos  y cuyes, ella vende sus animales en la feria sabatina del mercado de San Jerónimo más conocido como “Vino Canchon”, ella en esta oportunidad  desea aumentar el capital del negocio y desea el micro crédito para comprar animales críos como por ejemplo chanchos, gallinas y cuyes. 

Catalina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Catalina is 34 years old, has four children, and lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is raising and selling small animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She sells the animals at the Saturday fair held at the San Jerónimo Market, which is better known as “Vino Canchon”. Catalina is taking this opportunity to increase her business capital, so she is requesting a microloan to buy animals to raise such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs.

Catalina belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta tiene 41 años de edad, tiene un hijo, nació y vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Violeta es la venta y compra de cerveza, ella tiene un pequeño depósito donde guarda y vende la cerveza, ella tiene abierto el depósito las 24 horas del día y vende todos los días de la semana. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Violeta requiere el préstamo para comprar más cajas de cervezas. 

Violeta pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Violeta is 41 years old and has one child. She was born and still lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is buying and selling beer. She has a small warehouse where she stores and sells the beer. Violeta keeps her warehouse open 24 hours a day and generates sales every day of the week. She has been in this business for seven years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her business. Violeta is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more cases of beer.

Violeta belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase cases of beer

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila tiene 50 años de edad y tiene seis hijos de las cuales todos son independientes. Cirila vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Cirila nos cuenta que desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron la elaboración de panes y el negocio de la venta de panes de “Chuta”.  Ahora Cirila es independiente y se dedica a la preparación de los panes, ella como la mayoría de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio de panes tienen que alquilar los horno por horas para elaborar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Cirila requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas más. 

Cirila pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cirila is 50 years old and has six children, all of whom are independent. She lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Cirila says that when she was a young girl, her parents taught her how to bake and now she has a business selling “Chuta” bread. Today she is independent and spends her time making bread. Like most of the residents, Cirila operates her business by renting an oven by the hour so that she can make her products. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, and many other items.

Cirila belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and other supplies

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 20 años de edad y pronto va ser mamá pues está embarazada, ella nació en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Melissa es la elaboración y venta de panes “Chuta”, ella como la mayoría de pobladores que se dedican a este negocio tienen que alquilar un horno por horas para preparar sus productos. En esta oportunidad Melissa requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura y muchas cosas más. 

Melissa pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Melissa is 20 years old and will soon be a mother since she is pregnant. She was born in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru. Her main business activity is making and selling “Chuta” bread. Like most of the residents, she operates her business by renting an oven by the hour in order to make her products. Melissa is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, and many other items.

Melissa belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast, and other supplies

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 22 años de edad y pronto va ser papá pues su pareja está embarazada, él nació en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Jesús trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace un año, él y su pareja tienen un pequeño negocio que consiste en la preparación de panes “Chuta”. En esta oportunidad Jesús requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de elaboración y venta panes pues su pareja Melissa desea comprar harina, azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Jesús pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jesús is 22 years old and will soon be a dad, since his partner is expecting.  He was born in the city of Oropesa in Cusco province, Peru.

For the last year, Jesús has worked at a private company--he and his partner have a small business making "Chuta" breads.  Now Jesús needs the loan to invest in the business of making and selling breads, since his partner Melissa wants to buy flour, sugar, and other items.  

Jesús belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, and he is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium.  He promises to pay back the loan on schedule.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 27 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal de socia Marleny es trabajar como ayudante en el horno de una de sus vecinas, ella empieza su trabajo a las una de la madrugada  y termina a las ocho de la mañana del día siguiente pero las socia Marleny también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y chanchos. En esta oportunidad Marleny requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales como chanchos y cuyes.  

Marleny pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Marleny is 27 years old, has three children and lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. She makes a living primarily working as an assistant in the bake shop of one of her neighbors. She works from 1 a.m. until 8 a.m. Marleny also makes a living raising small animals like guinea pigs and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy more of these animals. Marleny belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunities provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase small animals like guinea pigs and pigs

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos.  Carmen trabaja en el horno “panificadora Sota” como ayudante del maestro panadero y su horario de trabajo es a partir de la una de la madrugada hasta las una de la tarde del día siguiente.  Ya son dos años que trabaja en el horno y le va muy bien.  Carmen nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño negocio independiente que consiste en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas de doble pechuga pero necesita incrementar un poco más el capital de negocio.  En esta oportunidad Carmen requiere el micro crédito para comprar más gallinas. 

Carmen pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Carmen lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. Carmen works at the "panificadora Sota" bake shop as an assistant to the master baker, and she works from 1 a.m. until 1 p.m. She has worked at the bakery for two years and it is going very well. Carmen tells us that she has an independent small business raising small animals like double-breasted chickens, but she needs to raise a little more capital for it. She is requesting the loan to buy more chickens. Carmen belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more chickens

loans.name: Dejid

texts.en: Dejid, 41, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in their own house and her husband works  a seasonal job. Her older daughter attends college and younger daughter goes to a local secondary school. She finished a vocational school in 2003 and started her own hair salon afterwards. She rents a room at a local market where it is mostly crowded. Her husband bought a mini-truck in 2006 and has used  it to operate a transportation service business. He then started working as a driver for a mining company in 2009. Both her husband and she try hard to make a better life. Dejid is trying to expand her business and increase her income. She is a hardworking and active person who says, " We are paying attention to our daughters' education. We want them to get good education". She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy more equipment for her hair salon.

loans.use: To buy equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. El tiene 47 años de edad y tiene un hijo. Victor se a vender panes “Chutas” a la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento del Puno. El nos cuenta que su hermana Marcelina es quien se encarga de elaborar los panes y el de distribuirlo. Victor y Marcelina hace 15 años que se dedican a la panadería y a la panaderia le llamaron “Virgen Estrella”. En esta oportunidad Victor requiere el micro crédito para comprar materiales o insumos como por ejemplo harina y levadura para preparar más panes. 

Victor pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Victor lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. He is 47 years old and has a son. Victor sells bread in the city of Juliaca, department of Puno. He tells us that his sister Marcelina is who is in charge of making the bread and he is in charge of distribution. Victor and Marcelina have dedicated themselves to their bakery, "Virgen Estrella", for the past 15 years. Victor is requesting the loan to purchase supplies and ingredients, for example flour and yeast, so they can bake more breads. Victor belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast, to bake more bread

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 44 años de edad y tiene tres hijos de las cuales todos son independientes. Marcelina se dedica a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. Marcelina junto con su hermano Victor abrieron hace 15 años la panadería “Virgen Estrella”. En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el micro crédito para comprar materiales o insumos como por ejemplo harina y levadura. Marcelina distribuye a revendedores de la ciudad del Cusco y también cuando hay tiempo lleva a la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento de Puno. 

Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Marcelina lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 44 years old and has three children, all grown up. Marcelina makes a living with her bakery, making the "Chuta" bread that is traditional in the cities of Oropesa and Cusco. Marcelina, along with her brother Victor, opened their bakery, "Virgen Estrella", about 15 years ago. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast. Marcelina distributes to vendors in Cusco and also, when she has time, in the city of Juliaca, department of Puno. Marcelina belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast.

loans.name: Gangantsetseg

texts.en: Gangantsetseg, 42, is widowed and lives with her daughter in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a house and her daughter attends local secondary school. They have a decent standard of living. Gangantsetseg began in the water pipe trading business at a local market in 2004 and has been operating for seven years continuously. She used to operate her business with her husband who passed away in 2008. Now her sister operates one of her stalls for 200,000 MNT monthly. Gangantsesteg's daily net income is 200,000 MNT and she pays 160,000 MNT for monthly rent of the stalls that she operates. She imports water pipes from Erlian, the closest border city of China, and spends 400,000 MNT for transportation fees. Her monthly gross income is between 700,000 to 1,000,000 MNT. Gangantsesteg is a modest and polite person who says, " I try to save money because I want to send my daughter abroad to get a very good education in the future". She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to import water pipes or other items for her business.

loans.use: To import water pipes or other items for sale

loans.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
The four people shown in the photograph above are low-income people who are jointly requesting a loan. They are all living in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. One of them, Kav C., age 42, has been selected by the other group members to be the leader. 

Kav C. and his wife now have a fishing business in and around the Tunle Sap River. They have been fishing in the river for more than ten years. They earn a profit of $4 per day to contribute to supporting their three school-aged children, including school fees. Kav C. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so that he can catch more fish.

There are three other borrowers who have requested a loan as follows:
Mr. Say L. will be using her loan to better support her fishing business.
Mrs. Ry S. is applying for a loan to expand her grocery business.
Mrs. S. S. will be using the Kiva loan to buy a new boat to replace a broken one.

loans.use: To purchase nets and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.en:
Gerson B. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 50 years old. Gerson is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gerson owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copras in the local community. He is also making and selling coco charcoal. Gerson has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gerson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gerson is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconut shells for charcoal. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gerson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut shells for charcoal

loans.name: Yoeuk

texts.en: Yoeuk K. is 39 years old and married Chan Hun, 44, many years ago. She is from the province of Siem Reap. Through fishing, the couple is able to generate a small income of $5 USD each day which they use to feed their family. They have four school-aged children. They have a small fishing business in and around Tunle Sap River. Recently, this family can’t catch as many fish as before because their boat is often broken. Therefore, Yoeuk K. is asking for a loan to buy a new boat.

loans.use: To purchase a new boat to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Genelie

texts.en:
Genelie Q. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Genelie is married. To make a living, Genelie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Genelie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Genelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Genelie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Genelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale such as canned goods & beverages

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard T. is from the village of Turod, Quezon, Isabela. He is 28 years old. Richard is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Richard owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Richard has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Richard joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richard is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Richard from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en:
Buenafe M. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Buenafe is married. To make a living, Buenafe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. She is also operating a motorela or habal-habal with her husband as the driver. Buenafe has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Buenafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buenafe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Buenafe is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & biscuits. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Buenafe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale such as canned goods & biscuits

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Alma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling homemade honey in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Alma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale like sugar & pure honey. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients needed to make honey and other products

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay R. is a 48-year-old resident of the province Kompong Tom. She was married but divorced her husband when her children were young. She has five children; four of them still live with her. The other one is married and lives away from the family home. To help support the family, three of her children are employed at different jobs. Svay R. plants rice and some vegetables to earn a living. 

Svay R.’s child is getting married soon but her current savings are insufficient to pay for the wedding ceremony preparations. To deal with this obstacle, Svay R. would like a loan from Kiva to add to her personal savings for her child's wedding. With the remainder of the loan, she will buy a few piglets to feed.

loans.use: To pay for her child's wedding ceremony and to buy a few piglets.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix J. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 59 years old. Felix is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felix owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas & coconuts in the local community. Felix has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felix joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Felix is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felix from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas & coconuts for sale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Marites is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, toothpaste and beverages in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Marites is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em L., 30, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own farmland in Kompong Tom province. In addition, she raises a few pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. Her husband is a cow seller. They have two single children who still live with them. Em L. is taking a loan to buy piglets to raise for selling.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise for selling.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Amidst turmoil there can be found an inner peace. This is what Marjorie C., 32, seeks to prove in her life. She reached high school and is now an entrepreneur and mother to two children who are both in elementary school. Her husband, Ritchie, works as a cutter in a restaurant. Their family currently resides in Baseco, Manila.

Marjorie sells fresh fish to her community. She also sells fashion accessories to her friends, neighbors, and business acquaintances. Her four years of experience in these businesses give her the skill of knowing the tastes of her valued customers. These business efforts enable her to earn 6,200 PHP monthly. 

To help continue operation of her businesses, she would like to request a 10,000 PHP loan. This money will truly help her grow her business as it will give her the capability to purchase more fish, as well as quality accessories for her customers. For Marjorie, this loan is one step toward improving and eventually expanding her business.

There are a lot of challenges surrounding Marjorie, so much that she considers her life in flux. The turmoil they have at home and with the rest of her family seems to rob her of the peace and focus she should be having in her business. She is also concerned with her husband, who just got in an accident. Adding to these burdens are the customers who run away from their debts. Still, despite all this, Marjorie strives to fix her eyes on God, the source of her inner peace. She prays for increased savings as her business becomes prosperous. She also never stops praying for a good life and a better future for her children. Marjorie also desires to have her own house and lot.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase fish and fashion accessories for retail sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Applying what she has learned as a community partner in CCT*, Gloria O., 55, capitalizes on food as a basic human need to establish a business that will work. Gloria has finished college and is running a household with seven children along with her husband Nivarjo. From the province of Bohol, their family has come to reside in Baseco, Manila.

Gloria runs a peanut butter sandwich business. She personally makes the sandwiches and sells them to her neighbors. She also sells chicken meat in her stall in the President Aquino public market. She has been in these businesses for nine years now. She is able to earn around 10,000 PHP monthly.

To help her grow her business, Gloria has requested a 9,000 PHP loan. She will use this money to enhance her businesses by buying more quantities of bread and peanut butter, as well different kinds of meat to give her customers more options to choose from. She is sure that the loan will make her business more profitable.

One challenge Gloria faces is the difficulty her customers have when it comes to paying their debts. Sometimes she doesn’t have many customers, resulting in low income. She is also overly concerned with her children whom she notices have become quite hardheaded. But she chooses rather to capitalize on these challenges and turn them into stepping-stones toward her dream of having a successfully growing business and a long, good life for everyone in her family. Gloria also desires to have her own house and lot. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase quantities of peanut butter and bread

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Debt. Sickness. Lack. These are the things Nelsa M., 45, currently faces as a micro entrepreneur but which she refuses to give in to. Nelsa finished only high school, but she will definitely not pass that fate on to her three children, who are all in school. She presently resides with them in Baseco, Port Area, Manila.

Nelsa focuses on her sari-sari (variety) store located near their home. She has been selling products on a per-piece price to her neighbors for ten years. She carefully chooses which products are preferred by her regular customers over the others, and which items will easily catch the eye of potential buyers. Monthly, Nelsa earns around Php 6,000. 

To help her grow her business, Nelsa is request a loan for Php 12,000. She knows that her learning in entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT* needs to be matched with sufficient money on hand to make her business grow. She plans to use this money to buy more products for her store, such as rice, sugar, canned goods, and charcoal.  Indeed, the loan will benefit her business and eventually her family.

At present, Nelsa’s big challenge is her son's illness.  Add to that her problems of dealing with customers who do not regularly pay their debts and low income at certain times of the month. Nevertheless, Nelsa is determined not to give in to these struggles. She focuses on eventually seeing the prosperity of her business and experiencing success in life. She hopes that unlike her, her children will finish their schooling. Nelsa also dreams of having her own car.

As a CCT community partner, Nelsa faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase goods for store

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, it has become commonplace to have a pig farm at home to help with the family income rather than counting on the husband's income alone. The problem is, most housewives do not know the correct way of raising pigs. To improve their capability, they joined in a group. In addition to exchanging information, they also get funds. 

Ni Ketut S., 40 years old and a housewife, became chairman of the group Kerto Sato to enhance their capabilities in terms of raising pigs and raising capital for their businesses. Her share of the loan will be used to buy three pigs and the rest to buy feed. In a period of 5 months, pigs are ready for sale. The advantage gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the family economy.

loans.use: buy three pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Having come from the province of Masbate, Novie E., 55, dreams of a better life in Manila. Novie barely finished high school, but she definitely believes that there is more in store for her. She is married to Lindro, a security guard. They now live in Baseco, Manila.

Novie operates her own sari-sari (variety) store, and at the same time rents out karaoke machines to friends and acquaintances who are fond of incorporating music into their personal events. Novie has two employees who help her with the daily work of accommodating clients and maintaining the business. Monthly, she earns around Php11,000.

Determined to grow her business, Novie is requesting a Php 28, 000 loan. She aims to use this money to boost her sari-sari store business. She will buy sacks of rice and charcoal, which she will repackage for retail. She will also buy trays of eggs, canned goods, and diapers for babies, which she knows her community needs based on her ten years of experience in the business.

From the moment she arrived in Manila, Novie holds on to her dream of a peaceful and abundant life. One hindrance to this is the headache she receives from customers who do not pay. However, she gets hold of a way to solve this issue. She desires for an expansion of her business, and that implies not settling for anything less in terms of service and profit.

As a CCT community partner, Novie faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.
