A él le han reincorporado a un grupo pequeño, por lo que es su primer crédito con MFP, y dice “que con confíen en él y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente”, ya que desea seguir trabajando para progresar. Y, con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento y arena, para que él mismo construya su cuarto, ya que también conoce mucho de albañilería.
texts.en:
Marino is a charismatic 58 year-old man.  He is a widower and father to three children who now live independently.  Marino lives in his brother's home.

Marino has worked in a number of trades from a very young age.  Since his wife died and his children grew up he has felt very lonely so his brother offered him work in his team working as a docker.  Marino gets up very early in the morning and works with his brother, unloading trucks with cargos of sugar and rice.  By 7 or 8 in the morning they have managed to unload up to two cars. This is how Marino leads his life but it is quieter and safer than he would like for his future.  For this reason, he is planning to build his own room on a plot of land that his brother has offered him in order to improve his quality of life.

Marino has been reincorporated into a small group for his first loan with MFP and he says that they trust him and are certain that he will make all his loan repayments on time since he would like to continue working in order to make progress.  Marino will use the loan money to buy cement and sand so that he himself can build his room since he knows a lot about building work.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 23 years old and sells clothes at local fairs/markets. She always travels to Lima to buy her merchandise which she sells in Ayacucho. Nelida will use her next loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy more clothes in order to increase her capital. Nelida has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. With her previous loan she was able to buy the material needed to set up her fair stand and to increase her business. 

Being a member of FINCA also provides her with the opportunity to study education at the local university. She enjoys the opportunity of saving and the training sessions provided have inspired her. She has learned to value herself more and to be responsible. Her goal is to open up her own clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy requiere el crédito para comprar herramientas de trabajo, como medidores de corriente, máquina soldadora, guantes de seguridad; Fredy es empleado y es técnico electricista. Con el ingreso que obtiene Fredy mantiene su hijo y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene un hijo. Es el primer crédito que tiene con IMPRO  y con KIVA.
texts.en: Fredy needs this loan to buy work tools such as a current meter, a soldering iron and safety gloves.  Fredy is an employee and he is an electrician.  Fredy uses his income to support his son.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in the Villa Nueva Potosí district of the city of La Paz.  This is his first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy a current meter, soldering iron and safety gloves so that he can continue in his business as an electrician

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of manure for use on his farms

loans.name: Boboto Plus Group

texts.en:
Régine is the leader of a community bank named “Boboto Plus”, made up of eleven members firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution, HOPE DRC, in order to develop their businesses.

Régine sells shikwanges (a kind of bread made of manioc flour), which are Kinshasa’s main food. She also sells onions and miscellaneous other foods.  She sells at a market located in the northeastern part of Kinshasa.  She has been in business since 1982. She has taken out 12 loans from HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. 

With her next loan, Régine will be able to meet the customers' demands and generate additional profits. Her business makes approximately $50 of profit per week. One of Régine’s strategies to keep her clients is that she tells them in advance about any change that can occur in her business. 

Her ambition is to diversify her business by opening a beverage facility in her area. Régine is 45 years old, married, and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 26. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old and the father of two children, ages 5 and 1.  He does dairy farming to earn his daily bread.  Besides, he is also otherwise employed.  He joined Faulu Kenya under a group where he saves his money.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances.  He hopes to add five more cows to his farm in the future. 

He has requested 30,000 KES to buy animal feed and a sprayer.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and a sprayer

loans.name: Bisiriyu  Oyeramiyi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Bisiriyu  a 48 ans et marié. Il a habite à Agoè.  Pour répondre aux besoins de ces enfants, il fait la vente de matériaux  électrique. Il achète  les  matériaux  au      grand  marché de Lomé et  revend dans  une boutique  non loin de  super marché  Leader Price à Agoè.  Il    a  commencé  en 1992 l’activité. Il    sollicite  un  prêt  pour  acheter  2 douzaines d’ampoule réglette, 2  douzaines d’ampoule économique, 3 rouleaux  de câble  VGV et 5 cartons de  boîtes  ronde.
texts.en: Mr. Bisiriyu is 48 years old and married. He lives in Agoè. In order to meet the needs of his children, he runs a business selling electrical equipment. He buys his goods at the grand market in Lomé and re-sells them at a store not far from the Leader Price supermarket in Agoè. He begin this business in 1992. He is seeking a loan to buy 2 dozen track light bulbs, 2 dozen energy-saving bulbs, 3 rolls of VGV cable, and 5 boxes of round tins.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two teenage children. He lives in Vodyanoye, Ukraine, and grows early spring vegetables to sell in the local markets in his region. He owns six arch greenhouses where he does tomato and radish farming. He has been in the business for nine years. He currently has 90,000 UAH invested in his business. Annually, he spends about 45,000 UAH on seeds and polyethylene protective film. 

He is requesting a 15,000 UAH loan to buy five rolls of polyethylene film to repair the greenhouses damaged during the heavy winter snowfalls and ice. The loan will give him a chance to sow seedlings in his greenhouses on time. 

Vitalyi’s daughter is graduating from high school and would like to enter a university. Vitalyi hopes to earn enough money selling groceries this summer to pay for her first year of studies.

loans.use: to buy polyethylene to repair his greenhouses

loans.name: Eric

texts.es: Eric es empleado en una empresa grafica como operador de máquina Offset, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de impresión (tinta, papel, etc.) para no perder un cliente que necesita este trabajo a ser realizado inmediatamente. Es su principal  fuente de ingreso para su manutención. A futuro el desea abrir una imprenta propia. Vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero sin hijos. El cliente se siente satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos. Esta es la quinta vez que viene a IMPRO para solicitar un crédito y la segunda vez que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Eric is employed at a graphics company as an offset printing machine operator. He's requesting this loan to buy printing material (ink, paper, etc.) in order to maintain his necessary clientele. This job is his principal source of income for his maintenance. In the future he hopes to open his own print shop. He lives at home with his parents in the city of La Paz; he's single and has no children. He's satisfied with the loans he's been granted. This is the fifth time that he's come to IMPRO to ask for a loan and the second time he's gone through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of ink, paper, and other materials to finish a job he's been entrusted with

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana is 20 years old and sells spare parts for cars from her house. She also sells salchipapa (thinly sliced pan-fried sausage served with french fries). 

She will use her loan of 1,000 PEN to buy more spare parts in Lima to sell in Ayacucho. Her business is doing well and she expects next month to be even better. 

Roxana has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. Being a member provided her with the opportunity to study biology. With her earnings she is able to buy the books she needs. Saving money is what Roxana likes most about being a member, because she is not able to do that at home. From the training sessions provided, she said her self esteem has increased and she has also learned to be punctual. 

Her goal is to finish her studies and open a bigger store to sell the spare car parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare car parts to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and the father of two school-aged children. He has been working as a mechanic for the past 29 years. In 1996, he opened his own garage. He took advantage of a first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client, repaying on his scheduled dates.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products in order to reinforce his business operation and further develop his business. His income is needed to support his wife and two young children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Djatougbé  Benoîte

texts.fr: Madame  Djatougbé   a 44 ans, mariée avec  3  enfants à  charge.  Elle habite quartier  Agoè  Logopé  où elle  fait  le commerce de produits d’alimentation.  Elle a débuté  en  1992 cette activité  et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle demande un crédit pour acheter  8 sacs du riz, 3 bidons d’huile, 2 cartons de tomate et 2 cartons  de boîte de  sardine.
texts.en: Ms. Djatougbé is 44 years old and married with 3 children in her care. She lives in the Agoè Logopé area, where she sells food products. She began this activity in 1992 and gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She is seeking a loan to buy 8 bags of rice, 3 cans of oil, 2 boxes of tomatoes, and 2 boxes of canned sardines.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia  realiza trabajos de costura en paño (tela especial); el crédito lo necesita para el aumento de mercadería, compra de 2 pieas de paño, cada una de 50 metros. Vive  en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Tejar  de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene 4 hijos. La cliente se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron desde el año 2005.
texts.en: Alicia works as a wool seamstress; she needs this loan to expand her merchandise. She's going to buy 2 swaths of woolen cloth, each 50 meters long. She lives in her own home located in the Alto Tejar area of the city of La Paz; she's married and has 4 children. She's satisfied with the loans she's received since 2005.

loans.use: Purchase of 100 meters of woolen cloth for her sewing business

loans.name: Gaston

texts.es: El señor Gastón trabaja como profesor y también es comerciante; el crédito que solicita es para que su hija cancele  la inscripción de ingreso a la Academia de Policías. Gaston es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorga.Esta es la segunda vez que se canaliza su solicitud a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Gastón works as a teacher and is also a salesman.  He is requesting a loan so that he can cover the enrolment fee that his daughter must pay to enter the Police Academy.  Gaston is married and has three children.  He lives in his parents' home in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.  Gastón is happy with the loan that he is being offered.  This is the second time that he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the enrolment fee that his daughter must pay to enter the Police Academy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy household products to sell

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio tiene un negocio donde presta el servicio de Internet, juegos en red y llamadas telefónicas. El préstamo lo destinara para la ampliación de su negocio, pues desea comprar un par de computadoras más. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. 
Vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Marco Antonio es soltero.

Este es el Tercer crédito con Impro y el primero canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio has an internet cafe business where he also sells access to internet games and telephone calls.  He will use this loan to expand his business, since he wants to buy two more computers.  This business is his main source of income and support.  He lives with his parents, whose home is located in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  Marco Antonio is single.

This is his 3rd loan with IMPRO, and the first that has been funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two computers to expand his internet cafe business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 32-year-old farmer.  He mainly does crop farming.  He has been in business for ten years and has experienced a lot of growth since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he used his previous loan from Faulu Kenya to buy a water pump and expand his farm.  He hopes to own a vehicle for transporting farm produce in the future.  With 20,000 Kes, he will buy manure and pressure pipe.

loans.use: To buy manure and a pressure pipe

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a member of Lucky Seven group in Faulu Kenya.  He is 40 years old and the father of a seven-year-old child.  He owns a van which he uses for a transport business.  He also sells cereals so as to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his business.  He needs 30,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his van.

loans.use: vehicle repair

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Ms. Eresmilda D. of O. who lives in Villa Rica.

Everybody was delighted to be a part of Mujeres Rurales, so they named the group "Mujeres Victoriosas" (Victorious Women).  The members of the committe are engaged in handicrafts, which is a talent they inherited from their parents and which they pass on from generation to generation.

They make beautiful clothing items, such as shirts, tablecloths in aopoi fabric, etc.  With the help offered by the foundation, this committee was able to increase its income and also improves the lifestyles of its members.

Mrs. Julia, for example, has been dedicated since childhood to traditional clothes manufacturing. She now wants to increase her income by advancing her business, and needs a loan to do so.

loans.use: buying raw materials for clothing manufacture

loans.name: Marcial Humberto

texts.es: Marcial tiene 26 años de edad es casado vive en casa propia con su esposa y su menor hijo de 06 años el se inicio como chofer de manera dependiente actualmente cuenta con un vehiculo propio en la cual trabaja de forma independiente el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para el mantenimiento y mejoramiento de su vehiculo, se le propone el crédito por tener buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Marcial is 26 years old and married.  He lives in his own home with his wife and their minor child, who is 6 years old.  He started out employed as a driver, and now has his own vehicle so he can work independently.  The financing granted will be used to maintain and improve his vehicle.  He was approved for the loan on the basis of having good references and having the willingness and ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Porfirio es socio propietario en el  sindicato de minibases Señor de San Roque;  el crédito  lo necesita para la compra de llantas  y el mantenimiento de motor de su vehiculo. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de San Roque de la ciudad de El Alto. Es primer crédito con Impro. Porfirio es soltero y no tiene hijos.
texts.en: Porfirio owns a vehicle and belongs to the mini-bus syndicate called "Señor de San Roque."  He needs this loan to buy tires and to do maintenance work on his vehicle.  This business is the only source of income that he has.  He lives in his own home, located in the San Roque neighborhood in the city of El Alto.  This is his first loan with IMPRO.  Porfirio is single and does not have children.

loans.use: To buy tires and do maintenance work on the motor of his vehicle, which he uses to provide public passenger transportation services.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina Quispe C. tiene 64 años, vive en la zona de la Maica Central parada 6, una zona periférica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en la zona sur oeste, vive con una de sus hijas, la cual es muy independiente de sus ingresos, su hija ya se encuentra casada. La señora Florentina fue desde muy joven madre sola porque su esposo las abandono, pero a pesar de todos obstáculos que tuvo supo cuidar siempre a su familia. Ahora tiene bajo su cuidado a un niño a quien lo quiere y cuida como uno de sus hijos a pesar de no serlo.

La señora Florentina se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, la cual la comercializa en la zona, a las productoras de quesillos, cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado vacuno y ella sola se dedica al cuidado de este ganado, se levanta temprano, los ordeña, y los lleva a pastorear (comer pasto) en la zona, y por las tardes las alimenta con alafalfa, alimento balanceado y cascara de soya, esto para que la producción de las vacas sea más óptima, y al finalizar el día las vuelve a ordeñar 8estraccion de leche cruda).

La señora Florentina desea comprar forraje para el ganado vacuno (cascara de soya) para no comprar solo por bolsas desea comprar medio camión que le resulta más económico, de este modo se ahorra un poco más, y como tiene a su cuidado al muchacho que le hace compañía, le podrá mejores condiciones de vida. Cuando el joven termine de estudiar el colegio, la Sra. Florentina le dejara todas sus vacas a él para que se dedique al mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Florentina Quispe C. is 64 years old and lives in the Maica Central neighborhood near bus stop 6.  This is a neighborhood that is on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba, on the southeast side. She lives with one of her daughters, who has her own independent income and who is married.  Florentina was a very young single mother, because her husband abandoned her.  But in spite of all of the obstacles she faced, she was always able to care for her family.  Now she is raising a young child who she loves and cares for as if he were one of her own.

Florentina has a business producing raw milk, which she sells in the neighborhood to the cheese producers.  She has 6 dairy cows, and she alone cares for these cows.  She gets up early, milks them, and puts them out to pasture in the area.  In the afternoons she feeds them with alfalfa, balanced feed and soybean husks, so that she can optimize their production of milk.  At the end of the day she milks them again. 

Florentina wants to buy fodder for her dairy cows (soybean husks.)  She wants to buy a half-truck full instead of bags, because it is more economical and in this way she could save a little more.  As a result, she and the boy who is in her care could have a better quality of life.  When the boy finishes school, Florentina will leave him all of her cows so that he can have the same business.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her dairy cows

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, es comerciante de libros, el crédito que solicita  será utilizado en compra de más libros para su puesto de venta en la ciudad de La Paz;  está divorciada y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres,  en zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en: Lucy is a bookseller.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more books for her sales stall in the city of La Paz.  Lucy is divorced and has two children aged 13 and 9.  She lives in her parents' home, in Mariscal Sucre district, in the city of El Alto.  This is her second loan from IMPRO and her second through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more books for her stall

loans.name: Ladislaa

texts.en:
Ms. Ladislaa is 43 years old and she is the local tailor.  She is married to Mr. Jorge Luis Vazquez, a 39 year old construction worker.  They have 2 kids, and they own a small apparel shop (aopoi clothing) in their house.

It started 7 years ago with the help of Ms. Ladislaa's mother, who takes care of making the clothes. Ms. Ladislaa requested the loan to buy aopoi fabrics, canvas, thread, buttons, rubber, etc., which will help her to increase the amount of work done.

She is very thankful to Kiva and the foundation for the support offered.  Thanks to that she can still make top notch clothing items and sell them at a good price to maintain her clientele.  Her income can also increase, allowing her to help her husband, pay the house expenses, and pay for her kids' education.

loans.use: Buying fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos , es un joven de 25 años de edad ,originario de Esteli, soltero quien vive con su madre ,y que se dedica a ayudarle en la contabilidad a su mama en el negocio de frutas .Empezo a los 14 años cuando su familia empezo a vender en el diamante de las Segovia municipio de Esteli,esta cursando la universidad estudiando la carrera de Contaduria Publica  en Esteli,pues no pierde la fe de sacar adelante a  su familia dandoles una mejor calidad de vida. 
El solicita el prestamo para capital de trabajo , pues de esta manera podra comprar mas frutas y venderlas por cantidad y surtir mejor su negocio,  mejorar sus ventas, considera que es una buena temporada para vender sus productos. Dentro de sus planes esta lograr culminar su carrera , desarrollarse profesionalmente y seguir ayudando a su madre .
Su meta proxima es comprar un vehiculo para trasladar frutas desde Managua a Esteli.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old and from Esteli.  He is single and lives with his mother.  He helps his mom with the book keeping for her fruit business.  He started at the age of 14 when his family started selling in Diamante de las Segovia, in the town of Esteli.  Carlos is at university, studying for a degree in certified public accounting, in Esteli.  He does not lose faith in being able to get his family ahead in life, providing them with a better quality of life.

Carlos is requesting this loan as working capital as it will enable him to buy more fruit, sell in bulk, better stock his business and improve his sales.  He says that this is a good season to sell his products.  Amongst his plans is managing to finish his degree, making progress professionally and continuing to help his mother.  His short-term goal is to buy a vehicle so that he can transport fruit from Managua to Esteli.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe es una persona seria, responsable, y sobre todo muy trabajadora ella esta separada de su esposo, tiene a su cargo a una niña para la que quiere  la mejor educación, la señora María necesita el dinero para poder arreglar un poco su casa ya que ella va a poner una barda y quiere mayor seguridad para su familia y para ella ya que se encuentra sola.
texts.en: María Guadalupe is a responsible and above all hardworking person. She and her husband are separated. She looks after their daughter, for whom she wants the best education. María needs the loan for home improvements, for example, to build a surrounding wall to provide greater security for her and her family.

loans.use: Construccion de  una  barda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy more natural products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca de 51años de edad, nació en la comarca el Coyolito, la Concordia municipio de Jinotega, es casada con tres  hijos, es comerciante y  ama de casa, ya que atiende  una pulpería. Inicio el  negocio de la pulpería con ayuda de su marido en la comarca el Coyolito localizada 28 kilómetros de Estelí, trasladando el producto desde Estelí  hasta la comunidad para poder venderlo. Además se dedican a la venta de leche pues poseen ganado y esto les ayuda a pagar los estudios  de sus tres hijos, que es su prioridad  ya que ella no pudo terminar su secundaria por problemas económicos y el difícil acceso a los lugares de estudios. Ella espera que al ampliar  su negocio ella mejorara sus ingresos.
Solicita el préstamo  para ampliar y abastecer el negocio, poder abastecerse de  la mayor cantidad de producto  y vender más, y generar mayores ingresos. Sus planes son darles estudios completos a sus hijos, poder convertirse en una gran distribuidora donde pueda solventar las necesidades de consumo de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Francisca is 51 years old and was born in the town of Concordia in the Department of Jinotega, Coyolito region. She is married and has three children. Francisca is a merchant and housewife who manages her own store. She started this business with the help of her husband and established it in Coyolito region, which is 28 kilometers from Estelí. Her products are brought into her community from Estelí so that she can sell them. In addition, she owns dairy cows and sells the milk to help pay for the education of her three children. They are her highest priority since she was not able to finish high school because of financial problems and difficulty accessing the schools. Francisca hopes to expand her business in order to improve her income.

She is requesting this loan in order to expand and restock her business. By restocking with a large quantity of products, Francisca will be able to sell more and generate better revenues. Her plans include helping her children complete their education and becoming a large distributor so that she can meet the consumer needs of her community.

loans.use: Acquire a large quantity of products for her store

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.en:
July is the leader of the Community Bank named “Soleil Plus” which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

July is 57, married, and has been part of the micro-enterprise world for many years. He operates a general store to the east of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening two large stores in Kinshasa. 

He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him $180 per week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. July is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having eight times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, sacks of sugar, and sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. July has six children aged between 12 and 26 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline owns a restaurant. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children who are between six and seventeen years old. Her husband sells cattle. Jacqueline has been selling cooked food in her restaurant for two years.  Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a motorcycle which will be used for transportation.

loans.use: Buying foodstuffs

loans.name: Jose Emanuel

texts.es:
José Emanuel V. M., tiene la edad de 33 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad al igual que su señora esposa. El cuenta con una soda y quiere seguir creciendo en el negocio. Por lo cual el pretende con el préstamo comprar más mercadería para ofrecer una gran mayoría de comidas o platillos. El también piensa en el futuro de su hijo y su esposa, al igual pretende brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y que su hijo no tenga ninguna necesidad para sus estudios, pues el quiere que sea un gran profesional en el futuro.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Emanuel V. M. is 33 years old, married, and has one child. Both his wife and child are his greatest priority. José manages a soda fountain and wants to continue growing his business. For this reason, he intends to use his loan to buy more supplies so that he can offer a wide variety of snacks and dishes. He also thinks about the future for his son and wife, as well as providing them a better quality of life. His son has no need for his studies, yet he still wants him to become a successful professional in the future.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. José has not taken any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better services and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for his soda fountain

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: La Sra. Ofelia T. Q. es una persona muy seria y responsable, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos que dependen  de ella, su único ingreso es su tienda de abarrotes, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y desea ampliar su  tienda futuro para  así  poner ofrecer mayor  mercancía  a sus clientes , su esposo el Sr. Raúl Arturo le ayuda a la señora en los tiempos libres que el tenga ya que el es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta el cual  quiere ver a su familia llena y completa de felicidad y alegría ofreciéndoles  un mejor  hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Ofelia T. Q. is a very serious and responsible individual. She is married and has two children who are dependent on her. Her only source of income is her grocery store. Ofelia is an enterprising person and wants to expand her store in the future so that she can offer more merchandise to her customers.

Her husband, Sr. Raúl Arturo, helps her whenever he has free time. Ofelia is hardworking and honest. By providing a better home, she hopes to see her family full of happiness and joy.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Abatoni Group

texts.en:
Josiane is the leader and a member of "Abatoni" group. She is 48 years old and she has six children. Her children are between the ages of 15 and 29 years old. All her children go or have gone to school. She sells different foodstuffs such as cassava, beans, beer and sodas.

Generally the rest of the group members sell foodstuffs while some have shops in which they sell household items. They are requesting a loan in order to invest in their businesses.

Josiane is shown in the photograph holding their blue bank passbook.

loans.use: Buying additional stocks of foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Maria Alma Delia

texts.es: La Sra. María Alma B., es una mama divorciada que vive al lado de sus dos hijos uno mayor de edad que ya es independiente y  esta trabajando  para ayudarla con los gastos, y el menor que se encuentra estudiando, actualmente la Sra. alma no ha encontrado trabajo en alguna empresa, y desde hace ya casi un año que ella para seguir con la manutención de sus hijos y de su hogar, inicio el negocio de la venta de zapatos por catalogo, pero como a ella le están solicitando mas producto ella desea invertir capital en comprar de  estos, y tener en existencia para mostrar a sus clientes, y así que puedan ver la variedad de zapatos, ya que le ha dado frutos la venta de este producto y así es como ha logrado seguir sacando adelante la manutención de sus hijos y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. María Alma B. is a divorced mother who lives with her two children. The oldest child is already independent and working to help with the expenses, while the younger one is in school. Sra. Alma currently does not have a job with any company. It has been almost a year since she held a job that allowed her to support her children and her household.

Sra. Alma started a business selling shoes through a catalog. She wants to order more products, but needs the capital to invest so that she can purchase them. Alma has an existing inventory that she can display to her customers, but they want to see a wider variety of shoes. Selling shoes has paid off because she can continue supporting her children and maintaining her home.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sonia es  madre de dos hijas, con deseo de superación profesional. En donde ha logrado mantenerse estable en su trabajo. Como auditora.
Atreves de los años ha venido construyendo su casa con ahorros y financiamiento que ha logrado en Afodenic en cuatro periodos, todos con el objetivo de poder dar  a sus hijas un techo digno.
 Hoy con esta nueva solicitud, comprara materiales de construcción para terminar un cuarto el cual lo tiene casi ya terminado, lo que comprara es laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos para el techo, a si como puertas y ventana para concluir la obra.
texts.en:
Sonia is a mother of two daughters, with a wish to improve herself professionally.  She has managed to maintain a stable job as an auditor.  Through the years she has built her house with her savings and with loans from Afodenic on 4 occasions, all with the objective of being able to give her daughters a worthy roof over their heads.  

Today with this new loan she will buy construction materials to finish a room which is almost done.  She will buy sheets of tin, support beams, screws for the roof, as well as doors and a window to finish the work.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish the roof and doors of a room

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Orden y trabajo, son las virtudes de Gladys, una mujer de 48 años. Su familia lo conforma sus 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en La Merced (selva central peruana). La venta de productos de belleza, es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 8 años; en todo este tiempo logró obtener muchos clientes, quienes constantemente le hacen pedidos de cremas faciales, perfumes, bloqueadores y demás accesorios. Gracias a las facilidades de pago que ofrece, todos sus clientes están contentos con ella, pero afirma que tiene dificultades para cobrar. Pues hace unos meses comenzó a trabajar para el estado peruano, en la cobranza ambulatoria  de los comerciantes. Por esa razón, desea instalar una cabaña turística, donde pueda contratar un personal para que le ayude en la venta de sus productos y demás artículos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las optimistas”, y este es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde demuestra responsabilidad, ya que es la secretaria de su asociación. Gladys, comenzará la  construcción de la cabaña, por ello con el crédito solicitado, está pensando comprar los insumos necesarios. Así podrá vender aretes, ropa, y productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Organization and hard work are the virtues that Gladys exhibits. She is a 48 year old woman. Her family consists of four children, but only two of them still live with her in their home in La Merced (which is in the central Peruvian jungle). Gladys has been selling beauty products for eight years. Throughout that time, she has been able to acquire many customers who constantly place orders for facial creams, perfumes, sunscreens, and other accessories. Thanks to the payment options she offers, all of her customers are happy with her yet she still has difficulties collecting payments. A few months ago, Gladys started working for the Peruvian state government as a traveling debt collector assigned to the merchants. For this reason, she wants to establish a tourist stand so that she can hire an employee to help with the sale of her products and other articles from her existing business.

Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Optimistas” (The Optimists). This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has demonstrated responsibility through her service as secretary of her association. Gladys will begin the construction of her stand, so the loan she requested will be used to buy the necessary supplies. This will enable her to have a place where she can sell earrings, clothing, and beauty products.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that she can build a stand for her business

loans.name: Vie Nouvelle Plus Group

texts.en:
"Vie Nouvelle Plus" (New Life Plus) is a group of 22 owners of small businesses chaired by Dorange. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Dorange, single and aged 30, runs a clothing stand while taking care of two relatives. She has been in business for many years. Dorange has used seven Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expanding of her inventory. Due to the high demand in her community, she intends with the next loan to buy still more goods for resale in order to meet clients' demand and generate additional profit. This will help her to achieve her plans to grow the business. It brings in a profit of US$100 per week. 

Dorange’s ambition is to purchase goods abroad herself. She is engaged.

loans.use: purchasing additional goods for her store for resale at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 1 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Albaneli es la coordinadora del grupo Amor y Paz 3, cada uno D. elL. días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en la ciudad D. Santiago, la segunda ciudad mas granD. D. Republica Dominicana, donD. el comercio, grandes industrias y el sector D. ganadería y agricultura, son las principales fuentes D. trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

Albaneli posee una familia conformada por sus 3 hijos y su esposo. Mientras su esposo trabaja para suplir las necesidades básica D. su familia, ella se ha dedicado a generar ingresos extra, actualmente con la finalidad D. poder reparar poco a poco su vivienda y poder construir en una estructura fuerte D. block, para garantizar mas seguridad. Su sueño es poder tener su casa terminada, y también tener una gran  compañía, este ultimo es su reto mas importante.

El negocio D. Albaneli es la venta D. calzado, lleva ya alrededor D. 1 año, el cual inicio al recibir su primer préstamo. Esta recibiendo su 3er préstamos con Esperanza Internacional. Gracias a L. prestamos anteriores ha podido crecer su negocio D. zapatos, y ha podido unirse a la venta D. calzados por catalogo D. mayor calidad. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en la compra D. calzados para mujeres, D. diferentes estiL., colores y tamaños; y reforzar una segunda actividad D. negocio que recién incorporo, es la venta D. salchichas a la parrilla.

Su historia representa a L. demás miembros D. su grupo y a L. clientes D. Esperanza, tanto L. haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. elL. recientemente) y L. dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Albaneli is the coordinator for the group “Amor y Paz 3” (Love and Peace 3). All of the members conduct their daily business activities in the city of Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. The main sources of jobs are traD., large industries, and the livestock and agriculture sectors. These members mostly engage in the sale of clothing, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Albaneli’s family consists of her three children and her husband. While her husband works to meet the basic needs of their family, Albaneli spends time earning extra income. At the moment, she wants to complete the gradual repairs to her home and build a structure maD. of solid block that is guaranteed to be secure. Her dreams incluD. finishing her house and having a large business. The latter goal is the most important to her.

Albaneli has been selling shoes for approximately one year and used her first loan to start this business. She is now receiving her third loan from Esperanza International. Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to grow her shoe business and incorporate the sale of higher quality shoes from a catalog. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of women’s shoes in different styles, colors, and sizes. She will also strengthen a second business she recently started, selling grilled sausages.

Albaneli’s story is representative of the other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in the poorest communities of the Dominican Republic that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loans.use: Purchase women’s shoes in different styles, colors, and sizes

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: El joven Omar M. M. es un hombre muy emprendedor pues comenta que hace algunos años se quedo sin empleo y su padre le propuso que lo enseñaría a preparar donas  lo logro y  empezó  con la  ventas  de  donas primero con su familia posteriormente  en algunas  tiendas de  su colonia después consiguió un empleo formal pero comenta que el desea su crédito para la compra de un caso de cobre puesto que  ahora combina su trabajo con la  venta de donas ya  que  realiza  su  venta  con  los  mismos  compañeros  de  trabajo.
texts.en: Omar M. M. is an enterprising young man who says that he lost his job a few years ago.  His father proposed to teach him how to make donuts.  He began selling donuts first to family members and later to a few stores in the area.  Afterwards he secured formal employment.  Omar says that he wants this loan to buy a copper pot.  Now he supplements his job by selling donuts to his co-workers.

loans.use: Purchase a copper pot for frying donuts

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Perseverancia; así definimos a Cirila, una mujer de 61 años; que vive junto a su esposo Teodoro, y sus 6 hijos, de los cuales solo cría y educa a Andrea de 18 años, en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). Todos los días desde muy temprano, Cirila recorre las calles de la ciudad; ofreciendo los ricos tamales que prepara un día antes. A pesar del cansancio que siente, ella se mantiene firme y comenta que no llega a su casa sin haber terminado todos los tamales que preparó, lo cual no es tan difícil, pues gracias a lo exquisita sazón, y a los clientes que adquirió durante 10 años, ella puede vender diariamente 80 tamales. Ya en las noches, afuera de su casa, ella vende anticuchos y picarones, ateniendo así un dinerito extra. Ahora sus planes son construir un pequeño quiosco, donde pueda vender los ricos platos que cocina, y de esa manera no estar caminando y establecer su negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener este aporte para el desarrollo de su negocio. Cirila, comenzará la construcción de su quiosco, por ello con el crédito que recibirá, comprará madera y clavos; asimismo comprar insumos para la elaboración de tamales, picarones y anticuchos.
texts.en:
Perseverance is what defines Cirila. She is a 61 year old woman. She lives with her husband and six children, but her daughter Andrea (age 18) is the only one who is still a dependent and attends school. Cirila lives in her own home in the city of La Merced, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. Every day she travels through the streets of her city from the early morning hours, offering the rich tamales that she prepared the day before. Despite the fatigue, she remains firm and says that she does not go home until all of her tamales have been sold. Cirila has no difficulty with selling all of her product since her food has an exquisite flavor. She accumulated her customers over the course of ten years and is able to sell 80 tamales per day. At night, Cirila sells skewered meats and fritters outside of her home so that she can earn some extra money. Now she plans to build a small kiosk where she can sell the rich dishes she prepares. This will enable her to have an established business so that she does not have to walk.

Cirila belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Optimistas” (The Optimists). This is her fifth loan with MFP. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can develop her business. Cirila will begin the construction of her kiosk, so the loan she received will be used to buy wood and nails. In addition, she will buy supplies for making tamales, fritters, and skewered meats.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation & construction materials to build a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Azul X Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama AZUL X, en honor a la nieta de la Tesorera en base a la admiración que le tienen por salir adelante, ya que tiene sindorme de dawn. El grupo esta ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, México. Esta formado por 10 integrantes. La Presidenta del grupo es Doña MARIA GUADALUPE C. J., quien  tiene 39 años,es casada y tiene dos hijos, estudió hasta la primaria. Se dedica a la venta de joyeria. La Tesorera del grupo es MARIA ENGRACIA A. C., quien tiene 44 años, es casada y estudió hasta la secundaria, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella solicito el crédito para realizar pedidos por adelantado y obtener mayores ganancias, ella ha salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación; sus compañeras la conocen desde hace tiempo y comentan que es  una persona trabajadora y honesta, ella solicita el crédito para apoyar a su familia y tener una vida de calidad.
texts.en:
This group is called “Azul X” in honor of the treasurer’s granddaughter who is greatly admired for the drive to succeed she demonstrates each day beginning at dawn. The group is located in the State of Puebla in Mexico and consists of ten members. Doña Maria Guadalupe C. J. is the group president. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children. Maria Guadalupe has an elementary school education and sells jewelry.

The group treasurer is Maria Engracia A. C. She is 44 years old, married, and has a high school education. Maria Engracia sells clothing. She is requesting a loan so that she can place orders in advance and generate more revenue. Maria Engracia has been able to get ahead because of her effort and dedication. Her fellow group members have known her for a long time and comment that she is a hardworking and honest individual. She is requesting a loan to help support her family and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Operating capital to use as business investment

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es: Jose tiene 46 años de edad es separado tiene dos hijas de 20 y 12 años el vive con su hija la mayor en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Urb La Palma Jose se dedica aproximadamente dos años al transporte labora de forma independiente en su propio vehiculo realizando el servicio de colectivo, el financiamiento sera destinado para el mantenimiento de su auto se le otorga el crédito por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Jose is 46 years old, separated, and has two daughters (ages 20 and 12). He lives with his eldest daughter at his parents' house in Urb La Palma. Jose has been providing transportation services for approximately two years. He works independently, using his own vehicle that he acquired from the taxi cooperative.

This loan will be used for automobile maintenance. Jose is being granted this loan because he presents good references as well as the willingness and capacity to pay.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 5 Group

texts.es:
Damaris posee una familia conformada por ella y su pequeña hija. Al ser madre soltera ha iniciado con su negocio con la intención de buscar un futuro mejor para ella y su hija, que pueda tener dinero suficiente y una estabilidad económica con la cual pueda dar un mejor estilo de vida, pueda seguir estudiando completando su formación universitaria y a la vez poder pagar los estudios a su hija. Su actividad favorita es jugar con su niña.

Damaris es una de los miembros del grupo Fe y Amor 5, cada uno de ellos días a días realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Santiago, la segunda ciudad más grande de Republica Dominicana, donde el comercio, grandes industrias y el sector de ganadería y agricultura, son las principales fuentes de trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.


Damaris inicio su negocio de venta de ropa por encargo, de modo ambulante visitaba clientes y preguntaba que necesitaban, luego iba y les compraba, en la actualidad ha podido gracias a los prestamos poder tener mayor mercancías y poder comprar para ella revender a mas clientes, ahora llega con productos, y puede mostrarlos. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en la compra de pantalones jeans de hombre y mujeres; y sus ganancias serán usadas para ahorrar y poder suplir su negocio en algún momento que sea necesario y le falte capital, ya que también con sus clientes más fieles suele venderles a crédito. Gracias por su apoyo, en nombre del grupo Fe y amor.
texts.en:
Damaris’ family is composed of herself and her young daughter.  Being a single mother, she started her business seeking a better future for herself and her daughter, to have enough income and economic stability that will lead to a better living standard, to continue going to the university as well as afford her daughter’s schooling costs.  Her favorite activity is playing with her daughter.

Damaris is a member of the “Fe y Amor 5” (Faith & Love 5) group.  Each one of them daily carries out business activities in the city of Santiago, the Dominican Republic’s second largest city, where commerce, large industry, cattle raising and agriculture are the main sources of employment.  They mostly sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics and food, among other miscellaneous products.

Damaris started her business selling clothes on order door to door; she visited customers asking what they needed, and then she’d go buy it.  Thanks to loans she’s been able to have more merchandise and be able to buy to resell to more customers.  Now she arrives with goods to show.  This new loan will be used to buy jeans for men and women.  Profits will be saved and also used to stock the business whenever necessary and when she lacks capital since she tends to sell to her most reliable customers on credit.  

Thanks for your support in the name of the Fe y Amor group.

loans.use: To buy jeans.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Don Jesús, de 52 años, casado con 5 hijos  a su cargo, es comerciante, originario del departamento de Estelí. A duras penas logro terminar la primaria pues su situación económica lo obligo a dejar  a temprana edad sus estudios. Inicio en una empacadora, localizada en el costado sur del hospital de Estelí, su primer trabajo fue  como vendedor de pan  ahí  duro 3 años. Luego tomo la iniciativa de poner su propio negocio empezó a trabajar  solo , con créditos  que le otorgaron diferentes  micro financieras llegando  obtener  una línea de crédito de hasta C$3,000.00(Tres Mil Córdobas Netos). En l actualidad se dedica  a vender  pan, ya que es un producto masivo y le ha ido muy bien pues desde muy joven ha conocido este negocio.  
Esta  solicitando el crédito para capital de trabajo, necesita invertirlo en compra de materia prima , y  de nuevos producto como  la rosquilla somoteña ya que este  producto tiene gran demanda entre su clientela.
Su próxima meta es hacer  crecer  el  negocio, tener su propio capital de trabajo, darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos  y mejorar  la infraestructura de su vivienda,teniendo estabilidad economica atraves de su negocio.
texts.en:
52 year old Don Jesús is married and has 5 children to care for. He is a merchant and a native of the city of Estelí. Although it was a hard struggle, he was able to finish elementary school. However, his economic situation meant that he left school at an early age. He began working in a packing plant to the south of Estelí hospital. His first job was selling bread there, which he did for 3 years. Later, he took the initiative to start his own business and began to work for himself, using loans from various micro-finances institutions he had a line of credit up to $3,000 net (in Córdobas). He currently sells bread as it is an always-needed product and he is doing very well because he has understood this business since he was very young.
He is requesting a loan for working capital. He needs to buy raw materials and new products such as a type of donut that is in great demand by his customers. 
His next goal is to grow his business and have his own business capital so he can give his children a better standard of living and improve their home. He hopes his business will bring them economic stability.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and new food products

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La Srita. Marisol, es enfermera de profesión, pero ella se ha especializado en enfermedades de personas con discapacidad, como embolias, parálisis  temporal entre otros , pero como ella da servicio a domicilio  porque la contratan por temporadas, a ella le hacen falta  varios aparatos que requiere para dar una terapia mas profesional a sus pacientes, y dice que al tener estos aparatos, siente que va a dar un mejor servicio, y la van a recomendar mas las personas que ya han estado trabajando con ella  y le han confiado el cuidado de sus seres queridos, por lo que ella se siente muy afortunada como enfermera de hacer este tipo de trabajos, es por eso que le pagan honorarios por el cuidado del paciente y a pesar de que ya a adquirido algunos aparatos ella quiere estar  siempre actualizada, ya que su profesión  la hace ser mas humana.
texts.en: Marisol is a nurse buy profession, but she has specialized in treating people with disabilities such as strokes and temporary paralysis, among others. She works from home, and also does seasonal contract work, and she does not have all the equipment that she needs to offer her patients the most professional therapy. She says that, if she had this equipment, she would be able to provide better service, and most of the people who have worked with her would recommend her to their loved ones. She feels very fortunate to work as a nurse, and this is why people pay for her work. Although she has already bought some equipment, she wants to always be updating. Her profession makes her feel more human.

loans.use: To buy physical therapy equipment

loans.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Diana es socia y una D. las 9 integrantes D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Luz D. san Antonio”, es conviviente y tiene 3  niños dependientes. Se hizo partícipe mediante L. convocatoria  D. una D. las socias que organizo al grupo. Diana se dedica hace 2 años  a L. venta  D. comida rápida como: salchipapas,  alitas D. pollo fritas y hamburguesas, debido a L. necesidad D. aportar en  los gastos D. su familia y como apoyo a su conyugue. Hasta L. fecha ha logrado adquirir algunos electrodomésticos para mejorar su calidad D. vida  y asume mensualmente el pago D. algunos servicios básicos en su hogar, nos manifiesta que si tuviera más capital lo invertiría en L. compra D. prendas D. vestir para niños y adultos para comercializar y obtener más ingresos. El préstamo que obtuvo esta vez será invertido en L. compra D. pollo, papas y algunos útiles escolares que necesitan sus hijos. Diana y sus socias D. L. alcancía comunal Luz D. san Antonio son responsables y puntuales mes tras mes. En L. fotografía podemos apreciar a Diana acompañada D. su niña.
texts.en: Diana is one of the 9 members of the loan group "Luz D. San Antonio." She lives with her partner and has 3 dependent children. She became a member of the group at the invitation of one of the organizing members. For 3 years, Diana has had a business selling fast food such as salchipapas (a typical dish of sausage and potatoes), chicken wings, and burgers. She works to contribute to the household income and help her partner. To date, she has bought some domestic appliances that improve her quality of life and has taken on making the monthly payments for some of their utilities. She tells us that, if she had more capital to invest she would buy children's and adult's clothing to sell and make more income. She will use the loan that she is requesting now to buy chicken, potatoes, and some school supplies that her children need. Diana and her companions in the loan group Luz D. San Antonio are responsible and punctual month after month. We can see Diana in the photo with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy chicken, potatoes, and school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sodas, bread, cookies, donuts, butter, rice, beans, four, sugar, coffee, soups, chicken, spaghettis, chili,  chile, candy, mosquito repellant, veneno para mosquitos, matches, and candles.

loans.name: La Cosecha 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Bertha es la coordinadora del grupo La Cosecha 3 y 4, Grupo formado por 10 mujeres empresarias de la ciudad de Los Alcarrizos, ubicada al oeste de la provincia de Santo Domingo, siendo una de las comunidades mas pobladas y mas rurales de la capital de Republica Dominicana. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

La F. de Bertha esta compuesta por ella, su esposo y sus 3 hijos, todos comparten y viven bajo el mismo techo, de una casa humilde, en una zona de escasos recursos económicos y de servicios. Sus planes es poder tener una buena tapicería, con muchos clientes y que se puedan fabricar y vender muebles de todo tipo. Sus retos es poder educar a sus hijos y proveerles lo que necesiten para salir adelante.

Bertha se dedica a la tapicería, y a la reparación de muebles, gracias a sus conocimientos ha podido crear este negocio, un poco escaso en la zona en la que vive; desea ampliar sus servicios y fabricar muebles para vender a buen precio pero con buena calidad. Esta muy emocionada de recibir su segundo préstamo con Esperanza y con este va a invertirlo en la compra de telas, accesorios, madera y algunas herramientas que necesita para su negocio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y es un ejemplo para su F. y las demás mujeres en su grupo.
texts.en:
Bertha is the coordinator of the "La Cosecha 3 y 4" (The Harvest 3 and 4) group which is made up of 10 enterprising women from the city of Los Alcarrizos which is located in the east of Santo Domingo province.  It is one of the most populated and rural areas of the Domincan Republic's capital city.  The women mainly sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food and other miscellaneous products. 

Bertha's family consists of herself, her husband and her 3 children.  They all live under the same roof, in a humble house, in an area which is poor both in financial terms and in terms of services.  Bertha's plans are to own a good upholstery business with many customers, making and selling all kinds of furniture.  Her challenges are to educate her children and to provide them with what they need to get ahead in life.

Bertha works as an upholsterer and also repairs furniture.  Thanks to her knowledge, she has been able to create this business which is quite scarce in the area in which she lives.  She would like to expand her services and make good-quality furniture to sell at a good price.  She is very excited to be receiving her second loan from Esperanza and will invest the money in buying fabric, accessories, wood and some tools that she needs for her business.  She is a very hard-working woman and is an example for her family and the other women in her group.

loans.use: To buy fabric and accessories for upholstering furniture

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 62 años ,habita en el Espinal comunidad cercana al departamento de Estelí, es casado con tres hijos , se dedica a la siembra de granos, es agricultor. Comenzó sus actividades de siembra y ganadería con ayuda de su padre en la comunidad  el  Espinal a 20 kilómetros al sur de Estelí. Desde temprana edad se dedicaba ayudarle por las tardes a su papa arriar el ganado y  en las mañanas asistía a la escuela. Su primer cosecha  fue  a los 18 años donde sembró su propia parcela de granos básicos con la cual pudo comprar ganado, así permitiéndole mejorar su casa  y la ampliación de su propiedad.  Hoy en día se dedica  a la siembra de granos básicos y en épocas  bajas a la venta y compra de ganado. 
Solicita  el préstamo para completar 1  1/2 manzana de frijol de riego para comprar los insumos y fertilizantes, pues esto le será de gran ayuda  para el y su familia, ya que con el dinero se apoyara para la compra de semilla e insumos para garantizar mayores rendimientos  en sus  cosechas.
Sus planes futuros son que con la  inversión del frijol de riego  ya no tenga que comprarlo sino que ser el que se convierta en el  mayor abastecedor de su zona, bridarles un mejor futuro  a sus hijos atraves  de una buena educación profesional.
texts.en:
Juan is 62 years old. He lives in the community of Espinal, close to the department of Estelí. He is married with three children. He is a farmer and sows grain. He began growing crops and raising livestock with the help of his father in the community of Espinal, 20 km to the south of Estelí. From an early age, he helped his father bring down the cattle in the afternoons and in the mornings he went to school. He had his first harvest when he was 18, when he sowed his own parcel of grains and used the profits to buy cattle. In this way, he was able to improve his house and expand his land. Today, he grows grains and in the quite times he sells and buys cattle. 
He is requesting a loan to buy supplements and fertilizer to treat 1 1/2 parcels of irrigated beans. This will be of great help to him and his family as he will be able to buy seed and supplements to achieve higher crop yields.
His future plan is that the investment in bean irrigation will mean that he becomes one of the biggest suppliers in the area and no longer has to buy beans. The will enable him to offer his children a better future and a good professional education.

loans.use: To buy supplements and fertilizer to treat 1 1/2 parcels of irrigated beans

loans.name: Itzel Anaiht

texts.es: La Srita. Itzel Anaiht es una persona muy joven y  trabajadora ya que ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada que atiende los fines de semana ya que además  ella trabaja en una maquiladora por que ayuda a la economía de su casa ella  quiere adquirí mercancía puesto que  sus clientes  le  realizan pedidos.
texts.en:
Itzel Anaiht is a very young, hard working person who has a clothing business on weekends because she also works in an assembly plant to help with family expenses.

She wants to acquire merchandise because her customers have placed orders with her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy milk, soap, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, beans, lard, oil, margarine, chili sauce, flour, soft drinks, tomato sauce, pasta, soups, juices, spices, toothpaste and toilet paper.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea madre soltera mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, agricultora como planes mejora infraestructura de la vivienda para tener seguridad y protección. Inicio con  apoyo de la reforma agraria, se le presenta dificulta con las enfermedades y plagas. 
Tiene de proyecto la conservación de suelo y siembro de abono verdes para obtener mayores productos. El préstamo será utilizado en la compra insecticidas brindando el manejo de fito sanitario al cultivo.
texts.en:
Andrea is a single mother. She is an enterprising hardworking woman who works as a farmer. Andrea plans to improve the infrastructure of her home in order to provide greater security and protection. She started farming as a result of land reform. The main difficulties she faces are diseases and pests.

Andrea is undertaking a soil conservation project and will also apply green composts on her crops so that she can increase her productivity. This loan will be used to buy insecticides so that she can manage the health of her plants.

loans.use: Purchase insecticides

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Mr. Ramon is 41 years old; he is married and has two kids. He is a builder, and he performs plumbing work, carpentry and masonry in general.  He first began over 10 years ago, so he takes care of the supervision and execution of different jobs.

He requested this loan from the Foundation so he could buy shovels, buckets, hammers, nails, etc., to perform good quality work. These are items that  need renewal due to constant use.  Mr. Ramon thanks the Foundation and Kiva for the support and help given; because of that he can take more jobs and increase his income, thus improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: The buying of shovels, buckets, hammers, nails, etc.

loans.name: Giovannia Maria

texts.es:
Giovannia es una joven de 23 años de edad, casada, madre de un hijo. Su esposo labora como ejecutivo de cartera y cobro en una empresa privada. Siendo su negocio la venta de cosméticos, bisutería, manualidades teniendo cuatro años en las ventas, anteriormente laboraba en una tienda de manualidades, la cual cerró y se ha dedicado completamente al comercio.
Como objetivo es el mejoramiento de su vivienda el cual opto al financiamiento  para lograr esta mejora de un bajarete en frente de su casa, asi como la compra de puertas que están en mal estado.
Comprara materiales como: laminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, madera, a si como puerta lo que está contenta por la probación que Afodenic está otorgando atreves del crédito. El cual podrá equilibrar sus gastos y poder cumplir sus compromiso de pago.
texts.en:
Giovannia is a young woman who is 23 years of age. She is married and the mother of one child. Her husband works as a billing and collections manager for a private business. Giovannia has a business selling cosmetics, trinkets, and handicrafts that she started four years ago. She previously worked at a crafts store, but the store went out of business, so she decided to become a small businesswoman full-time.

One of Giovannia’s goals is to make improvements to her home, so she has opted to seek financing in order to build a veranda at the front of her house. She will also buy doors to replace the existing ones that are in bad condition, as well as construction materials such as sheets of zinc, beams, nails, and wood. Giovannia is happy that AFODENIC has extended this credit opportunity to her so that she can balance out her expenses while completing her payment obligations.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a veranda & new doors to replace the ones in bad condition

loans.name: Osmar Silvino

texts.en:
Mr. Osmar is 31 years old and he is currently single.  He lives with his parents and he owns an auto repair shop.

He first started thanks to his father, from whom he learned the profession. Nowadays he has all the necessary work elements for any type of auto repair or maintenance work.  Seeing the need for service improvement, he went to the Foundation for help.

He requested a loan to get a new air compressor, as the one he has is almost obsolete.  Osmar is very thankful to the Foundation for the given opportunity, which will help him improve the service that he gives and get some advantage over the competition.

loans.use: buying an air compressor

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Oscar, de 31 años de edad ,soltero ,con un hijo , es originario El Jícaro, comarca de Estelí , de oficio agricultor ,tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la siembra de hortalizas. Sus inicios fueron con la ayuda de sus hermanos  y cuñados  comenzaron a medias donde una parte era  de el y la compartía con sus hermanos. A los 14 años comenzó a sembrar a media con sus hermanos hasta los 25 año después el pudo sembrar su propia  parcela, tiene su casa propia producto de las ganancias . Debido a la situación económica solo pudo llegar hasta el tercer año de  secundaria y sus padres no tuvieron los  recursos para darle una mejor educación. Sus ventas  las realiza en la comunidad y en su hogar.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la siembra de tomate y cebolla comprando insumos que le permitan obtener un mejor rendimiento de su plantación. Además una vez finalizado el pago de su crédito ,desea invertir mas capital de trabajo en  su plantación de tomates , ya que es un producto perecedero y de consumo popular, obtener  mejores ganancias logrando sustentarse el, mejorar la calidad de vida su familia, su casa  y poder brindarle un buen futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Oscar, 31, is single and has a son.  He’s originally from El Jícaro, Estelí.  He’s a farmer.  He’s been growing vegetables for five years.  He started out with help from his brothers and brothers-in-law sharing equally where part was his and he shared it with his brothers.  At the age of 14 he started planting sharing with his brothers until he was 25.  Then he was able to plant his own parcel.  He now has a house of his own thanks to his profits.  Because of the economic situation he was only able to get to 9th grade because his parents did not have sufficient resources to give him a better education.  He makes his sales in his community and at home.

He is asking for a loan to invest in tomato and onion crops buying supplies that will make a better yield from his plants possible.  In addition, once he pays off the loan he wants to invest in more working capital for his tomato crops because this is a perishable item that’s very popular, obtaining better profits thus supporting himself, improving his family’s quality of live, his house, and provide his son with a better future.

loans.use: To buy supplies and pay for labor costs for tomato and onion farming.

loans.name: Guadalupe S J Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Guadalupe SJ. Está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla, en México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Mireya G. R., es la presidente del grupo, tiene 26 años, estudió una carrera técnica y no tiene hijos. La señora Mireya se dedica a la venta de zapato por catálogo, inició hace 1 años. Sus clientes son de la comunidad. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmado y con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Solicita este crédito para la compra de zapatos ya que tiene pedidos pendientes por entregar. También espera que con este préstamo obtenga mejores ganancias y mayor clientela, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a su familia con los gastos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Guadalupe SJ” and located in the State of Puebla in Mexico. The group consists of ten members. Mireya G.R. is the president of the group. She is 26 years old, earned a technical degree, and has no children. Sra. Mireya sells shoes through a catalog and started her business a year ago. Her customers are from the community.

Upon submitting her loan request, Mireya was enthusiastic and eager to excel. She needs this loan to buy shoes since she has outstanding orders that are pending delivery. Mireya also hopes that this loan will improve her earnings and attract more customers so that she can have a better quality of life and support her family with the expenses.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Juan Pablo Ii Group

texts.en:
The women's committee "Juan Pablo II" was formed on August 13th, 2010.  With a lot of joint effort they are now on their 2nd loan cycle.  Besides the independent activity of each member of the group, they also have activities in which they work together, helping each other to reach the ultimate goal: to help their families.

Ms. Amelia L.'s story is touching. She sells milk and she says that through the loan given by the Foundation she was able to improve her business, living conditions and income.

She tells us that her business helped the economy of her family due to the fact that she is the only economic supporter of her household.  Ms. Amelia mentions that the activities that the Foundation helps them with are very important because this helps to develop their work capabilities and self-esteem.

loans.use: buying more milk for resale

loans.name: Kuñatai Group

texts.en:
The women's committee called "Kuñatai" was formed on June 21st, 2010.  With a lot of effort they are now in their 2nd loan cycle.  Besides their independent work, the group also has joint activities which they engage in to reach the ultimate goal of helping their individual families.

One of the most touching stories is that of Ms. Maria V. who owns a small general store.  She says that her business helped her family's economy and living conditions.  She is the only supporter of her household and she also has to provide an education to her kids so she says that there was a big change in her family's economy thanks to her business.

According to Ms. Maria, the activities carried out with the help of the Foundation are very important.  Thanks to those activities, all the members of the committee have been able to develop their work skills and self-esteem.

loans.use: buying goods for subsequent selling

loans.name: Virgen Maria Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed on January 27th, 2011.  With a lot of effort and hard work they are now on their 1st loan cycle.  Besides the independent activities each one of the members has, they also work together to built up investment capital so they can help their families.

Ms. Francisca R. who sells vegetables says that the loan helped her to improve her business, living conditions and income.  She says that her business helps her household economy (she is the only supporter of the household), and is enabling her to give an education to her kids.  Ms. Francisca says that the activities conducted with the Foundation are very important to the committee because they helped improve the committee's work skills and self-esteem.

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Las Santanitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LAS SANTANITAS, Esmeralda C. S. es integrante del grupo, esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Ella se dedica a la venta de chiles secos que inicio hcse 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de más chiles secos para incrementar su negocio. Al momento de solicitar este pestamo se siente satisfecha ya que le ayudará a su economía familiar. Ella estudio hasta la secundaria y tiene 3 hijas. Alejandra A. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 27 años, estudió hasta Bachillerato, es casada y tiene una hija. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para incrementar más su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Santanitas”, which is located in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. Esmeralda C. S. is a member of this group. She started selling dried chili peppers five years ago. Esmeralda is requesting a loan to buy more chili peppers to increase her business. When she applied for this loan, she felt satisfied because the funds would help her family financially. Esmeralda studied through high school and has three daughters.

Alejandra A. is the group president. She is 27 years old and earned her high school diploma. Alejandra is married and has one daughter. She started selling Mexican snacks three years ago. Alejandra is requesting a loan so that she can increase her business even more and provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase dried chili peppers

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia forma parte del banco comunal “Las pioneras del comendador” perteneciente a la ciudad de Pudahuel. 

Ella siempre se ha desempeñado en el rubro del comercio, siendo consejera de Avon, vendedora de ropa interior por catálogo y desde hace dos meses comenzó a vender aros, collares, pulseras y anillos que ella misma crea y hace. De esta manera tiene clientela que realiza pedidos de su artesanía a su gusto, en cuanto a diseños, colores y tamaños.
Los clientes de María Eugenia son los mismos del negocio de venta por catálogo y clientes particulares que van directo a su casa. Por lo que el horario de su negocio es flexible y relativo.

Ella compra sus materiales en Santiago, donde obtiene hilos, perlas, ganchos para hacer los aros. 

Con éste préstamo comprará mas materiales y pretende comprar una maquina de coser. 

María Eugenia vive con su familia, tiene 3 hijos de  26, 20 y 16 años de edad, su hija menor la ayuda en la realización de su artesanía. Su esposo se encuentra con licencia médica (incapacitado temporalmente para trabajar) con reposo temporal debido a un estrés laboral. Es por esto su motivación de continuar su negocio y así aumentar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es comprarse una máquina bordadora y un vehiculo, ya que traslada su mercadería con un carro de mano.

Lo que más le gusta a María Eugenia de Fondo Esperanza es que dan la oportunidad de postular a un crédito, el cual ha servido para invertir en su negocio. Además del compañerismo del grupo y capacitaciones de la asesora de Fondo Esperanza.

Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is part of the “Las Pioneras del Comendador” (The Commander’s Pioneer Women) communal bank in the city of Pudahuel.
She has always been in commerce.  She has been an Avon consultant, has sold catalogue underwear, and for the last two months has started selling earrings, necklaces, bracelets and rings that she designs and makes herself.  Thus, her customers can order crafts according to their own taste, design, color and size requirements.  María Eugenia’s customers are the same ones from her catalogue sales and private customers that come direct to her house.  Because of this, her working schedule is flexible and relative.  She buys materials in Santiago where she obtains thread, pearls and hooks to make the hoops.  She will use this loan to buy more materials and she intends to also buy a sewing machine.

María Eugenia lives with her family.  She has three children who are 26, 20 and 16 years of age.  Her youngest daughter helps her with the crafts.  Her husband is on medical leave (temporarily incapacitated to work) on temporary rest due to work-related stress.  This is why she’s motivated to stay in business and increase her income.  Her dream is to purchase an embroidery machine and a vehicle since she currently transports her goods in a push cart.
